loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Hog-raising is a primary activity of Elvie, to help her husband in generating income. She is 41 years old and blessed with three children. Due to hardships of living, she and her husband aspire to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better living. 

With this regard, Elvie wants to improve her business in order to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. Through this loan, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 49 years old and married, with eight children, three of whom are in school. Josefa works very hard to provide for them.

Josefa's business and family home was destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Josefa has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Josefa has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Josefa is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Luthgarda

texts.en:
Luthgarda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been with Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) since 2013. She is now requesting a PHP 3,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Luthgarda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Luthgarda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 52 years old and married, with eight children. Five of her children are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Luzviminda runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Luzviminda has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mariche

texts.en:
Mariche is 25 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Mariche is taking out a housing loan, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Mariche has been a Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her business.

With your help, Mariche can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 42 years old and married, with four children, one of whom is in school. Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie's business and family home was destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Melanie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Melanie has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Melanie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old and a married mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Marissa has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa is 36 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Melisa and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Melisa is taking out a housing loan, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Melisa has been a Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Melisa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Matias

texts.es: Don Matías, tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, produce, maíz, frijoles y café. Actualmente el cultivo fuerte es el café, el cual lo vende despulpado en grano. Esta solicitando el séptimo ciclo de préstamo que es por 4,000 Lempiras para comprar bolsas de abono para asistencia al cultivo de café y mejorar la producción y ganancias. Su plan es ampliar la producción sembrando mas plantas de café y poder mejorar su estilo de vida con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Matías is sixty-two years old, married, has five children, and lives in a village in the Gracias Lempira municipality. He has made a living his entire life in agriculture, producing corn, beans and coffee. Currently, the dominant crop is coffee, which he sells by pulping the grain. 

He is asking for his seventh loan in the amount of 4,000 Lempiras to buy bags of fertilizer to help the coffee planting and improve production and earnings. His plan is to expand production by planting more coffee plants and to be able to improve his way of life with his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow coffee

loans.name: Rowen

texts.en:
This is Rowen, a 28-year-old married man with one child. He is engaged in selling different products in the community. Aside from his retail business, he is also busy with hog raising. Rowen is requesting a loan of Php 25,000 to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, noodles, candies and spices for his business. Rowen is known in the community as a hardworking person.

Rowen's only wish is to see his family have a better life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, noodles, candies and spices for his business

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 43 years old and married to Edgar. She has three children. She is very hardworking mother. She always checks her family's needs so that she knows what she needs to do. She manages a restaurant together with her husband. She is the one who handles the financial needs of the restaurant while her husband handles the customers' needs. To have additional capital, she borrowed money to buy meat, seasoning and spices for her business.

In the future, Noreen hopes that her business will expand so that she can give a better quality of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasoning and spices for her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: To generate income, Cristina runs a small eatery within her community. She is 44 years old and has three school-aged children. Due to the high cost of school fees, she aims to strengthen the business and make it more profitable in order to support the education of her children. She wants to prepare more kinds of recipes to sell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, Crisitina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy pork, dressed chicken, fish, vegetables, seasonings and other  needed ingredients to be cooked and sold in her eatery. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy pork, dressed chicken, fish, vegetables, seasonings and other needed ingredients

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 36, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Emmanuel, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Jennifer operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jennifer dreams that her variety store will someday become a grocery store and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Prima will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Prima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 54 years old. She is a married mother with nine children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Shirley has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Shirley has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 50 years old and single.

Elsie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elsie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elsie has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elsie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 57 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Teresa has a general store business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Teresa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 44 years old and married with five children.

Rosie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosie has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rosie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Uy's Group

texts.en: A villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Uy is a 25-year-old married mother blessed with two little kids. She counts solely on her single business, cassava farming, of which she has been involved with for seven years. Now, her current business generates her about 38,900 KHR per day. This is her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She is the leader of a group consisting of four members. The total amount of her entire group loan is 3,900,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees, and to purchase pesticides. She hopes to expand her farmland in a larger scale than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees, and to purchase pesticides

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 54 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su familia en casa propia, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y maicillo; sus productos son de muy buena calidad los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Jorge solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra como también mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jorge, 54, is very friendly and a hard worker. He lives with his family in his own home. He works very hard in his own plot of land where he grows corn and sorghum. His produce is of very high quality and he sells it in different markets that are close to his home. 

Jorge is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL in order to have the money needed to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizers and seeds, amongst other things, needed for sowing his crops. These products will also improve his land which is shown in the photograph. He is eager to increase his sales so that he can earn a higher income and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pest control, fertilizers, seeds and other supplies to improve his land.

loans.name: Ma'murjon

texts.ru: Маъмурчон 27-летний оператор базы данных-кассир, работающий в Микрокредитной депозитной организации. У него высшее бухгалтерское образование. Он женат и имеет годовалую дочь. Маъмурчон живет в районе Мастчох города Худжанд. У него есть младший брат, который учится в столице в первом курсе Таджикского Аграрного Университета. Сейчас семье Маъмурчона необходимо оплатить за годовое обучение его брата. Для этой цели Маъмурчон берет кредит. Он хочет, чтобы его брат тоже получил высшее образование. Так как он знает, что имея высшее образование можно найти хорошую перспективную работу.
texts.en: Ma'murjon is a 27-year-old cashier and database operator working for a microcredit deposit organization.  He has a college degree in accounting.  He is also married and the father of a one-year-old daughter.  He lives in the Maschoh district of the city of Khujand.  His younger brother is a first-year student at the Tajik Agrarian University located in Dushanbe.  The family now needs to pay his brother's annual tuition fees and this is the reason why Ma'murjon is taking a loan.  Ma'murjon wants his younger brother to also receive a higher education in order to have better job opportunities one day.

loans.use: to pay for his younger brother's annual college tuition fees.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
Todas las integrantes del grupo San Agustin lucha y son incentivadas para mejorar sus ingresos para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona quien mediante el esfuerzo, ganas de crecimiento y lucha constante y por medio de las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella busca  mejorar su situación de pobreza,  está consciente se encuentra mejorando su vida. Ella se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallina, patos, pollitos y demás, lo que le permite ayudar a sus seres queridos como lo viene haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales, lo que le ayudará a seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
All of the women in the "San Agustin" group are highly motivated and struggle to increase their incomes in order to provide a better quality of life for their families. 

Ramona, one of the group's members,  is a successful woman, thanks to her hard work, desire for growth, constant effort, and her good behavior. She is looking to raise her family out of povery and, through her work, is aware that she is improving their lives. She makes a living raising farm animals, such as chickens, ducks, chicks, etc., which allows her to help her loved ones. 

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy animal feed, which will allow her to keep working and fighting to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Jeraldine

texts.en: Jeraldine lives in Tagudalo Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has been a farmer for five years, planting and harvesting corn for a living. With her income from farming, her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm. In the future, she hopes to purchase a hectare of land for vegetable production and thereby earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Manelyn

texts.en: Manelyn is a responsible housewife who supported her husband in gaining income. They are currently residing in a rural community and earn their living through farming. They are engaged in planting rice, raising fingerlings and hogs for sale. They aim to improve their business and increase their income in order to satisfy their necessities and save some for the education of their children. Having inadequate capital, Manelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional fingerlings, feeds and piglets to raise. She hopes that she will obtain her loan to be able for her to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy additional fingerlings, feeds and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Lisonia

texts.en: Lisonia has been a farmer for many years. She used her previous loan to purchase farm fertilizers to elevate production and to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. With her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loan and built another business, raising pigs to sell commercially. She took a new loan recently to buy more piglets and feeds. Lisonia expects to earn enough to eventually purchase more farmland to manage.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en: Julito has been earning income with his farming activities. He has a piggery business and has been three years in operating it. He earns well from this, which aside from farming, is his main source of income. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy feeds and piglets. In the future, he wants to sustain his business and wants to save his profit to use it for a better future with his own family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Sreypech's Group

texts.en:
Sreypech is 32 years old and a citizen from the Dambae district in the province of Kampong Cham. She is married and blessed with one little kid who is still under the school age. To struggle for a living, she is growing cassava for income, which she has done for 14 years. 

This is the second loan cycle for Sreypech and the first loan cycle for her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan, and the support has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle progressively. For this cycle, she is seeking loan for 1,600,000 KHR and her joint-borrower is applying loan for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Sreypech will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, labor, harvesting fees, fertilizer and insecticide. She highly hopes to expand her farmland on larger scale than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor, harvesting fees, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy production supplies.

loans.name: Jenny Julieta

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Jenny, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 

La socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria,la socia lleva buen con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma sacar adelanté a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the communal bank “Senor de los Temblores II” in the city of Cusco, Peru.

She continues to sell food door-to-door. She enjoys her job, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work every day. Jenny is very responsible and ambitious. She hopes to continue working this way to support her family.

Jenny is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as oil and rice, among other things.  She is very thankful for the granted loan and promises to meet her established payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as oil, rice and other things.

loans.name: Nasly Rosa

texts.es: Nasly de 43 años de edad, habita en un sitio muy cercano al mar, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijas en las edades de 15 y 29 años. Desde hace 3 años, inició un negocio mediante el cual ofrece mercancía alusiva a la temporada.  Su idea empresarial inició siguiendo su propia inclinación, y porque su amiga la recomendó para vender productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos.  Hoy sus ventas las realiza a crédito todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, comprando a los proveedores en el centro de la ciudad mediante crédito y contado. Sus principales cliente, son sus amigos y familiares, y su meta empresarial es la de incrementar sus ventas en cada temporada, para genera utilidades, con el fin de que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios. Su principal desafío es sostener la fidelidad de su clientela para permanecer en el mercado.  En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará cremas, perfumes, cosméticos etc. Con esta inversión tendrá la mercancía apropiada a la demanda venidera, haciendo así que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Nasly, age 43, lives in a place very close to the sea.  She lives with her husband and their two daughters, ages 15 and 29.  Three years ago she started her business of selling seasonal merchandise.  

Her business idea started by following her own inclinations and because her friend recommended that she sells products through specialized guides or catalogs.  She now makes her sales on credit every day from eight in the morning until eight at night.  She buys on credit and for cash from the providers in the center of the city.  Her main customers are her friends and relatives.  Her business goal is to increase her sales each season in order to generate profits.  She will do this so that her children can finish their education.

Her main challenge is keeping loyal customers in order to stay in the market.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan in order to buy creams, perfumes, and cosmetics, etc.  With this investment she will have the appropriate merchandise for future demand.  By doing this, her Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, and cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Thun, 51, lives in a village of Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province. Thun is married to a local man who is a policeman in the region, and together they have been blessed with five children who are living with them under the same roof. 

Thun has been busy with taking care of her family and agricultural activities, primarily growing and harvesting rice for sale. She has been in this field for more than 30 years and earns a decent income for her family. 

She is taking out this loan to add to her existing capital in order to buy a piece of farmland. Through patience, hard work, and the loan, Thun believes that they will be able to improve her farming business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Laiheang

texts.en:
Laiheang has just finished her second year at an accounting institute in Phnom Penh and will soon start her third year. In Cambodia, bachelor degree studies consist of four years that are divided into two semesters each. Students can pay school fees yearly or by the semester depending on the school or university policy.

She wants to continue her studies so that’s why she has decided to ask for a loan to pay her upcoming school fees. 

Laiheang lives with her sister and widowed mother in a suburb of Phnom Penh, and she is also a part time English teacher for a private English school.  She will graduate in 2015.

The photo is of Laiheang.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es: Un gran sueño de tener una vivienda propia es lo que ha alimentado al señor Jesús toda la vida quien ha laborado en negocios siempre relacionados con la atención al cliente como bares, restaurantes entro otros, empezando como mesero y progresando hasta ser el administrador pero trabajando en estos negocios identifico que su sueño de la casa propia se hacía más lejano por esta razón decidió montar su propio establecimiento una cafetería la cual atiende todos los días, solicita le crédito para la compra de una vitrina para re-acomodar la exhibición de productos como postres, tortas, leches entre otras y lograr tener un mayor impacto visual hacia los clientes logrando captar su atención para tener una posible venta de estos. Gracias a este negocio el señor Jesús ve cada vez más cerca su posibilidad de adquirir su vivienda propia para vivir tranquilamente con su hijo de 19 años de edad por quien está dispuesto a luchar y trabajar hasta el último suspiro de su vida
texts.en:
A large dream of having his own home is what has fueled Jesus all his life. He has always worked in businesses that related to attention to customers' needs such as bars and restaurants, among others. He started as a waiter and worked his way up to manager but realized that while working these jobs his dream of having his own home kept getting further away. For this reason, he decided to open his own cafe where he works every day.

He is requesting a loan to buy a display case to rearrange the display of his goods such as deserts, cakes and other products so that the products can have a greater visual impact on his customers. By adding the display case, he will be able to capture his customer’s attention and increase the possibility of selling these displayed products. 

Thanks to this business, Jesus is everyday closer to his dream of buying his own home where he can live peacefully with his 19 year old son, a dream that he is willing to fight and work for until the last breath of his life.

loans.use: to sell his desserts, cakes and other goods and display them in a tasty way

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is 57 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

She has a gasoline retail business in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. 

Presentacion requested a 27,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more gasoline to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 32 years old, married, and a loving mother of two children. She did not have the opportunity to go to school, so she started her career as a rice farmer in Kampong Cham province. 

Hoeurn has worked in agriculture since she was 10 years old. At first, she worked with her parents. Once she was married, she continued working and helping her husband. She does her farming work on a schedule of 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and rice seed. She strongly hopes that her family’s income will increase gradually to improve their standard of living. 

Hoeurn expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and rice seed.

loans.name: Heling Patricia

texts.es: Heling Patricia mayor de edad madre soltera de un menor de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado al norte del occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productiva, ganadera, comercial, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de ropa usada y venta de tortillas negocio el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, inicia su negocio como un medio de vivir para sacar adelante a su pequeño bebe, ya que sus ingresos no cubrían sus gastos, hoy en día tiene cuatro años de tener estos dos negocios, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de otro país tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, sus ventas son al contado, uno de sus sueños es poder ver crecer su negocio y que su hijo pueda tener una mejor educación y ser un profesional, Heling se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable con muchos deseos de superación ha logrado sacar a delante a su hijo a pesar de ser madre Soltera, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasar mucho tiempo con su pequeño hijo saliendo a recrearse en el parque. Heling esta solicitando financiamiento para surtir su inventario de ropa usada y compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas.-
texts.en:
Heling Patricia, an adult and single mother to a minor, is originally from one of the towns of Chinandega, located in the north-west part of the country, a zone known for production, ranching and commercial business.  She is a micro-business entrepreneur who buys used clothing and sells tortillas.  Her business is located in her home.  She started her business as a way of life to get a heard for her small child, since her income does not cover his expenses.

Nowadays she has had these two businesses for four years.  She makes her purchases in cash in markets from another country.  She has regular and perspective customers and her purchases are in cash.  One of her dreams is to se her business grow and for her son to have a better education and become a professional.  

Heling is known for being an enterprising woman, responsible and full of a lot desire to overcome challenges.  She has managed to get out ahead for her son despite being a single mother.

In her free time she loves to spend it with her small son, going out and enjoying the park.

Heling is requesting financing to stock her inventor of used clothing and to buy ingredients to make tortillas.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, corn, firewood, among other items.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en: Zeynab is a 52-year-old woman, married and the mother of two children. Both of her children are married. Zeynab and her husband are IDP’s (Internally Displaced Persons) from Zangilan city and now live in the Baku region. Zeynab rents a shop, where she sells women's clothing like pants, blouses, dresses, etc. She has been in this business for 16 years. Today Zeynab is planning to increase her business. Now is spring-summer season and Zeynab needs 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy new seasonal clothes. Therefore she has applied to Komak company. Zeynab is thankful for the aid of Kiva organization and lenders. In the future she wants to buy a store to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy new seasonal clothes

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Norma, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” ,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Norma  tiene 34 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de imprenta, la socia lleva buen con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma sacar adelanté a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles, tintes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is Norma. She is part of the "Señor de los Temblores II" communal bank, located in the Cusco district, of Cusco province and Cusco department.

Norma is 34 years old; she is married and has three children. Norma looks after the home and has a printing business. Her work is going well thanks to her daily determination. Norma is responsible and determined; she wants to continue working in order to help her family to prosper.

Norma is applying for a loan in order to buy paper, ink and more.

Norma is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink and more.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is an industrious woman who is involved in tailoring clothes and providing sewing services to generate income. She and her husband a joint business in Phnom Penh by renting a space for their business in a public gathering area. She sews all kind of clothes as required by her customers. She has been doing this for more than 2 years and earns additional income from rice husbandry.
 
Chanthy currently needs a loan, which will be used to buy a plot of farm land to expand her farming business. This way she can increase production and make a better income for her family. Chanthy awaits your kindness and hopes for your loan support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farm land to expand her farming business.

loans.name: Aby

texts.en: Aby, 35 years old and married with two children. She earns a living buying and selling rice, cantaloupe, watermelon, cucumbers and other produce cultivated in the area where she lives. She is going to use this new loan to buy rice, cantaloupe and watermelon.  Her dream is to own a larger truck so that she can bring her products to other cities.

loans.use: to buy rice, cantaloupe and watermelon

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is 50 years old, married, but has no children. They live in a rural community managing a small variety store. He and his wife aim to become successful and financially stable in order to have a bright future. Therefore, he plans to improve his business by increasing his product offerings. Having inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP10,000.00 to buy more stocks of snack foods, noodles, canned goods, assorted biscuits, beverages, soft drinks and seasonings to resell. Through this loan, he believes that he will make improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, noodles, canned goods, assorted biscuits, beverages, soft drinks and seasonings to resell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a 29-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be visionary and productive. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are tea factories. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low tea prices. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to pay farm labor expenses. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a successful business lady.

loans.use: pay farm labor expenses

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 59-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as visionary and focused. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables and keeps cows which produce milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile and productive place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low prices. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy seedlings and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She describes herself to be diligent. 

Rachael operates a farm where she grows coffee, tea and bananas. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Her business goal is to be stable within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 47 años,  esta casado, trabaja en la agricultura, debido a la situación económica que vivió junto a sus padres no le permitió sacar una carrera profesional, por la situación económica no ha podido darle a sus hijos una educación mas avanzada ya que solo los ha podido dar un estudio hasta séptimo grado.

Daniel se dedica a la agricultura, siempre le ha gustado ese trabajo, lo hace junto a sus hijos y su esposa, son muy unidos y se apoyan mutuamente, se levantan muy temprano para ir al campo a trabajar.

Con el préstamo pretende comprar una cocina para vender pupusas, y todo lo necesario para este trabajo ya que será una herramienta para obtener mas recursos para seguir adelante junto a su familia.
El sueño de Daniel es que sus 3 hijos que aun están con él  no vivan solo de la agricultura si no que aprendan otro trabajo que les ayude a obtener mas recursos económicos y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Daniel is 47 years old, married and works in farming. Due to his and his parents' financial situation, Daniel was unable to go to university. Daniel has also been unable to offer his children schooling further than seventh grade, again because of his financial situation.

Daniel works in farming and has always enjoyed it. He works alongside his wife and children, and the family is very close and everyone helps each other out. They all wake up very early to head out to work in the fields.

Daniel intends to use this loan in order to buy a cooker and everything else necessary for preparing "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). This work would allow Daniel to earn more to get ahead with his family.

Daniel's dream is for his three children not to live off farming but rather for them to learn another trade that allows them to earn a higher income and to prosper.

loans.use: to buy a cooker and everything else necessary for preparing "pupusas".

loans.name: Gwenda

texts.en:
Gwenda is 31 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Gwenda works very hard to provide for them.

Gwenda's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Gwenda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Gwenda has taken a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Gwenda is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a divorced woman with one school age child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years she has operated a retail business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She also prepares sweets dumplings and sells them in her retail shop.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos tiene 19 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Carlos es un joven emprendedor quien desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de panadería y actualmente es lo que le permite ganarse la vida y apoyar a su familia con los gastos económicos del hogar. Carlos es muy conocido en su comunidad como un joven trabajador y sobre todo responsable. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y ladrillo de piso para cambiar las condiciones del piso de la vivienda que actualmente es de tierra.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 19, lives in his own house with his family.  Carlos is an enterprising young man who learned the bakery trade when he was very young.  This is currently what allows him to earn a living and help his family with the household expenses.  Carlos is very well-known in his community as a hardworking young man.  Most of all he is knowing for being responsible.

In order to improve his living conditions and those of his family, he has made the decisions to request this loan from FUSAI.  He will use the loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks for the floor.  He will do this in order to change the floor of his house, which is currently a dirt floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks to change the dirt floor in his house.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be idealistic. She operates a farm where she grows tea, cabbages and keeps pigs. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of adequate capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more fertilizer and animal feed. Her business goal is to be stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will benefit from the loan. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more fertilizer and animal feed

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya is married with one school-going child. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Asya has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Asya is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Martha tiene 37 años de edad, es ama de casa culmino sus estudios hasta 9° es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 12 años a quien a logrado sacar adelante sola y con mucho esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza de catalogo de algunas revistas, ademas tiene una venta de joyeria que distribuye a sus clientes por todo el caserio.

 Martha es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora e independiente, el dia jueves ella compra leche de vaca y elabora queso fresco y sale a entregar pedidos a sus clientes.
El prestamo lo invertira en la compra de mercaderia y ropa para seguirla distribuyendo a sus clientes.
 Martha esta muy satisfecha porque le han dado la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio.
su sueño mas grande es el estudio universitario a su hijo para que sea un profesional.
texts.en: Martha is 37 years old and is a housewife. She went to school up until the 9th grade. She is a single mother with a son who is 12 years old, who she has been able to raise alone and with a lot of effort. She works selling beauty products through the catalogs of some magazines. She also sells jewelry that she distributes to her customers around her village. Martha is a very enterprising woman, hardworking and independent. On Thursdays she buys cow milk and makes fresh cheese and she goes to deliver orders to her customers. She will invest the loan in buying merchandise and clothing to keep distributing to her customers. Martha is very satisfied for the opportunity she has been given to make her business grow. Her biggest dream is that her son studies in college and becomes a professional.

loans.use: to invest more in her clothing sales.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 49-year-old lady, living along with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
The financial condition of her family is not good; her husband has grown old, even in his old age he is running a scrap business. He is a hawker and purchases scrap iron, plastic, waste papers etc door to door. He uses his four wheel cart to carry the goods from one place to another. One day his cart got damaged due to loading and unloading, so that he wants to repair it and change its tires, but he does not have sufficient savings to do so.
Hameedan has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to repair his four wheel cart and can buy additional scrap goods to continue his business. 
Hameedan hopes that through the profits earned she will make more savings to meet any sudden incidents in future.

loans.use: For the maintenance of four wheel cart and to buy additional scrap goods for reselling.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 26-year-old married woman who has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows cabbages and carrots. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate labor.

Ann will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of adequate capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more seedlings. Her business goal is to be stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will benefit from the loan. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more seedlings

loans.name: Utupo

texts.en:
Utupo is a 50-year-old married man with four children. He works in New Zealand as a seasonal worker, picking kiwi fruit to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years. Utupo has requested a loan to purchase air tickets, visa, clothing, and some pocket money to be used in New Zealand.

He became a member of SPBD in 2014. With his earnings, he hopes to improve his family lifestyle and help his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase air tickets, visa, clothing, and to have pocket money.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en:
Jacklyne is a very hard-working woman who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be much more successful. She is a married woman with two school going children.

Jacklyne has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer), a business which she has run for one year. 

She needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason she is requesting a loan through Yehu, to invest in additional floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

loans.use: to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en: Elnora appreciates her previous Kiva loan that enabled her to earn more money selling vegetables. An increase in sales improved her living conditions. She is now requesting a 50,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy more of these vegetables to sell. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 44-year-old married woman with three children who describes herself as visionary and hardworking. For the past ten years she has farmed tea and cabbages. Her land is located in a fertile and productive area, and she primarily sells her produce to individuals and tea factories. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low prices.

Nancy is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through SMEP to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs. Her goal is to see her farm become ever more productive and herself more prosperous.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 45-year-old mother of four children, living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits, and other items. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason it is doing well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot. However, he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. Therefore, Zubaida requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

Zubaida thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for a general store (wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.).

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is one of the four members of this loan group which is applying for a 105,000 PKR loan through Brac Pakistan. She is 45 and the mother of six sons and a daughter. Her husband owns a shop where he builds wooden furniture such as sofas, tables and beds. He has been making furniture for many years and has been teaching his craft to his sons as well.

One of Azra’s sons has become a fine carpenter and has the skill and business sense to open his own shop. To do so he needs to buy tools and furniture-making materials, so his mother will be applying her share of the group’s 105,000 PKR loan toward that end.

Azra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To set up her son's furniture-making shop.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es: Margoth tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, hijo de 17 años de edad y su hija de 12 años de edad. Margoth se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan. Tiene mucho tiempo de contar con este negocio y es así como junto a su compañero de vida se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Margoth solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios (tela metálica, hierro, arena, cemento, grava, etc.) para construir un cerco perimetral en su terreno y así poder proteger sus pocas pertenencias y a su querida familia.
texts.en:
Margoth is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, 17-year-old son and 12-year-old daughter. Margoth makes a living by making and selling bread. She has had this business for a long time and this is how her and her life partner make a living and provide for their livelihood. 

Margoth requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of the materials necessary (wire mesh, iron, sand, cement, gravel, etc.) to construct a fence around the perimeter of her property and in this way protect her few possessions and her dear family.

loans.use: to buy wire mesh, iron, sand, cement, gravel, etc. to build a fence around the perimeter of her home

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with three children who are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling second hand clothes for both men and women door-to-door. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Mwanasiti is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to reinvest in her coffee plantings

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано 43-летняя жительница города Душанбе, которая занимается швейным делом. У нее большой стаж работы швеи. Она 10 лет как занимается шитьем. Впервые она научилась этому делу на швейной фабрике. В данный момент Рано занимается пошивом женских платьев отдельно у себя дома. Старшая дочь помогает матери в деятельности. Рано замужем за предпринимателя и у них пятеро детей. Сейчас главной целью Рано является расширение деятельности. Она просит кредит, чтобы закупить еще одну швейную машинку.
texts.en: Rano is 43 years old and she lives in the city of Dushanbe where she works as a seamstress.  She has been in the same business for the past 10 years and she has a lot of experience in her field.  She learned her craft while working in a clothing factory.  Rano is now self-employed and she sews women's dresses from home.  Her oldest daughter helps her to run the business.  Rano is married to an entrepreneur and they have five children.  Her main goal is now to expand her activity.  She is taking a loan in order to buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and threads for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rose has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past 10 years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be visionary and focused. She operates a farm where she grows cabbages. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fertile and productive place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy seedlings and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 46-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children.

Her son is a turner by profession. He works on a lathe machine, manufacturing and renewing spare parts for vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of the engines, and renews the turbines and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and now his business is much settled. Due to continuously working on the lathe machine, some important spare parts have torn off and urgently need to be replaced. Without replacement of these parts, it highly affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine. Her son is a poor and responsible father of his own family who does not have sufficient funds to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools. Therefore, Nusrat has requested a Kiva loan for her son so he can buy spare parts for his lathe machine. 

Nusrat hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of a lathe machine.

loans.name: Kibiriyo

texts.ru: Кибириё деятельная женщина и планирует начать свой бизнес в области животноводства. Она живет в районе Шахритус, где сам климат благоприятствует ведению этой деятельности. Кибириё 52 года. Она жена, мать и бабушка. Ее муж работает сторожем, а старший сын находится в России на заработках. Кибириё сама до этого времени нигде не работала. Она хочет открыть бизнес откорм-продажа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы обеспечить себя работой. Кибириё планирует содержать скот в доме у родственников, где имеется большой коровник. Муж будет помогать в новой деятельности жены. Кибириё просит кредит, на сумму которого собирается приобрести 4 голов крупнорогатого скота. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Kibiriyo is a very active 52-year-old woman who is planning to start a new business in the field of animal husbandry.  She lives in the Shahrituz district, whose climate is ideal for this type of activity.  She is a wife, a mother and a grandmother.  Her husband works as a watchman and her oldest son is currently working in Russia.  Kibiriyo herself had never worked until now.  She wants to start her own animal husbandry business in order to support herself.  She plans to keep her cattle in a large barn owned by some of her relatives.  Her husband is also planning to help her with this new business.  Kibiriyo is taking a loan to buy four head of cattle.  She is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy four head of cattle to start a new animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field. Her husband helps her by purchasing stock from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years.
 
She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

Azra thanks Kiva, Kiva lenders and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to sell

loans.name: Ghafooran

texts.en:
Ghafooran has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but most of the savings are spent over household expenses. Now she wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for him but she does not have enough money to buy it.
 
Therefore, Ghafooran has requested a loan so that she can buy a new rickshaw for her son with the contribution of savings. She hopes that her son will drive the auto rickshaw with full devotion and earn sufficient income.

Ghafooran is a 57-year-old woman, living with her nine children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She thanks Kiva and it's field partner, brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: para compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir un nueva plantación de café recién cultivada

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es: El señor Amadeo tiene 61 años, casado  tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 16, 13, 7 y 6 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior el vende media deportivas y calcetines, el tiene su puesto de venta en la ceja de la ciudad de El Alto, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Amadeo,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa al por mayor  y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, el señor Amadeo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Amadeo is 61 years old, married, and has four children aged 16, 13, 7 and 6. His wife sells underwear, and he sells sportswear and footwear. He has a stall in La Ceja, a part of the town of El Alto. 

The loan is his first with the institution, and Amadeo plans to use it to buy clothing at wholesale prices as stock for his stall. He wishes to increase the amount of merchandise he has for sale. One of the challenges he faces is competition. He is going to use any profits he earns to buy more items and in this way generate more income. 

He is happy and grateful for this opportunity to grow his business, improve his income and the standard of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: Buy more clothing

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is from the village of Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur. She is married and has four children. To make a living, Luz owns and operates a farm. She has a general store in their village where she earns an additional income. 

In 2007, Luz joined GDMPC and she gained access to financial services. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio has been cultivating rice for many years for a living. He has eight children, and some of them already have their own family. With his generated income from farming, his previous loan used for the farm was successfully repaid. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer in order to improve the farm.
 
He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is Ruth, 38 years old, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Andy, her business partner, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for her everyday expenses.

Ruth operates a repacking business. She buys different products from wholesalers, repacks them, and sells them at a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy different products such as peppers, misua (salted chinese noodles), crackers, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products for repacking.

Ruth hopes to have more products to be added to her existing products. She dreams of having a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for peppers, misua, crackers, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products for repacking.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 50-year-old divorced woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be honest and focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and keeps cows that produce milk. She has been involved in this business for 25 years. Her business is located in a busy and productive place and her primary customers are of all types. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy a cow. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to invest further in the business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a divorced woman who has been blessed with three school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

Mary has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

Besides the clothes selling business, she operates a salon business. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stocks of dryers, hair oils, shampoos, and extensions for her business. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dryers, hair oils, shampoos, and extensions for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en:
Ulfat is at the age of 32, living with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her elder son has been working in a mobile shop for seven years and earning sufficient income. He troubleshoots the mobile, sells the mobile accessories, such as charger, body, data cable, etc., and provides the recharge facilities of different networks. 

He has gotten good experience to run a mobile shop. He has built up very good relation with his regular customers. Nowadays, a lot of demand increases for accessories and for recharge, that sometimes he has to refuse his customers. Therefore, he wants to open his own mobile shop. But he does not have savings to invest into the business because he already has spent all his savings on household expenses.
 
Therefore, Ulfat requested a loan for her son so that he would be able to open a new mobile shop. Ulfat says thanks to Kiva and to it's field partner over this honorable support.

loans.use: to open new mobile shop for son.

loans.name: Edwin Alberto

texts.es: Edwin ha sido ha trabajado por más de 7 años en talleres de confección donde según el gracias a dios se topó con grandes jefes y personas que lo impulsan a mejorar cada día solo buscando el bien del empleado y no el de la empresa. Por esto con gran apoyo de su familia, amigas y el  ultimo jefe que tuvo quiere comenzar su propio taller de confección con la esperanza de que le vaya bien y sea un negocio rentable, para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de maquinaria como maquina plana, fileteadora, recubridora y una  máquina para cortar con la que iniciara el gran proyecto de ser un microempresario. Su gran sueño es darle las gracias pero con resultados a las personas que dieron un voto de confianza hacia él crecer como empresa consolidándose en este gran mundo de las confecciones como una empresa élite que compite por los mejores cliente para poder mantener a toda su familia y en un futuro darles un empleo para que ninguno de ellos aguante hambre
texts.en:
Edwin has worked for more than seven years making clothing. He is grateful to have encountered bosses and other people who encouraged him to seek work that would be good for him and not just the business. For this reason and with help from his family, friends, and his last boss, he wants to start his own workshop with the hope that it will do well and be a profitable business.

Edwin is seeking a loan to buy equipment such as sewing machines, serger, and other specialized machines in order to start his project of being a small business owner. He wishes to give thanks to those people who give him a vote of confidence and enable him to grow his business in the world of sewing. He wishes to have a top class business that competes for the best clients so that he can provide for his whole family and in the future provide them with a job so that no one goes hungry.

loans.use: Buy sewing machines and other specialized equipment so he can start a  sewing business

loans.name: Marcos Edil

texts.es: El señor Marcos tiene 33 años, casado  tiene dos hijos de las edades de  13 y 6 años, el se dedica a la venta de vidrios en su vidriería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona Carmen , este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Marcos,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de vidrios en cantidad  y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, el señor Marcos enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de el y de su familia, su deseo es tener una vidriería más grande y mucha clientela. En la foto el señor Marcos esta con su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcos is 33 years old, married, and has two children aged 13 and 6. He sells glass and his business is located in the Carmen neighbourhood. This loan is his second with the institution, and he plans to use it to buy a larger amount of glass as stock for his store. He wishes to increase the amount he has for sale.

One of the challenges Marcos faces is competition. He is going to use any profits he earns to buy more items and in this way generate more income. 

He is happy and grateful for this opportunity to grow his business, improve his income and the standard of living for himself and his family. His wish is to have a larger glass business with many customers.

He appears in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: Buy glass at wholesale prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, steel, a sander, and a vehicle part.

loans.name: Samphors' Group

texts.en: Samphors is a local farmer from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province where her rice cropping business is located. She is 27 years old and the mother of two little kids. Besides agribusiness, she can earn extra income via a grocery selling business. Samphors has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages with a successful repayment. Now, her living condition is getting better than before. For this cycle, she is the leader of a group consisting of two borrowers. She is applying for 1,400,000 KHR whereas her joint borrower is seeking for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to gain more yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Edison Fernando

texts.es: La historia de Edison es algo muy común que pasa en Medellín y por lo cual luchamos cada día pues es un problema que frena el progreso de los emprendedores ya que Edison era un empleado de una empresa de gases con la cual tuvo muy buen desempeño y rápidamente se iba convirtiendo en un hombre de confianza  pero la envidia de algunas personas freno su progreso hasta tal punto que salió de la empresa por amenazas, pero debido a su gran desempeño dicha empresa le propuso un negocio a Edison el cual era abrir un punto de distribución de sus productos, actividad que desempeña en la actualidad, solicita el crédito para la compra de activos cilindros de gas ya que en muchas ocasiones tiene que solicitar cilindros prestados y realizar mantenimiento a una moto que la empresa le presto y que ya tiene 4 años de funcionamiento su gran sueño es progresar, y demostrar que esta para grandes cosas que sin importar los problemas es un hombre que progresara sin importar lo que se le interponga en el camino
texts.en:
Edison' story is a very common one in Medellín, a problem that we struggle with every day and which checks the progress of local entrepreneurs. Edison used to be employed in a gas company, where he performed very well and quickly became a trusted member of staff. However, the jealousy of certain other employees prevented his further progress, and the situation deteriorated until he left the company due to threats. Thanks to Edison's great performance, the company proposed to him that he should open a distribution centre for their products, which business he is now developing.

He is seeking a loan in order to buy gas cylinders, which he currently often has to borrow, and to carry out maintenance on a motorbike which the company loans him, and is now four years old. His greatest dream is to continue to progress, and to show that he can do great things regardless of his problems, and that he is a man who will progress whatever is put in his way.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders and carry out maintenance on his motorbike.

loans.name: Yelen Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe YELEN est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le  prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits à l’image de SETOU qui est la femme assise devant  dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 15 pièces de pagnes, 25 mètres de bazin moins riche avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Yelen group is made up of four married women who are, on average, 39 years old and have five children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood in Bougouni. The group members know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

To reinforce their financial capacity so that they can better conduct their businesses, the group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their second loan. Their first loan was repaid correctly.

This group of women sells clothing, like Setou, who is the woman seated in front in the photo. With her loan, Setou plans to buy 15 lengths of pagne [brightly colored fabric] and 25 meters of damask fabric at a lower price from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales in a market and from home, for cash or credit, to a mixed group of customers.

Setou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 55,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Saint Jean Baptiste Group

texts.fr:
Mme DELPHINE est responsable du groupe SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE.  Elle se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère 05enfants. Le plus âgé 16ans et le moins âgé 10mois. 03 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la transformation (prépare et vend du dolo) depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de mil et 01 charrette de bois de chauffe.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et aider à scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Delphine is the leader of the Saint Jean Baptiste group. She is doing well. Married, she is a mother of five children. The eldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 10 months old. Three of the children go to school. 

Delphine has been making and then selling dolo [millet beer] for nine years.

She procures her goods from a local market. She would like to buy one sac of millet and a wagon of firewood.

Delphine would like to reinvest her earnings back into her business. One day she hopes to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy one sac of millet and one wagon of firewood

loans.name: Flor De La Canela Group
