texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento FLOR DE LA CANELA Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres que se dedican a  distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Filomena tiene 42 años y tres  hijos de las edades de 24, 20 y 16 años que se encuentran estudiando ya dos en la universidad y el ultimo en colegio,  ella se dedica a la venta de telas al por mayor y menor en su tienda que se encuentra por la populosa  zona de la 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de telas al por mayor para surtir su tienda, la señora Filomena es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y también agradecida por la ayuda a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The FLOR DE CANELA communal bank is comprised of eight members who are involved in different business activities.  The president of the group is Filomena who is 42 years old and has three children, ages 24, 20 and 16 who attend school and the university.  She sells wholesale and retail fabric in her shop which is located in the busy area of "16 de Julio" in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to buy wholesale fabric for her shop.  Filomena is a hard-working person who has been in this business for many years.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support she is receiving since this business is her only source of income for the family.  She is also grateful for the help to other members of her group because many of them are heads of household.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fabric for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa de 55 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, legalmente esta casada pero es madre soltera, su esposo la abandono hace 10 años aproximadamente, ella tiene tres hijos, de 35,34, 32 ya todos mayores de edad los tres trabajan pero ya tienen hogares aparte porque ya estan acompañados, con ella vive su madre y dos nietas de 14 y 7 años de edad. así que a su cargo están tres.

Rosa trabaja en un centro de bienestar infantil, ganando $60.00 al mes, ya tiene 12 años de dedicarse a eso ella decidió trabajar porque con lo poco que ganaba su esposo no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos de la casa, entonces ella decidió también aportar, pero luego que su esposo la abandono con mas esfuerzo ella lo hace por trabajar ahora que ella es madre soltera, a ella le sirve mucho lo poco que gana, el trabajo le queda a una hora caminando y su horario es de 7am a 4pm.

Rosa dice que si el préstamo le fuese otorgado ella quiere comprar lamina para el techo de su casa y comprar parte del tratamiento de su madre, ya que esta preocupada porque ya viene el invierno la lamina que actualmente tiene su casa no le sirve, ya esta rota la lamina.

Los sueños de Rosa son poder terminar su casa, ya que aun le falta mucho, dice tener la esperanza que poco a poco ella podrá lograrlo, se sentirá orgullosa por lograrlo, sueña con poder darles el estudio a sus nietas y que su madre mejore ya que esta bastante mayor y enferma.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55, has a ninth grade education.  She is legally married but lives as a single mother since her husband left her around ten years ago.  Her three children are 35, 34 and 32.  They are married and live and work independently.  Rosa's mother and two granddaughters, ages 14 and 7, live with and depend on her.

Rosa works in a child care center and earns $60.00 a month.  She has been working there for 12 years because what her husband earned was not enough to cover household expenses and she wanted to contribute something.  But when her husband left she had to work even harder as a single mother because she really needed the money.  She walks to work, an hour away, and her schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Rosa wants to use the loan to buy metal sheeting for the roof of her house and also to pay for part of her mother's treatment.  She is worried about the coming winter because the current sheeting on her roof is broken.

Her goal is to finish her house, because there is much left to be done.  She says she can do it little by little and will be proud of her accomplishment.  She wants to provide her granddaughters with an education and is hopeful her mother will get better since she is quite old and ill.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting for the roof of her house and to pay for part of her mother's treatment.

loans.name: Kelegnan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kelegnan est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce pagnes wax de meilleures qualités, du charbon de bois et de céréales. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Doussou (assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente de pagnes wax de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Doussou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Kelegnan group is made up of married women, who live with their husbands and children in monogamous families. They are, on average, 39 years old and have six children. They all live in Djalakorodji, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. They know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members all work in small-scale commerce selling quality wax pagnes [brightly colored fabric], charcoal, and cereals. In order to increase their business capital, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their second group loan.

Doussou, who is seated second from the right in the photo, has a good reputation when it comes to selling high quality wax pagnes. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 lengths of wax pagnes from the Grand Market. Resales will be made at a market and from traveling around to a group of customers who are mostly women.

With this loan, Doussou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes [brightly colored fabric]

loans.name: Yasmiry Estela

texts.es: Yasmiry es una mujer de 29 años de edad madre de dos hijos y que se dedica hace 7 años a la venta de productos por catálogo actividad que aprendió de una amiga y que le ayudo hacerse miembro y distribuir estos productos adicionalmente también vende minutos una mujer polifacética que no desperdicia ningún tiempo muerto y que ejerce las dos profesiones a la vez, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercancía en especial ropa para ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos que estos tenga varias opciones a la hora de adquirir un producto. Su gran sueño es poder tener un negocio rentable y que pueda brindarles educación techo y alimentación a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera y sin importar la condición ella no permitirá a que a sus dos hijos les llegue a faltar algo en la vida
texts.en:
Yasmiry, 29, has two children and she has been selling products by catalogue for seven years.  She learned the business from a friend who helped her become a member and distribute these products.  She also sells cell phone call service by the minute.  Yasmiry is a multi-faceted woman who does not waste a single moment and carries out two jobs at the same time.

The loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise, especially clothing, to offer her customers a wider range of products so they will have different options when making a purchase.

Her goal is to have a more profitable business and be able to put a roof over her children's heads and put food on the table.  She is a single mother but does not let that limit her ability to provide her children with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of merchandise, especially clothing.

loans.name: Las Caseritas Group

texts.es: Edgar de 48 años es casado con 03 hijos 01 de ellos en etapa escolar, actualmente pertenece a la grupo “Las Caseritas” constituida por 06 socios trabajadores que han demostrado ser personas responsables. Edgar se dedica a la venta compra y venta de vinos, negocio que le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y apoyar con los gastos de su familia. Así mismo esta implementado su negocio con la venta de abarrotes donde todo le va bien. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite y leche. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Las Caseritas” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Edgar se encuentra en la parte posterior de pie.
texts.en:
Edgar, 48, is married and has three children, one of whom is still school-aged.  He currently belongs to the "Las Caseritas" communal bank which is comprised of six hard-working members who have proven themselves to be responsible.  Edgar sells wine for a living and has been able to improve his home and cover household expenses through is work.

He is also beginning to sell groceries and it is going well.  The loan he is requesting is to buy rice, sugar, oil and milk.  His desire is to continue working in a positive way.  The communal bank "Las Caseritas" is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.  In the photograph, Edgar is the one standing.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil and milk.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées uniquement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de poissons, charbon du bois et  bois de chauffage. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de poisson de toutes les variétés.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 70kg de poissons frais à Kabala au bord du fleuve Niger. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée mixte. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the Danaya group are married into monogamous households. They are, on average, 37 years old and have three children. The all live in Djalakorodji, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. The group members know each other from neighborhood ties and their business activities in the Djalakorodji market. 

The group members all work in small-scale commerce, selling fish, charcoal, and firewood. In order to increase their capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their second group loan.

Awa, who is seated second from the left in the photo, has a good reputation when it comes to selling different types of fish. With this loan, she plans to buy 70 kilograms of fresh fish from Kabala, which borders the Niger river.

Sales will be made for cash and credit, at a market and from traveling around, to a mixed group of customers.

With this loan, Awa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Mme JEANNE est mariée et mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. Les 05 vont à l’école.
Elle vend des gâteaux depuis 10ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les boutiques de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter 03sacs de farine de blé, 03bidons d’huile, 01rangée de bois et 03sachets de levures.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider sa famille. Elle ambitionne ouvrir  un magasin pour stocker sa matière première.
texts.en:
Jeanne is married and a mother of five children. The eldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 9 years old. Five of the children go to school.

Jeanne has been selling cakes for ten years. She procures her goods from local stores. She would like to buy three sacs of wheat flour, three drums of oil, one rack of wood, and three sacs of yeast.

Jeanne wants to use her earnings to help her family. She plans to one day open a shop and sell basic goods.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of wheat flour, three drums of oil, one rack of wood, and three sacs of yeast

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
El señor Pedro tiene 54 años y toda su vida se ha dedica a las labores de agricultura y ganadería para el sustento de su familia.
El se desempeña en varios campos como el trabajo de la tierra y la ganadería.
En estos momentos está dedicado en pleno al manejo de carneros y ganado vacuno con esto ha podido mantener a su familia de una manera digna.
En estos momentos requiere de una ayuda para comprar un lote de carneros y ganado para el levante y así venderlos a la producción de carnes.
Esta actividad ha estado presente a lo largo de la historia de su familia y es un negocio que es heredado por las generaciones que llegan.
Con este apoyo podrá tener mejor rentabilidad en su negocio y seguirá ofreciéndole bienestar y buena calidad de vida a su familia, además de generar un empleo.
texts.en:
Pedro, 54, has worked in agriculture and livestock farming all of his life to support his family.  Although he has worked in both sectors, now he is more dedicated to raising sheep and cattle which allows him to support his family in a dignified manner.

He is in need of a loan to buy a group of sheep and cattle to raise and sell.  This business has always been part of the heritage of his family which has passed it on from generation to generation.  With this support he will be able to make his business more profitable so he can continue to provide his family with a quality lifestyle, and also generate employment.

loans.use: To buy cattle and sheep.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Benkadi  est majoritairement composé des femmes  mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes  dans le quartier de Banconi-Flabougou dans le district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, friperies de meilleures qualités, encens et condiments. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des friperies de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 balles de friperies  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché  et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is mostly made up of married women who live with their husbands and children in nuclear families. They average 35 years old with 4 children each. They all live in the Banconi-Flabougou neighborhood in the Bamako district, and met through relatives, neighbors and friends. 

The group members sell high-quality used clothing, incense and condiments. With the goal of building up their stock of merchandise in mind, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 3rd solidarity loan cycle. 

Aminata (second from the left in the photo) is well-known for selling high-quality used clothing. She plans on using her loan to buy 5 bales of used clothing in Bamako. She retails her products at the market and as a street vendor to a mostly female clientele. Aminata hopes that this loan will enable her to earn an average monthly income of 100,000 CFA Francs, which will be re-invested into her business and used to meet her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with this season's coffee crop.

loans.name: Haby's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très expérimentées dans le programme de l’institution, ces dernières sont très actives  dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier favorisant une  bonne entente et solidarité de groupe très appréciées.

Madame Haby  (debout à la troisième position de la droite vers la gauche avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 05 filles et 01 garçon, elle  est âgée de 39 ans. C’est une femme qui commence à bien maîtrise son activité qui s’articule autour de la vente d’articles vestimentaires et accessoires qu’elle achète pour la plus part du temps dans la sous région pour la revente à crédit moyennant deux échéances égales.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte renouveler son stock  par l’achat de lot d’étoffes légères pour la revente durant l’été.

Les bénéfices tirés de ses activités lui permettront d’assister ses enfants dans leur scolarité et de soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois Kambeng Doumassou was created at its inauguration on November 15th, 2006. The group is made up of women who have a great deal of experience with the institution, and are very involved in their income-generating activities, particularly small-scale retail sale. They all live in the same neighborhood, which has promoted an understanding and a solidarity appreciated by all. 

Haby (standing third from the right with her left hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and has 6 children, 5 girls and 1 boy, and is 39 years old. She is gaining an excellent understanding of her business, which consists of selling clothing and accessories that she usually buys in the sub-region and sells on credit to be repaid in two equal installments. 

With her new loan, she plans on renewing her stock by buying a batch of light fabrics to sell during the summer. The profits from this business will allow her to support her children in their schooling and to help her husband manage their daily expenses.

loans.use: to renew her stock by buying a batch of light fabric to sell during the summer.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très expérimentées dans le programme de l’institution, ces dernières sont très actives  dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier favorisant une  bonne entente et solidarité de groupe très appréciées.

Madame Astou  (assise à la troisième position de la gauche vers la droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 05 filles et 02 garçons. C’est une femme très entreprenante et s’active dans la vente de jus de fruit à base de feuilles de bissap, de pain de singe, de tamarin et de gingembre. Elle se procure la marchandise au marché central. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine pour lavoir pratiqué pendant plus de 05 ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter quatre sacs de pain de singe de 50 kg  à 4 000 FCFA l’unité, trois sacs de bissap à 5 000 FCFA l’unité, deux  sacs de sucre de 25 000 FCFA l’un et le reste pour divers colorants alimentaires et saveurs  entrant dans la préparation des jus.

Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle compte assurer en plus de la dépense quotidienne, les frais scolaires de ses enfants et ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
The Kambeng Doumassou Banc Villageois was created with its inauguration on November 15, 2006. The group is made up of women with a great deal of experience with the institution's program, and who are very involved in their income-generating activities, mainly small-scale retail sale. They all live in the same neighborhood, which has promoted an understanding and a solidarity that are appreciated by all. 

Astou (seated third from the left with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and has 7 children: 5 girls and 2 boys. She is a very enterprising woman in the business of selling fruit juices made from hibiscus, baobab fruit, tamarind and ginger. She gets her supplies from the central market. She benefits from a great deal of know-how, thanks to her 5 years of experience in the business. 

Her new loan will enable her to buy four 50 kg bags of baobab fruit at 4,000 CFA Francs each, three bags of hibiscus at 5,000 CFA Francs each, and two bags of sugar at 25,000 CFA Francs each, with the rest going towards various food coloring and flavoring used to make juices. With the resulting income, she plans to cover not only daily expenses, but also her children's schooling and her own needs.

loans.use: to buy four 50 kg bags of baobab fruit at 4,000 CFA Francs each, three bags of hibiscus flower at 5,000 CFA Francs each, two bags of sugar at 25,000 CFA Francs each, as well as various food coloring and flavoring used to make juices.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: La señora Leonarda tiene 38 años, ella es soltera no tiene hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella vende mantas y polleras en distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y el Alto, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Leonarda,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa como mantas al por mayor  y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Leonarda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida
texts.en: Leonarda is 38 and single. She sells clothing such as mantas (traditional shawls) and polleras (traditional colourful skirts) at several fairs in the cities of La Paz and el Alto. This is her first loan with the institution, and she wants to use it to buy clothing such as wholesale mantas to stock her business. Her reason for requesting the loan is to increase her range of goods. She faces business challenges such as competition, and she is going to use her profits to continue buying goods, and in this way increase her income. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity this gives her to grow her business. She will be able to improve her income and therefore her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale mantas (traditional shawls).

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 23-year-old lady who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last five years.

For the past several days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular usage. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the repair costs. Therefore, Najma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband. This will help him to continue his business. Najma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Sameth's Group

texts.en:
Sameth, 35, is a local citizen from Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with five kids, but only four of them still depend on her; three are in school and one kid is too young for schooling. To feed her family, she does cassava cropping and rice farming to get income. The business, which she has been involved in for 17 years, earns her 33,300 KHR per day. 

Including this cycle, she is the fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a group leader. The successful repayment of her past loan has enabled her to improve her lifestyle so it is better than before. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying loan for 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy insecticide, fertilizer and to pay plowing, harvesting and labor fees for her cassava field. She hopes to gain better yield and good income.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer and to pay plowing, harvesting and labor fees.

loans.name: Gulrui

texts.ru:
Гулруи молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 22 лет. Она у себя дома занимается швейным делом уже три года. Она способная и умелая портниха. Ее муж 25-летний автомеханик и работает в автомастерской. У них имеется двухлетняя дочь. Они живут в отдельном доме в городе Куляб. 
Профессии швеи Гулруи научилась у своей соседки. Изучение данной профессии ей далось легко, так как она была очень заинтересована. В 2011 году она начала свою деятельности и по сей день продолжает ее. Сейчас Гулруи нуждается в кредите для закупки тканей для шитья. Благодаря данному кредиту она сможет продолжить свое любимое дело.
texts.en: Gulrui is a young and married woman of 22 years old.  For over three years, she has been working as a seamstress from her home.  She is a capable and a skillful dressmaker.  Her husband is 25 years old and works as a mechanic at a car repair shop.  They have a two-year-old daughter and live in their own house in the city of Kulob.  Gulrui learned how to sew dresses from her neighbor.  Learning this skill came easy to Gulrui because she enjoyed the process.  In 2011, she started her own business of tailoring dresses.  Currently, Gulrui is in need of a loan to purchase fabrics so she can continue to follow with her favorite activity.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for sewing dresses

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат живет в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 24 года. Она замужем и живет в доме родителей мужа. Саодат вместе с мужем занимается растениеводством. На протяжении 5 лет они выращивают бахчевую и огородную культуру. Прибыль с продажи урожая является основным источником дохода семьи. Саодат и ее муж сейчас готовятся к очередному посеву. На сумму кредита они хотят приобрести качественные семена бахчевых культур. Этот кредит им очень важен.
texts.en: Saodat lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 24 years old, married and lives in the home of her in-laws.  Together with her husband, Saodat grows various vegetables.  Over the last five years, they have been growing melons and various other vegetables.  Profits from the sale of the harvest provides the main source of income for their family.  Saodat and her husband are getting ready for another sowing.  They are planning to use the loan to purchase melon seeds.  This loan is very important for them.

loans.use: To purchase melon seeds

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice, 24 years of age, is married to a motorcycle driver and blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a motorcycle together with her husband for almost five years and earning a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net profits are usually spent on their daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business even more.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Selveria

texts.en:
Selveria sells cosmetics in her village to make a living. Aside from doing this, her main source of income is from manufacturing and selling lampakanay products in town. She buys woven products and resells them in volume. She earns better income from this and so was able to repay successfully her previous loan which she used for the business. 

Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more raw materials and more woven products to resell. In the future, Selveria hopes to be more progressive in this venture and would like to be able to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials and more woven products to resell.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is married and has a kiosk from which many people buy every day. She is accepting a $600 loan to improve her business. She will use it to buy some additional supplies, such as oils, Fanta, Coca Cola, cigarettes, bread, coffee, and shampoo. She has been involved with this business since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Joana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy oils, Fanta, Coca Cola, cigarettes, bread, coffee, and shampoo.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her two children and spouse in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruit and vegetables for many years. Customers like to buy fruit from his shop instead of going to the market. Due to his fruit’s freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and he makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased and his stock runs out by noon.

Abida feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for the family. She is taking a loan for her husband so that he can buy more fruits and vegetables to match the need. She wants to save the excess profits so that she can save for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is a 38-year-old woman, living with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using three wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings he has purchased a used auto rickshaw, its engine quality is good but the body is fully damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy new rickshaw body and seat covers. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount to buy rickshaw body.

Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy new rickshaw body and could drive smoothly. She hopes that now he would be able to buy more income. She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new body and seat cover for a rickshaw.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
Maria es de esas personas que transmiten alegría con solo hablar, y es que esta emprendedora mujer utiliza su simpatía en todas las áreas de su vida, inclusive en su negocio.
Ella monto un pequeño local en el que vende múltiples variedades como juguetes, golosinas, algunos artículos para el hogar, ropa y accesorios. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 8 meses con el afán de buscar ingresos para su propio sostenimiento ya que por ahora no tiene hijos.
Trabaja todos los días y es muy dedica y juiciosa en lo que hace.
Su principal desafío es la falta de un buen capital para tener más variedad de productos, por esta razón solicita un crédito para comprar un inventario de productos más amplio y de esta manera tener siempre disponible los artículos para sus clientes. Esto impactará positivamente sus ventas y aumentará significativamente sus ingresos.
Su anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un gran almacén con amplio surtido de productos.
texts.en:
María is one of those people who simply exudes happiness when she speaks. She is also a very enterprising woman whose kindness can be seen in all area of her life, including at her business.

María started her own little business where she sells a variety of items, including toys, sweets, some items for the home, clothes, and accessories. She works every day, and is dedicated and sensible in her work.

María's greatest challenge is her lack of capital, which she needs to offer a larger variety of stock. Because of this she is applying for a loan in order to buy more products and always have items available for her customers. This will affect sales positively and her income will increase significantly.

María's desire is to expand her business and turn it into a large distributor with a large variety of products.

loans.use: to buy stock (games, items for the home, and clothes) to stock up her business and sell a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат 25 лет. Она замужем и является матерью трехлетнего ребенка. Малохат независимая женщина. Уже 5 лет как  она занимается шитьем у себя дома. Она в основном шьет женские платья национального стиля. По причине того что швейная машинка Малохат очень устарела, она причиняет ей много неудобств в процессе работы. Она решила устранить эту трудность, замедляющий процесс ее работы. Малохат обратилась за кредитом. Она планирует приобрести новую электрическую швейную машинку, чтобы выполнять заказы в срок и качественно. Малохат очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Malohat is 25 years old.  She is married and has a three year old baby.  Malohat is an independent woman, for over five years she has been running a sewing business from her home.  She mainly sews women's dresses in the traditional style.  Malohat's current sewing machine is quite old and slows down the process.  She decided to eliminate this stumbling block by obtaining a loan to purchase a modern electric sewing machine.  This will enable her to complete her orders faster and with greater quality.  Malohat is really counting on your support.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hugo Geovanny

texts.es:
Recinto playas del Rio Blanco un lugar de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, a este Recinto llegan muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de los maravillosos paisajes y sitios de descanso que encontramos en la vía.
En este recinto vive y tiene el negocio el señor Hugo un hombre de 33 años él es padre soltero tiene un hijo de 1 año 3 meses de una relación que tenía un tiempo atrás, el nació y creció en una familia humilde y muy trabajadora, él se dedica desde su niñez a la agricultura, por la distancia en la que estaba ubicada su vivienda y por no tener los recursos necesarios no pudo estudiar el solo tiene la primaria, solicita este crédito para invertir en iniciar con su propio negocio una pequeña granja porcina ya que conoce mucho de esta actividad.
Con esta nueva inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos y poder darle a su hijo todo lo que necesite, el señor Hugo agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Río Blanco and its beaches have a warm climate and the place is filled with friendly and hard-working people. Many national and international tourists come to this area in order to enjoy the wonderful scenery and the places to relax that line the highway.

And it is here in Río Blanco that 33-year-old Hugo lives and runs his business. Hugo is a single father to one son - aged one year and three months - whom he had in a previous relationship. Hugo was born and raised in a humble and very hard-working family. Hugo has been making a living in farming since he was a child. As his school was so far from his home, and because his family did not have enough money, Hugo was unable to study much and only attended primary school. Hugo is applying for a loan in order to start his own business - he will open a pig farm, as he knows a lot about this trade.

With this new investment, Hugo hopes to increase his income and to give his son everything that he needs. Hugo is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunity being given to him.

loans.use: to start his own pig farm.

loans.name: Jekafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées équitablement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Jekafo ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi-Flabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Banconi-Flabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (échalotes, cube maggi), charbon du bois, pâte d’arachide et habits. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou  (première assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (échalotes,  cube maggi, etc.)  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 sacs d’échalotes et 20 cartons de cubes Maggi à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au Banconi-Flabougou  à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bintou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Jekafo group, who are married equitably in monogamous and polygamous households, average 33 years of age with three children each. They all live in Banconi-Flabougou, one of the districts in Bamako, and they got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities at the market in Banconi-Flabougou. The group members have small businesses selling condiments (shallots, Maggi stock cubes), charcoal, groundnut paste and clothing. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so that they could expand their businesses and are on their third group loan cycle.

Bintou (who is sitting on the right of the photo) is a significant seller of condiments (shallots, Maggi stock cubes, etc.). She is planning to use her loan to buy 15 sacks of shallots and 20 cartons of Maggi stock cubes in Bamako. She resells on a retail basis in Banconi-Flabagou to a primarily female customer base. Bintou expects to make an average monthly profit of 125,000FCFA with this loan and will use the profit to reinvest in her business and satisfy her household's small needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Julia Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Julia una mujer luchadora de 52 años es madre soltera tiene 9 hijos de los cuales 6 son independientes ya no viven con ella y 3 aun la ayudan en casa, ella vive y tiene su negocio en un pequeño Recinto llamado San Bernabé el mismo que está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos, este Recinto es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de sus maravillosas hosterías y sitios de descanso que podemos encontrar.
La señora Julia se dedica a la producción de cerdos, aprendió de este negocio desde su niñez junto con los papás, ya que fue criada en el campo, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 5 horas al día recibe la ayuda de sus hijos en la alimentación y cuidado de los cerdos, ella no pudo estudiar por la falta de oportunidades, solo tiene la primaria pero lucho y lucha muy duro para que sus hijos tengan lo que ella no pudo.
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio para arreglar las chancheras y construir otra para incrementar la producción, con esta nueva inversión mejorar su calidad de vida y de  los hijos que aún viven con ella , La señora Julia agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Julia is a determined 52-year-old woman who is a single mother with 9 children, 6 of whom are independent and don't live with her anymore and 3 who still help at home.  She lives and has her business in a small rural settlement called San Bernabé, which is located in the northwest of the of Pinchincha province in the canton of San Miguel de los Bancos. This settlement is frequently visited by domestic and international tourists to enjoy the marvelous inns and resting places that we can find.

Julia works raising pigs. She learned this business in her childhood with her parents, since she was raised in the country and she works an average of 5 hours per day in this business.  Her children help her in feeding and taking care of the pigs. She couldn't study due to limited opportunities, and she only has a primary education but she struggles and works very hard so that her children can have what she couldn't. 

She asks for this loan to invest in the business in order to fix the pig pens and build a new one to increase her production and with this new investment, improve the quality of live for herself and the children who still live with her.  Julia thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunity they offer.

loans.use: to fix the pig pens and construct a new one.

loans.name: Eladio Miguel

texts.es:
Eladio es un joven hombre de 30 años, vive con su esposa y con la luz de su vida, su hijo de 10 años quien le brinda toda la alegría para salir adelante y buscar oportunidades de progreso.
El se dedica a la producción agrícola hace aproximadamente 8 años, oficio que aprendió desde muy niño a lado de sus padres quienes toda su vida fueron campesinos.
El desea continuar con sus cultivos y hacerlos más amplios, por eso solicita apoyo para comprar abono para sus tierras y semillas de nuevos alimentos como plátano y yuca.
Con estos insumos podrá aumentar su producción y obtener ingresos extra para el sustento de su negocio y su familia.
Su sueño es tener un gran cultivo que le permita vender a grandes fábricas y plazas.
texts.en:
Eladio is a 30 year old young man. He lives with his wife and with the light of his life, his 10 year old son, who provides him all the joy he needs to move forward and look for opportunities for progress. 
He works in agricultural production and has done so for about 8 years. He learned this work at his parents' side when he was very young and his parents were always farmers. 
He wants to keep growing his crops and to plant a larger area so he is requesting support to buy fertilizer for his land and seeds for new plants such as banana and yuca.
With these supplies, he will be able to increase his production and have extra income to sustain his business and his family. 
His dream is to have a large farm so that he can sell to large factories and places.

loans.use: to buy supplies for cultivating the land like fertilizer, seeds, and irrigation.

loans.name: Álvaro Reomir

texts.es:
Álvaro de 39 años, no teme a ensuciarse las manos con tal de tener el sustento para su familia y el progreso de su negocio.
El es dueño de un pequeño taller de mantenimiento de motocicletas y automóviles, en el cual trabaja de lunes a sábado con el fin de obtener un poca mas de recursos para su hogar.
Tiene gran experiencia en el campo de la mecánica a pesar de no haber realizado ningún estudio de este, es un hombre muy emprendedor y responsable con sus trabajos.
Desea ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes por eso necesita comprar neumáticos y 2 gatos hidráulicos, esto le brindara la oportunidad de trabajar mas cómoda, rápida y oportunamente, lo que se verá reflejado en sus ganancias y cantidad de clientes.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller reconocido en la zona, con varios empleados trabajando allí.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 39 years old. He has no fear of getting his hands dirty if he can support his family and progress with his business.

Álvaro owns a workshop where he maintains cars and motorcycles. He works there Monday to Saturday in order to earn a little more for his household. 

Álvaro has a lot of experience as a mechanic, though he never studied the subject. Álvaro is a very enterprising and responsible person in his work.

Álvaro wants to offer better service to his customers and so needs to buy tyres and two hydraulic jacks. This will provide Álvaro with the opportunity to work more comfortably and quicker. This will then be reflected in his profits and his number of customers.

Álvaro's greatest dream is to have his workshop well-known in the area, and to have a number of employees working there.

loans.use: to buy tyres and two hydraulic jacks.

loans.name: Manuel Enrique

texts.es:
Manuel es un joven de grandes ambiciones y planes para su vida, la de su esposa y sus dos hijos pequeños, por esta razón trabaja incansablemente todos los días en las duras labores del campo.
El desempeña desde hace 6 años a la agricultura, sembrando alimentos como yuca y plátano, estos alimentos los cosecha y posteriormente los vende en los pueblos cercanos; una pequeña parte la utiliza para el propio consumo de su familia.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una finca propia que le permita tener sus cultivos y algunos animales, pero sabe que para lograr esto debe trabajar duro y en algunas ocasiones pedir ayuda, por esta razón solicita un apoyo económico para comprar insumos de agricultura como abonos, riegos, semillas y pesticidas. Con estos elementos podrá sacar adelante la cosecha de este año y seguir llevando el sustento diario de su familia que al fin y al cabo son la razón de su vida y por los cuales se esfuerza tanto en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a young man with great ambitions and plans for his, his wife's and his two children's lives. He is constantly doing difficult work in the country.

Manuel has been working in farming for six years. He grows foods such as yuccas and plantains. He harvests the crops and later sells them in nearby towns. Manuel uses part of the yield to feed his family.

Manuel's greatest dream is to have his own farm, where he could grow his crops and raise a few animals. He knows, however, that to achieve this he must work very hard and, on occasion, ask for help. Manuel is therefore applying for financial support to buy farming supplies such as a manure, irrigation, seeds and pesticides. With these items Manuel will be able to more forward with this year's harvest and continue bringing home enough to support his family every day. After all, Manuel's family are his reason for living and the reason he puts in so much effort at work.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as manure, seeds, pesticides and more.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des ménages monogamiques, les huit  membres du groupe Lolo ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (tomates), céréales, habits, charbon de bois du bois de chauffe et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sali (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des condiments (tomates, oignons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 corbeilles de tomates en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Djalakorodji à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sali compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Lolo group, who are all married and living in monogamous households, average 39 years of age with four children each. They all live in Djalakorodji, one of the districts in Bamako, and they got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities at the market in Djalakorodji. The group members have small businesses either selling condiments (tomatoes), cereals, clothing, charcoal and firewood, or carrying out restauration activities. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so that they could expand their businesses and are on their third group loan cycle.

Sali (who is standing on the far right of the photo) is a significant seller of condiments (tomatoes, onions). She is planning to use her loan to buy 2à baskets of tomatoes wholesale in Bamako. She resells on a retail basis in Djalakorodji to a primarily female customer base. Sali expects to make an average monthly profit of 90,000FCFA with this loan and will use the profit to reinvest in her business and satisfy her household's small needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Carmen una mujer luchadora de 24 años es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos el mayor de 5 años y la última de 3 meses ella vive y tiene su negocio en un pequeño Recinto llamado San Bernabé el mismo que está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos, este recinto es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de sus maravillosas hosterías y sitios de descanso que podemos encontrar.
En este Recinto tiene una pequeña granja de cerdos aprendió de este negocio por iniciativa, al mismo le dedica un promedio de 6 horas al día, por una mala relación se separó del esposo y hoy tiene que luchar muy duro para salir adelante con sus pequeños hijos, ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos lo que no le permitió continuar con sus estudios ella solo cursó la primaria. 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio para ampliar y arreglar las chancheras, comprará un nuevo techo, pisos, puertas, para poder comprar más cerdos he incrementar la producción, con esta nueva inversión su vida cambiara ya que mejorara su nivel de vida y recursos económicos. 
La señora Carmen agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking 24 year old woman who is a single mother and has 2 children, the oldest is 5 years old and the youngest is 3 months old. She lives and has her business in a small place called San Bernabé, which is located in the north west of the province of Pichincha in the canton of San Miguel De Los Bancos. This place is much visited by domestic and foreign tourists who go to enjoy the marvelous inns and relaxing places that are found there. 
In this village, she has a small pig farm. She learned this work on her own initiative and spends about 6 hours a day running the business. She is separated from her husband due to a bad relationship and now she has to strive very hard to be successful for her little children. She comes from a low income family so she was not able to study beyond primary school. 
She is requesting this loan to invest in her business by increasing and repairing the pig sties. She will buy a new roof, floors, and doors so that she can have more pigs and increase her production. Her life will change with this new loan as she will improve her standard of living and economic resources. 
Carmen is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunity they offer.

loans.use: to grow and repair the sties and to buy a new roof.

loans.name: Idbela Yolany

texts.es:
Idbela es una joven de 28 años de edad, acompañada y madre de un hijo quien estudia en la escuela situada en la comunidad.  Su compañero de hogar trabaja como maestro de educación primaria por lo que es muy beneficioso para ambos pues sus ingresos ya no solo dependen del cultivo de café. Idbela se graduó de la secundaria como perito mercantil y contador público aunque aún no ha podido ejercer su carrera ya que las oportunidades de empleo en su comunidad son muy pocas. Como ingreso principal para la familia es la siembra y cultivo de café trabajando por varios años y adquiriendo dicha experiencia gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y que hoy en día en compañía de su pareja son los encargados de dar la atención y mantenimiento a sus cultivos. 
Sus planes para el futuro como productora de café, seguir ampliando sus cultivos, poder comprar más tierra para que esta pueda ser cultivada con una variedad de café ya que en la actualidad su propiedad es de una manzana de tierra y para este año planea ampliarla. Como madre de familia seguirse esforzando y trabajando duro para dar la oportunidad a su hijo de poder seguir estudiando y se pueda convertir en una persona preparada académicamente. En esta oportunidad ella solicita apoyo financiero a los inversionistas de KIVA para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, foliares, urea, entre otros insumos que son necesarios para  dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Idbela is a 28 year old young woman who has a partner and is the mother of one son who studies in the community school. Her partner works as a primary school teacher, which is very beneficial for them both as their income does not depend solely on the coffee crop. Idbela graduated from high school with expertise in trade and public accounting however she has never been able to follow these careers because their are few opportunities for employment in her community. The main source of income for the family is growing and harvesting coffee. She has been working in this field for some years and has acquired experience thanks to her father teaching her. Today, she and her partner are charged with attending to and maintaining the crops. 
Her plans for the future as a producer of coffee are to keep increasing her cultivation and to buy more land so that she can cultivate a variety of coffee on it as her property is currently relatively small and she plans to increase it this year. As a mother of a family she sill keep striving and working hard to give her son the opportunity to have an education so that he will be an academically prepared person. On this occasion, she is requesting financial support from the Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers, manure, foliar fertilizer, urea, and other supplies that are necessary for caring for her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies that give technical assistance to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nyetaga Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Nyetaga sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, poissons,  condiments, charbon du bois et céréales. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de  poissons de toutes les variétés.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100kg de poissons frais à Kabala au bord du fleuve Niger. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée mixte. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The majority of the seven members of the Nyetaga group are married and living in polygamous households. They average 39 years of age with six children each. They all live in Djalakorodji, one of the districts in Bamako, and they got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities at the market in Djalakorodji. The group members have small businesses selling fish, condiments, charcoal and cereals. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so that they could get fresh supplies for cash and are on their third group loan cycle.

Awa (who is standing on the far left of the photo) has a good reputation for selling all kinds of fish. She is planning to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of fresh fish in Kabala on the banks of the river Niger. She resells for cash and on credit at the market and door to door to a mixed customer base. Awa expects to make an average monthly profit of 90,000FCFA with this loan and will use the profit to reinvest in her business and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 11 años y 9 años de edad. Cecilia se dedica  a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo ye es así como logra sacar adelante a su familia y junto a su esposo van sacando adelante a sus hijos. Cecilia desea construir las paredes de un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro. De esta forma espera brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Cecilia is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their 2 children who are 11 and 9 years old.  Cecilia has worked providing domestic services for a long time and this is how she manages to provide for her family and with her husband the have provided for their children.  Cecilia wants to build the walls of a bedroom in her home for which she has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying the necessary materials such as cement, sand, bricks and iron.  In this way, she hopes to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron to buuild walls for a bedroom.

loans.name: Gabby

texts.en:
Gabby is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 30 years old and has three children. 

He aims to improve their standard of living, educate his children, and give them a better life.  

He farms and also  has a retail fruit and vegetable  business to earn additional income. He wants to continue to strengthen this business but he does not have the capital. For this reason, he 10,000.00 PHP to buy  fruit and vegetables to resell. 

Through this loan, he believes that he will improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, hermano y hermana. Luis es un joven trabajador quien se dedica a trabajar como motorista de transporte público en su localidad. Luis es un hombre visionario y en vista de que su vivienda se encuentra en mal estado hace algunos meses comenzó la construcción de su nueva casa con materiales más resistentes. Por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar de construir su vivienda por lo que  solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas, ventanas, arena, cemento y ladrillo de piso. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder terminar su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Luis is 24 years old and lives in his own home along with his mother, brother, and sister. Luis is a hardworking young man who works as a public transit driver in his community. Luis is a visionary man who, on seeing that his home had been in a poor state for a few months, began building a new house with more durable materials. Because of a lack of economic resources, he has not been able to finish building his house so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy doors, windows, sand, cement, and earth bricks. He hopes to receive this loan and to to be able to finish his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: doors, windows, sand, cement, and earth bricks.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Badialan, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de friperie, de fruits et légumes,  des jus  et d’article divers.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente ASSETOU, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de jus. Elle compte acheter 50 kg de sucre, des bouteilles vides, du sachet plastique et autre matière première sur place chez les grossistes à Fana, puis le transforme en jus de qualité. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché hebdomadaire et ceux des villages environnants à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 Fcfa qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who average 32 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, in the Badialan district, which lies in the prefecture of Dioïla in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through family, neighbors and friendship  and they have businesses selling cereals, second-hand clothing, fruit and vegetables, juices and other products. The group members decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso so that they could satisfy their huge customer demand and are on their fifth group loan. These loans will be used to buy the aforementioned products

The customer, Assetou, who is standing on the far left of the photo, is uneducated. She currently sells juice and is planning to buy 50 kilos of sugar, empty bottles, plastic bags and other basic products locally from wholesalers in Fana, then use them to make high-quality juice. She resells on a retail basis at the weekly market and at markets in surrounding villages to a mixed customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA which be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients for making juice.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans 5 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Badialan, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de chaussures, de pots et de boissons non alcoolisées.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SALI, personne assise est instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de chaussures. Elle compte s’approvisionne en  chaussures pour femme chez ses fournisseurs à Dakar. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 70 000 Fcfa qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made up of married women who average 44 years of age with five children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, in the Badialan district, which lies in the prefecture of Dioïla in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through family, neighbors and friendship,  and they have businesses in restauration, selling cereals, shoes, pots and non-alcoholic drinks. The group members decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso so that they could satisfy their huge customer demand and are on their eighth group loan. These loans will be used to buy the aforementioned products

The customer, Sali, who is the one sitting in the photo, is uneducated. She currently sells shoes and is planning to get supplies of women's shoes from suppliers in Dakar. She resells on a retail basis and for cash from her home and sometimes door to door to a female customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 70,000FCFA which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Aladin

texts.en:
Aladin  has owned and operated a motorcycle transportation business for five years to earn a good income for the family.

Aladin joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2013 to gain access to financial services and to help improve his business and living situation. He used his previous loan for his service-based business  and it was successfully repaid. Aladin requests a new loan to cover transportation licenses renewal to offer better services.

In the future, Aladin wants to make improvements to his house and improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase transportation licenses renewal.

loans.name: Johana

texts.es: Johana es un mujer de 37 años la cual tiene dos negocios primeramente tiene un corral de cerdos y segundo atiende una heladería los cuales inicio hace tres años y que ha progresado con la ayuda de los créditos que ha usado para la creación y fortalecimiento de sus dos negocios, vive en una casa con su pareja y no tiene hijos, ella prefiere esperar a tener una empresa bien constituida y rentable para traer hijos al mundo que tenga el capital suficiente para educarlos y alimentarlos ya que sus inicios le toco aguantar hambre y no quiere que un futuro hijo suyo le llegue a pasar esas condiciones, solicita el crédito para la construcción de un corral de marranos y la compra de varios cerdos, con los que aumentara su activo fijo y por ende sus ingresos su único sueño es en un futuro tener una feliz familia que se beneficie de la empresa que le ha costado tanto esfuerzo constituir
texts.en: Johana is a 37 year old woman who has 2 businesses. Her primary business is a pig farm and the second is that she works in an ice cream store. She started the businesses 3 years ago and has progressed with the help of loans that she has used to start and strengthen her businesses. She lives in a house with her partner and they don't have children. She prefers to wait to have a well-founded and profitable business before she brings children into the world so that she will have the funds needed for their education and food. She suffered hunger in her early years and she doesn't want her future children to have the same experiences. She is requesting this loan to build a pig sty or corral and to buy some pigs so that she can increase her assets with the goal of increasing her income. Her only dream is to have a happy family in the future that will benefit from the business that it has cost her such effort to build.

loans.use: to build a corral and buy pigs  y comprar credos to increase her assets and generate more income.

loans.name: Carmen Leonor

texts.es:
Carmen se dedica a la compra y comercialización de plátano en el municipio de Montería (Córdoba). Este oficio lo aprendió al lado de sus padres y le ha servido para el sustento de su familia, compuesta por su esposo y 3 hijos.
Ella compra el producto en las fincas cercanas y luego los vende en la plaza de mercado de la región; en ocasiones sus hijos le ayudan con esta actividad y entre todos se ayudan para su propia subsistencia.
Ella solicita un apoyo económico para comprar una mayor cantidad de producto y generar mejor rentabilidad a su negocio, entre los costos de su comercialización debe pagar las semillas y la mano de obra de la actividad.
Su mayor desafío es el clima ya que muchas veces seca las plantas y las mata.
Por otro lado su mayor sueño es poder tener una finca propia con sus propios cultivos, de esta forma podrá generar empleo y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen makes a living buying and selling bananas in the town of Montería (Córdoba).  She learned this job alongside her parents and it has served to provide for her family, which is made up of her husband and three children.

She buys her products from the nearby farms and then sells them in the region's market square.  Sometimes her children help with the work and between them all they help make their own living.  

She asks for financial support in order to buy a greater quantity of product and to generate better profit in her business.  In addition to the costs of selling, she has to pay for the seeds and the labor of the job.  

Carmen's greatest challenge is the climate since the dry season often kills the plants.  On the other hand, her greatest dream is to be able to have her own farm with her own crops.  This would allow her to generate employment and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of bananas to sell, to buy seeds, and to pay the labor for harvesting.

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en:
A villager located from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Khon is 43 years old. She is married and blessed with five kids; two of them are in school. To make a living, she grows cassava and rice as her main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for 25 years with a decent income to cover the needs of her family, especially in providing her kids sufficient food. This positive impact has resulted from the past loan that she has completely repaid. 

Now, she is leading a group of two to get a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR each. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for plowing, harvesting and labor fees. She strongly hopes to expand her farmland so it will be bigger than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for plowing, harvesting and labor fees

loans.name: Kelly Johana

texts.es: Kelly es una mujer joven de tan solo 22 años de edad que quería sentirse útil en su familia quería generar su propios ingresos no solo para ella si no para su hija de 1 año de edad pues sentía demasiada pena al pedir algún artículo para su hija, por eso con algunos ahorros compro una cerda la cual crió con en un corral que le adecuo su padre y con el que viene trabajando, gracias a su familia adquirió los conocimiento para el cuidado de estos animales, solicita un crédito para la compra de cuido adecuar su corral y comprar más cerdos de cría para preñarlos y sus crías serán destinas a cerdos de engorde, su principal sueño es crecer como empresa generando recursos los cuales le servirán para ampliar su negocio y en un futuro comprar una finca para criar cerdos y ganado prosperando y volviéndose una empresaria consolidada pensando siempre en el futuro de su hija.
texts.en: Kelly is a young woman only 22 years old who wanted to feel useful to her family and wanted to earn her own income not just for herself but also for her 1-year-old daughter since it pains her to ask for anything for her daughter.  For this reason, she bought a pig with some of her savings and raised it in the pig pen that her father made and with which she has been working. Thanks to her family, she gained the knowledge to take care of these animals.  She asks for this loan to buy the concentrated pig feed, enhance her pig pen, and buy more breeding pigs to breed them and the piglets will be fattening pigs.  Her main dream is to grow the business generating resources which will allow her to increase her business and in the future to buy a farm to raise pigs and cattle, becoming prosperous and becoming an established businesswoman, always thinking of her daughter's future.

loans.use: to buy concentrated pig feed, enhance her pig pen and buy pigs with the hope of selling more.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 43 years of age, is married to a farmer and has two children.

She has sold rice grains in her village for almost one year and earns a net income of 200 PHP weekly. She usually saves her  income.

Due to insufficient capital to run her business, she would like 5,000 PHP to purchase rice bags. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase rice bags for retail.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Ry is 33 years old and a mother of one school-aged child. She lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. 

Her main source of income to support her family is growing cassava and rice. With VisionFund(Kiva’s partner), she is in sixth loan cycle with a successful repayment history. 

Her living conditions have gradually improved  and  she can provide three  decent meals a day for her children. 

She leads a group of four borrowers. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and pay for plowing, harvesting and labor fees for her cassava’s field.

 She hopes to gain a high yield and expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide and pay for plowing, harvesting and labor fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and maintain the bus.

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 31ans, Madame Koko pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales revend depuis 2013 des déodorants, des savons de toilettes et divers produits dans une boutique. Elle a de nombreux clients de parts et d'autres dans la ville et n'arrivant plus à les satisfaire sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter des marchandises. Son objectif est d'ouvrir une boutique de produits cosmétiques et assurer la bonne scolarisation à son unique enfant.
texts.en: In order to help her partner with the family expenses, 31-year-old Koko has been selling deodorants, soaps and various other products from her shop since 2013. She has many local customers and some from the city, but she is no longer able to satisfy their demands, hence the need for her first loan in order to purchase new stock. Her goal is to open up a shop for cosmetic products and to ensure that her only child receives a good education.

loans.use: buy deodorants, soaps and other products

loans.name: Barnokhon

texts.ru:
Барънохону 24 года. Она уроженка городка Турсунзаде. Барънохон замужем. У нее есть один маленький ребенок. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Ребенка воспитывает одна. Потому что ее муж был вынужден уехать, чтобы прокормить семью. Барънорон берет заказ на шитье национальной женской одежды. Она получает небольшой, но значительный доход. Она не теряет время зря, и одновременно нигде не работая сидя дома следя за сыном, она предоставляет услуги шитья. 
  На данный момент Барънохону необходимо новая швейная машинка, чтобы не потерять важный источник дохода. Так как ее предыдущая машинка не в рабочем состоянии. Помогите Барънохону приобрести швейную машинку.
texts.en: Barnokhon is a 24 years old native of a little town of Tursun-zoda.  Barnokhon is married and has a small child.  Her husband is currently working in the Russian Federation to provide for the family, so Barnokhon is raising the baby on her own.  While taking care of their baby, she does not waste her time and provides sewing services.  She takes orders for dresses in the traditional style, which provides a small but steady income.  Currently, she is in need of a new sewing machine, so she can avoid losing an important source of her income.  Her current sewing machine is old and broken.  Please help Barnokhon to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children in his own home, located in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. All of his children go to local school and still depend on their parents' income. Sophal works as a policeman and earns additional income from agricultural business. Most people in the community works in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade. 

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Sophal is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding his family's health and protecting the environment. He will use the loan he's applying for to drill a well and install a hand pump well on the top of the drilled well. This way he won’t face water shortage in the future and he won't need to spend much time collecting water from far-distant areas, so that he can pay more attention to his business and earn more income to support his family. He is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to drill a well and install a hand pump

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona was born in 1990. She is a young mother and tries to offer her son all the best. Farzona is divorced and is bringing up her son alone. She is going to start her own business selling fabrics and shoes because she needs a source of income. 

Farzona took part in a course called ‘To get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a lot of new information for herself. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy fabrics and shoes for organizing this new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and shoes so as to organize a new business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina  owns and operates a specialized retail store selling grocery goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for four years and earns good income from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in buying more stock. 

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC and gained access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She also has a farm, their main source of income. Gina has taken out  a new loan to buy fertilizer in order to improve the farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single woman with one child who is still underage. She lives at a rental house that has no piped water but has electricity. 

Mwanamisi has operated a beauty salon business for the past three months. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future.
