With the loan she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and conditioners

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last ten years. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular uses. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. 

Therefore Tahira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Tahira is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is 47 years old and married. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she has requested a Kiva loan through the BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use this loan to buy a stock of spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help her to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

This is her fourth loan with BRAC and first with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a stock of stitching materials for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Hea's Group

texts.en: Hea is a villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province,  a mother of two children who are in school. To overcome her family’s hardships, cassava and rice farming are the main source of income in which she has been occupied for 15 years. This is the second loan for Hea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader of a group consisting of four women. The total amount of her entire group loan is 3,900,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for land plowing fee. She hopes to gain better income and to keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To pay for land plowing fee

loans.name: Kefaya

texts.en:
Kefaya is a 35-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus city. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. He husband works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. 

Three years ago, he decided to open his own business which is a small workshop for manufacturing furniture. Its a good business and earns a good income. Kefaya and her husband would like to improve the workshop buy adding more machines for furniture making. 

Kefaya took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy a new machine for the furniture workshop. By taking this loan, Kefaya and her husband will be able to improve their productivity and increase their income. 

Kefaya appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new machine for the furniture workshop.

loans.name: El Futuro Del Mañana Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Futuro Del Mañana” conformado por 10 socios trabajadores y responsables,  la cual pasa a su 8vo ciclo. Dora de 40 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida como lomo saltado y  arroz con pollo. Gracias a su esfuerzo Dora ha  logrado cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Su último crédito los destinará para la compra de arroz, pescado y aceite. El grupo “El Futuro Del Mañana” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Dora es la primera del lado derecho viste polo morado.
texts.en: This is the “El Futuro Del Mañana” ["The Future of Tomorrow"] group, made up of 10 hard-working and responsible members. The group is in its eighth cycle. Dora, age 40, is separated with one dependent child. She sells food such as sautéed meat and rice with chicken. Thanks to her hard work, Dora has been able to cover her household costs. She will use this loan to purchase rice, fish, and oil. The group thanks those who have made this loan possible. Dora is pictured first on the right, in the purple t-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fish, and oil.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky’s grocery store is doing very well. She has managed to stock it with the basic goods that people in her village need. More clients are attracted to her shop now that she has a large variety of products. She has seen an increase in sales and profits and is managing to pay bills per month. 

With her profits, she bought furniture for her home, paid school fees for her three siblings, and started a poultry business to further increase her income. She is asking for a loan amounting Php 10,000 to buy candies, snack foods, noodles and spices for her business.

loans.use: to buy candies, snack foods, noodles and spices for her business

loans.name: Nodirakhon

texts.en:
Nodirakhon was born in 1973. She is an ambitious woman who lives in a big house with her family. She is bringing up three children. Her husband is a builder. 

Many years ago, Nodirakhon had her own business but for the last several years she has not had any business activity. Now, she wants to start a new business selling children's clothes. Nodirakhon will sell children's clothing in a local market. She will manage her business alone. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy children clothes to organize her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for her new business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be patient, honest and determined. She operates a M-pesa business where she offers a mobile phone-based money transfer service. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area. 

Gladys describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add more M-pesa float, i.e., money for customers to withdraw. Her business goal is to open another branch within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to add more M-pesa float, i.e., money for customers to withdraw

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia  is 42 years old, married, and lives with her family. She has a retail store selling assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works in their own farm. 

Antonia has eight years' experience in this field. She works hard every day in order to provide income for the family. Antonia requested this  loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits for their better future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia, 42, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a worker abroad, and she is a mother to her children, managing their household while operating the business. At this time, she and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Celia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Celia hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having a prosperous life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Iffat

texts.en:
Iffat is a young and kind 43-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a very hardworking person and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business so as to have a regular income in the family. He is involved in making and selling wooden furniture, such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business over fifteen years ago. 

Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to cope with the increasing demand.

Therefore, Iffat came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for making furniture. Iffat hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for their business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Bintihassan

texts.en:
Bintihassan is a divorced woman and has three school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women and also curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for nine years and with her generated income, she was able to repaid her previous loan successfully. Aside from this, she is also engaged in a buy-and-sell business selling farm produce in town. Now  Alice is requesting a new loan to purchase more farm produce to resell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more farm produce to resell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel’s husband is a meat vendor. She is 37 years old and has three children attending school. Maricel used to  spend her time purely in raising hogs. Then she come on a thought that she would butcher the hogs and sell the meat in the market. As time went by while managing the business, and Maricel realized that she earned more income from selling meat in the market.

 At present, Maricel sells pork, chicken, and fish. In view of her customers' demand, Maricel is requesting a loan of P 50,000 to buy hogs to butcher and sell. She will also use the loan to buy feed for the maintenance of her piglets. Maricel hope to earn more for the future of her three children.

loans.use: to buy hogs to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, sand, cement, and bricks to build a a wall in the passageway of her home.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia helps her husband in managing their own farm for a living. She has been successful with their farm, so she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. With her savings, Florencia was able to build another business which is raising pigs and selling them commercially in town. She borrowed a loan again to buy feed and piglets to raise. She is determined to gain more profit from the farm to improve their living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar grows and harvests rice and has been in business for more than 11 years.  His profits are his primary source of income for his family. 

Aside from farming, Oscar also help his wife run her general store to additional income.  

Oscar took a new loan to buy grocery goods to sell to improve sales.

Oscar is planning to expand his farm, hoping it will flourish and enable him to improve his business to ensure a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 26 year old man who describes himself as creative.  He is a carpenter and has been involved in this business for four years. 

His business is located in a nice place and his primary customers are the general public.  Charles says his biggest business challenge is a lack of timber. 

Charles will use his Kes 20,000 loan to buy timber to make furniture.  His business goal is to be a large producer within five years. 

He hopes to improve his business and will use the anticipated profits to buy more timber.

loans.use: buy timber to make furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Khet's Group

texts.en:
Khet, a resident of Kampong Cham province, is 43 years old and a mother of three children; one of them is in school. She is a cassava farmer and a grocer in the area. She has been involved in her current business for ages. She is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her successful repayment has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle and make it better than before. 

For this loan cycle, she is leading a group of three to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire group loan is 2,350,000 KHR, of which 1,600,000 KHR is her loan portion. She will spend her entire loan portion for labor costs. She hopes her business will enable her to keep supporting her child until a high level of education.

loans.use: To pay labor costs

loans.name: Alexander De Jesús

texts.es: Alexander es un agricultor especialmente de plátano que adquirió una parcela de cultivo que le dejo su madre antes de partir cuando el solo tenía 15 años y que ha mejorado y ampliado  hasta convertirlo en un hermoso cultivo de plátano que se puede evidenciar en la foto, su gran fortaleza es que la ubicación de la parcela está en un territorio privilegiado ya que es una zona muy fértil, solicita el crédito para la construcción de canales , modificación de los ya existentes, realizando un control de abono, su gran sueño es adquirir más terreno para el día que su madre regrese encuentre una gran territorio ocupado por su hijo y que esta se sienta orgullosa de él y que ambos disfruten de sus extensos y fértiles territorios de cultivo de plátano
texts.en: Alexander is a farmer whose main crop is plantains. He has a parcel of land that his mother gave him before leaving when he was only 15. He has improved and expanded it; he has made it into a lovely plantain-growing land, as can be seen in the photo. His strength is the location; it is in a privileged area, a very fertile zone. He is requesting this loan for the construction of channels and to modify those that currently exist. This will allow him to better control fertilizer. His great dream is to acquire more land for the day that his mother returns, so that she will find a great land occupied by her son and be proud of him, so that they can both enjoy his extensive and fertile plantain lands.

loans.use: to build channels and modify his existing channels in order to better control fertilizer.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 47 years old, married and has eleven children, four are in school.

Edwina and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. Edwina is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Edwina has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her food vending.

With your help, Edwina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, Edwina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa owns and operates farm land where she planting corn to earn a living. She has been in business for many years and earns well with her husband. 

Marisa has been able to repay her previous loan used for the farm.  She requested a loan to purchase organic fertilizer.  In the future, Marisa plans to save her money to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben's main source of income comes from his corn and coconut production business. He has been working on his farm for nine years, earning well to sustain their living. He earns well and had repaid successfully his previous loan used for farm inputs. In 2011, Arben joined GDMPC, and he gained access to microfinance services. 

Recently, Arben has requested a new loan to purchase fertilizer and planting materials. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and planting materials.

loans.name: Amormia

texts.en:
Amormia had a transportation business in Bonifacio Misamis Occidental and has been in business for more than 13 years.  She earns a good income and has successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy accessories and tires.

Aside from this work, Amormia also has a farm where she raises fish in a pond.  It is a good business because it offers a multiple return from her investment. 

Recently, Amormia took a new loan to obtain fingerlings and feed.  She’s hopes to expand her business and wants to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to obtain fingerlings and feed.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
This is Jeremias, 56.  He is a resident of Silang, Cavite, in the Philippines.  He is married to Miriam, a midwife.  He and his manags their own household and a business.  Jeremias works hard to continually provide income for his family’s everyday expenses.

Jeremias operates a video/karaoke shop.  He provides a place in his house for customers who want to rent the video/karaoke machine.  He also operates a video games shop to make additional income.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, Jeremias is requesting a Php15,000 loan.  He will be utilizing the loan to maintain his video/karaoke machine and video games.

Jeremias dreams that his business will continue to expand and hopes to have a better living.  He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to maintain his video/karaoke machine and video games.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married with three children who attend school.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Analyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has run her general store for three years.  Analyn also earns income from farming rice.

Analyn aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani is 55 years old. She lives in the Zhinvali district with her husband and mother. Her mother is provided with a retirement pension. Nani is unemployed nowadays. She is a very hardworking woman and wants to start her own business. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,000 gel to open a market. Once the market is open, Nani will work there as a saleslady. She will control all the sales and turnover of the market and will generate profit. The start-up program will be great support for the family. Nani awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a market

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 72 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, milk, etc.

Anselma has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is 49 years old, married and has three children.  Recently she separated from her husband due to unavoidable circumstances. She lives with her three children in Kampong Cham province. 

To make a living, Sarin has been a rice farming for many years.  Her profits enable her to cover her household expenses.

Sarin is requesting a loan to improve her farming business, by purchasing supplies for her rice crop, such as: fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc. 

She is a taking out this loan because her earnings aren't enough to cover these expenses.  Sarin also hopes to continue sewing her crops, and in this way make more money and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her rice crop, such as: fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of books

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old, married with four school age children.  She has a sari-sari (convenience) store in Bonifacio, Calamba.  

She earns a meager income of Php 5,000 per month doing this work but has support the needs of her family.   

Marilyn is In need of a loan.  She joined Paglaum in 2013 and is applying fo a loan to buy soft drinks to sell.  

Marilyn wishes to sustain her business so she can continually to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  Dionesia has been in this business for 16 years.

Dionesia requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

In the future, Dionesia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and married.  She runs a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

Gina needs the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Gina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 68 years old woman who lives in the Kaspi district, with her son and his family. 

His grandsons work as security guards and daughter-in-law is a nurse at a local hospital. 

Manana needs money to finish the building of her bakery, which she has started in their yard. 

The Start Up program, a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables Manana to get a loan of $1500.  With the loan Manana will open her bakery and purchase the stock needed for baking Georgian bread.  She plans to sell her bread locally. 

Manana awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 72 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Estelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Estelita has been in this business for 19 years.

In the future, Estelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Tarpuy Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Tarpuy” está conformada por 09 socias responsables y trabajadoras que mejoran cada día. Miriam de 40 años es casada y tiene 03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas. Se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su último crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de frutas como manzana, mandarina, plátanos y uvas. El deseo de Miriam es de ver realizados profesionalmente a sus hijos. El grupo “Tarpuy” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.  Miriam se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado izquierdo,  viste blusa floreado.
texts.en: The “Tarpuy” communal bank is composed of 9 responsible and hard-working members who improve each day. Miriam is 40 years old is married and has three children. Two of them are dependent on her. She sells fruit. She feels proud as through her efforts she has been able to provide a better quality of living for her family. The last loan she requested was used to buy fruit like apples, mandarins, bananas and grapes. Miriam's wish is to see her children become professionals. The "Tarpuy " group would like to thank the people who make this loan possible. Miriam is the first person seated to the left wearing a flowered blouse.

loans.use: to buy fruit like apples, mandarins, bananas and grapes.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима очень способная женщина. Она окончила школу с отличием. Фотима данное время работает в средней школе. Она преподает персидский язык 6 и 7 классам.  Одновременно Фотима продолжает учебу в Таджикском Государственном Исламском Университете. Она учится в заочное отделение в 4 курсе. Фотима замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 10 и 8 лет. Они учатся в средней школе. Зарплата Фотимы не хватает для того, чтобы она оплатила за учебу. Фотима запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fotima is a very gifted woman. She has finished secondary school with honors. At present Fotima works as a high school teacher. She teaches the Persian language in the sixth and seventh grade. In the same time, she continues studying at the Tajik State Islam University. She is enrolled in a distance-learning program and is now in her fourth year of studies. Fotima is married and raising two children. Her children are 10 and 8 years of age. They attend secondary school. Fotima's salary is insufficient to pay for her studies. Fotima is applying for a loan to pay for her university tuition. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Jair Alberto

texts.es: Jair es un joven de tan solo 21 años de edad que de verdad sabe pensar en un futuro pues a pesar de su edad dedico su juventud al trabajo y que ejerce tres profesiones: venta de casas, venta de plátano y atiende un billar y parece increíble que un joven de 21 años de edad sea tan polifacético y más que la ciudad que opera es un sitio muy golpeado por la violencia pero esto solo es motivo de progreso para Jair que quiere ser un ejemplo para los jóvenes demostrarles que el trabajo es la mejor solución para el conflicto que para adquirir capital no es necesario estar en una banda armada y pro esto requiere un crédito para la adecuación y remodelación de su billar pues es uno de los pocos sitios de esparcimiento de sus vecinos con estas remodelación fidelizar a sus clientes y atraerá a nuevos clientes también le sitio como lugar de cierre para sus otros dos negocios su única ambición es poder generar empleos y sacar de los grupos armados a los jóvenes y que estos se conviertan en unos ciudadanos de bien
texts.en:
Jair is a young man of only 21 who really knows how to think about the future; despite his young age, he spends his youth working. He has three professions: selling houses, selling plantains, and running a billiards business. It seems incredible that a young man of 21 is so multifaceted, especially since his city is struggling with violence. This just motivates Jair to progress. He wants to be an example for the youths, to show them that work is the best solution to conflict, and that it is not necessary to be in a gang to make money. He needs a loan to fit out and remodel his billiards business. It is one of the few places of recreation for his neighbours. With this remodelling, he hopes to increase loyalty in current clients and attract new clients as well. This space is the centre of his other two businesses.
His only ambition is to be able to generate employment and get young people out of gangs, and for these youths to become good citizens.

loans.use: to fit out and remodel his billiards business, because it is one of the few places of recreation for his neighbours.

loans.name: Miguel Santana

texts.es:
El señor Miguel se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a realizar labores de campo y agricultura, a sus 64 años ha logrado acumular gran experiencia en este medio por lo cual se siente capacitado para desenvolverse fácilmente.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de quesos por diferentes zonas del municipio de Montería (Córdoba), básicamente los vende a amistades y tiendas pequeñas; pero él desea ampliar su mercado y ha decidido venderlos a algunos supermercados de la zona que ya están muy interesados en su producto. El problema es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para cubrir estos pedidos y ha decidido pedir ayuda para comprar una gran cantidad de surtido de quesitos, adicional a esto necesita comprar algunos insumos agropecuarios para continuar con su producción agrícola.
En general es un hombre de múltiples actividades y muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel has dedicated a large part of his life to farm work. At the age of 64, he has been able to gain strong experience in this area, so he feels able to do it easily.
He currently sells cheeses in various zones of the Monteria (Cordoba) municipality. He essentially sells to friends and small stores, but he wants to expand his merchandise, and has decided to sell to various supermarkets in the area which are very interested in his product.
The problem is that he does not have enough capital to cover these orders, so he has decided to request help to purchase a large quantity of cheese. In addition to this, he needs to buy some agricultural supplies in order to continue with his farming.
He is a man of many activities and is very hard-working.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell, as well as agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy chickens and construct a small pig pen.

loans.name: José Amilcar

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor estudio hasta 9° grado, es padre de dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, José a pesar de estar divorciado con la madre de sus pequeños es un hombre muy responsable y no desampara a sus hijos y lucha cada día para que nada les haga falta.
Él actualmente se desempeña como vigilante prestando sus servicios en la municipal y en su tiempo libre colabora con su madre en  el negocio familiar  que es comercializar verduras,  negocio al que se dedicaba antes de ser vigilante.

Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando para comprar materiales de construcción, como cemento, grava, arena,  los cuales utilizara para mejorar su vivienda.
Su sueño más grande es poseer su propia casa y que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old and is a very hard-working and enterprising person. He studied up to ninth grade and is a father to two children who are both in school. In spite of being divorced to the mother of his little ones, José is very responsible and does not neglect his children; he fights every day so that they do not need for anything.

José currently works as a security guard in the town and, in his spare time, he helps his mother with the family business selling vegetables. Before starting his job as a security guard, José worked only at the vegetable business.

This loan will help José to buy building materials - such as cement, gravel and sand - to make improvements to his home.

José's biggest dreams are to own his own house and for his children to graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy building materials - such as cement, gravel and sand - to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Evis Margarita

texts.es:
Evis es una mujer pujante, trabajadora y muy perseverante, ella ha sido capaz de salir adelante con su hijo de 4 años sin ayuda de nadie, pues desde que se separo de su esposo ha tomado toda la responsabilidad del hogar.
Ella tiene un galpón en el cual realiza la cría y producción de pollos de engorde y levante. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 6 años y obtuvo su experiencia con sus padres cuando era niña.
Ella tiene la esperanza de poder acondicionar su negocio, por eso acude a un apoyo económico para comprar pollos y materiales para acondicionar su galpón como: mallas y lonas.
De esta manera podrá trabajar de una manera mas cómoda y eficientemente, generando mejor rentabilidad para su negocio y su hijo.
texts.en:
Evis is a strong, hard-working and very persevering woman. She has been able to prosper with her four-year-old son with no help from anybody else. Since separating from her husband, Evis has been responsible for looking after the home.

Evis has a shed where she raises chickens to fatten up. She has been doing this work for six years, having gained experience from her parents as a child.

Evis hopes to set up her business and so has come to "Interactuar" for financial support to buy chickens and materials - such as canvas and mesh - to do up her shed.

With this loan, Evis can work more comfortably and efficiently, and earn higher profits in her business and for her son.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten up, and materials - such as canvas and mesh - to do up a shed.

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru: Зулфинисо одна из жительниц маленького городка Турсунзаде. Ей 37 лет. Зулфинисо как и многие жительницы Республики Таджикистан занимается земледелием. Ведь Таджикистан является аграрной страной. Зулфинисо готовится к очередному посеву. Но ей не хватило денег на приобретения семян, и Зулфинисо решила обратиться за кредитом. Она намерена потратить кредит на приобретения семян. Зулфинисо около 20 лет своей жизни потратила на земледелие и хочет далее продолжить деятельность в этом направлении.
texts.en: Zulfiniso lives in the small town of Tursun-zoda. She is 37 years old. As many in the Republic of Tajikistan, Zulfiniso grows produce. Agriculture is a key activity in Tajikistan. At present Zulfiniso is preparing for the planting season. She lacks the necessary funds to buy seeds, which is why she decided to apply for a loan. She intends to use this loan to buy seeds. Zulfiniso has spent over 20 years of her life doing farmwork and would like continue working in this area.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro socias trabajadoras, coordinado por la señora Margina, de 39 años de edad, casada en el domicilio vende ropa nueva y calzado su principal ayuda en el negocio es el esposo con el crédito pretende continuar invirtiendo en más mercadería  comprando camisas, pantalones, shorts, brasieres, blúmer, etc. El grupo lo integran tres socias más, la señora Laura de 57 años de edad la cual vende frijoles por sacos o al por mayor, la señora Carmela con 39 años propietaria de una pulpería y la señora Ana de 52 años ambas propietaria de una pulpería en el domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four hard-working members, coordinated by Margina, age 39. She is married and sells shoes and new clothing from home. Her husband is her main support in the business. With this loan she plans to continue investing in more merchandise. She will buy shirts, pants, shorts, bras, underwear, etc. 
There are three other members in the group: Laura, age 57, who sells beans in bags or wholesale; Carmela, age 39, who owns a small grocery store; and Ana, age 52, who also has a small grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as shirts, pants, bras, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a widowed woman. She has two children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail business selling fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy place, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of sufficient working capital.

Christine will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a la situación económica que vivía su familia esta acompañado, tiene dos hijos el de 17 años estudia primer año de bachillerato y el otro octavo grado, ellos ayudan al trabajo en el campo, y solo ellos viven con él.

José ha trabajado toda su vida en el cultivo de la sandia, trabajo que prendió de su padre, actualmente trabaja de vigilante en una empresa telefónica, en sus días libres se dedica al trabajo en el campo, la distancia de su trabajo formal es de unos 25 minutos en bus, y donde siembra la sandia esta a una distancia de 25 minutos de su casa, al trabajo del campo le ayudan sus hijos.

El dinero lo utilizara en la siembra de sandia, pago de alquiler de la tierra, compra de semilla y fertilizantes, esto le ayudara a tener el capital que necesita para cultivar y aumentara sus ingresos

Su sueño principal es seguir teniendo vida y salud para sacar adelante a sus hijos, pagar el crédito y tener las puertas abiertas a futuros créditos.
texts.en:
José, age 40, studied up to grade 6 because of his family's economic situation. He has two children. The 17-year-old is in his first year of university, and the other child is in grade 8. They help with the farm work, and they are the only people who live with him.
José has worked all his life as a watermelon cultivator. He learned this work from his father. He currently works as a security guard at a telephone company. In his free time he works in the fields. It takes him 25 minutes by bus to get to his formal job. His watermelon crops are located 25 minutes from his home. His children help him with the farm work.
He will use this loan to cultivate watermelon; he will pay the rent on the land, and buy seeds and fertilizer. This will help him to have the capital that he needs to cultivate and to increase his income.
His main dream is to keep having life and health in order to get his children ahead, as well as to repay his loan and have the doors open for future loans.

loans.use: to plant watermelon, pay rent on his land, and buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Ignovación Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por  tres socios exitosos y coordinado por la señora María 32 años de edad y acompañada, se dedica a vender tortillas y fritanga tiene 5 años establecido el negocio y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de maíz por quintal, carne de res, platano verde, platano maduro, arroz, repollo, tomate, etc. Otro socio es el señor Carlos 24 de años comercializa ropa nueva, y la señora Jenifer 21 años de edad se dedica a vender bisutería entre ellos pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc.
texts.en: This communal bank is made up of three successful members coordinated by María. She is 32 years old and in a common-law relationship. For the last 5 years she has been selling tortillas and fritanga (home style Nicaraguan foods). She has requested the loan to buy corn by the quintal, beef, plantains, bananas, rice, cabbage, tomato, etc. The other members are Carlos who is 24 years old and sells new clothing and Jenifer who is 21 years old and sells jewellery like bracelets, rings, earrings etc.

loans.use: to buy corn, beef, plantain, bananas, rice, cabbage, tomato, etc.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is 30 years old. He is the third-born in a family of six. He is married and has two children, ages 9 and 2. His 9-year-old son is in third grade. Jonas lives in Chililabombwe, where he operates a Zoona mobile money transfer business.

Jonas describes himself as a hard worker who has passed through a lot of ups and downs in his life. He says this makes him very strong and focused in whatever he does. He enjoys running his business because it is a way for him to provide for his family. He says he also gets to meet a lot of people in his community as he spends most of his time at his green booth, where he serves customers who need to access financial services.

Jonas will use his loan to purchase three trading booths so that he can grow his business and service more customers in need of mobile money services. He is hopeful that once he gets his Kiva loan he will be able to grow his business and earn more profits. He plans to reinvest the profits back into the business and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase three trading booths so that he can grow his business and service more customers in need of mobile money services

loans.name: Flor Del Pedregon Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro socias trabajadoras, coordinado por la señora Flora de 59 años de edad, tiene a cargo un nieto de 10 años de edad, comercializa ropa de segunda calidad y calzado de manera ambulante con 8 años de experiencia en este negocio y requiere el crédito para la compra de paca de camisas, vestidos, pantalones, shorts, etc. En el grupo también se encuentra la socia Brenda, 24 años se dedica a la venta de bisuterías en su domicilio, y la señora Telma 36 años vende ropa nueva y comida en su domicilio, y la señora Ana de 55 años se dedica a comercializar cosméticos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group consists of four hard-working members. It is led by Flora, who is 59, and who looks after her 10-year-old grandson. She sells clothing seconds and shoes as a travelling vendor, and has some 8 years' experience in this job. She needs the loan to buy bundles of items such as shirts, dresses, trousers and shorts.

Brenda, who is 24 , is another member of the group, and she sells costume jewellery from her home. Telma 36, sells new clothes and food from home, and Ana, 55, sells cosmetics in her community.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as jeans, shirts, blouses, skirts and all kinds of shoes.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps rabbits and grows crops. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Margienita

texts.en:
Margienita is 56 years old, married and has seven children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Margienita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Margienita has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Isabel

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad,  con mucho esfuerzo de sus padres lograron que cursara un estudio hasta un tercer grado, luego por la condición económica no pudo seguir estudiando, luego se acompaño y empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta, en compañía de su compañera de vida. Su hijo tiene 3 meses de edad. 

José se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y también al destazo de semovientes, esta segunda actividad la a realizado desde que estaba muy pequeño ya que su padre también se dedicaba a esta misma actividad, después a logrado su pequeño lugar de destazo siempre en compañía de su compañera de vida.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para arreglar una pequeña galera para mejorar la atención en el negocio de destazo.

Su deseo es arreglar mejor su vivienda para que su familia pueda tener una mejor  situación de vida y darle los estudios a su  hijo que puedan asistir a la universidad  y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old and through much effort on the part of his parents manged to study up to Grade 3. He could not continue after that for economic reasons. Later he entered a common-law relationship and began to work for himself, along with his life partner. He has a 3 month old son.

José is a farmer who also butchers animals. He has done this second activity since he was small as his father did the same thing. He built his small butchering place along with his life companion.

The loan that José is requesting is to fix up a small shed to improve the conditions of his butchering service. His desire is to improve his house so that his family can have better living conditions and provide education for his son, so he can go to university and have a better future.

loans.use: to fix up a small shed to improve his butchering business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, leaf fertilizer, and other items for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es: Dorotea tiene 52 años de  edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo quienes juntos se ganan la vida honradamente y llevan el sustento a su hogar. Dorotea y su esposo poseen un molino de nixtamal en el cual muelen variedad de semillas como: maíz, café, arroz, frijoles, etc. Este molino funciona a base de electricidad lo cual les genera muchos gastos y aveces no ven muchas ganancias por causa de los costos de la energía. En vista a que el negocio es rentable ya que no existen otros molinos cerca han tomado la decisión de buscar nuevas alternativas para hacerlo trabajar. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de un motor de diésel para generar electricidad y hacer funcionar el molino y así esperan poder captar un poco más de ganancias que les permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dorotea is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. Together they earn an honest living and sustain their home. Dorotea and her husband own a grain mill, in which they grind a variety of products, such as: corn, coffee, rice, beans, etc. 
The mill is electric and is very expensive to run, which means that sometimes they don't earn much after paying their energy bills. Still, the mill is profitable and there aren't others like it nearby, so they have decided to look for new ways to get it to function. 
This is why they have requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a diesel motor which will generate the electricity that the mill needs to run. In this way they hope to keep a larger portion of their profits and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel motor to generate electricity and power her grain mill.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADENYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sirifila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments et d’habillements.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe BADENYA sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente NENE, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habits. Elle compte acheter des pièces de pagnes wax et des pagnes Bazin chez ses fournisseurs à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante dans les villages environnants à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The BADENYA group is composed of married women who are, on average, 41 years old, and have four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Sirifila, in the administrative center of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro (second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They met through family, neighborhood and friendship connections. They are all involved in selling grains, condiments and clothing. The BADENYA group are asking for their twenty-third loan. In order to satisfy the increasing demand of their clients, they are asking Soro Yiriwaso for another loan, in order to purchase the afore-mentioned merchandise. 
Nene, who can be seen in the photo standing second from the right, is currently a vendor of clothing. She plans to purchase traditional wax cloth and Bazin cloth from wholesalers in Bamako. She then resells them for cash, and sometimes as a door to door salespersons, in the surrounding villages, to a mixed clientele. She hopes to earn a monthly benefit of 80 000 FCFA, that she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase traditional style cloths

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is 54 years old and a single mother of three children. She lives in a rural village in the Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. As a responsible mother of three children, Im works hard to support her family. She earns a living with a business farming rice and also earns additional income by working as a paid day laborer. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years now and has support from her children.

Im has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from Hattha Kaksekar and has successfully paid back her loans. As of now, she is asking for a loan of 600,000 riels to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizers, seeds and herbicides, for her crop. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizers, seeds and herbicides, for her crop.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза родилась в 1977 году. Она разведенная. Она жила несколько лет с мужем и развелась. После развода она вернулась в родительский дом. В те годы семья родителей была большая и малообеспеченная. Было очень трудно жить на иждивении братьев. Она была вынуждена начать свой бизнес, так как у нее не было высшего образования. Итак, 7 лет назад она обратилась в ИМОН и получила свой первый займ. Фируза начала бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Постепенно она развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она имеет свою точку продажи и постоянных покупателей. Она хочет купить детскую одежду, чтобы расширить оборотный капитал, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки детской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Firuza was born in 1977. She is divorced. She lived for several years with her husband and then got a divorce. After her divorce she returned to her parents' home. At that time her parents had a large low-income family. It was very hard for  Firuza to be financially supported by her brothers. Firuza was forced to launch her own business since she did not have higher education. Thus even years ago she reached out to IMON and obtained her first loan. Firuza started a business buying and selling children's clothing. She grew her business gradually. At present she has her own sales stand and loyal customers. She would like to buy children's clothing and expand her working capital, but lacks the funds. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 7,500 TJS to buy children's clothing. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy children clothes by increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Kodjogan

texts.fr: Styliste et modéliste de profession, Kodjogan âgé de 28ans se bat chaque fois pour apporter le meilleur de lui même à sa famille.(Il est marié et père d'01 enfant). Après sa formation, il a ouvert son atelier en 2011 et coud des habits aux clients. Manquant de fonds pour acheter de la machine à broder, il demande son second crédit à WAGES. Il espère à l'avenir épargner pour fonder une école de stylisme et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en: Kodjogan is a 28 years old fashion designer, who struggles to bring the best of himself to his family (he is married, and the father of one child). After undergoing training, he opened his workshop in 2001, and sew clothing for clients. Lacking funds to purchase an embroidery machine, he is asking for his second loan from WAGES. He hopes to save money in the future in order to establish a design school and ensure the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with one school-going child. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Esther has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past 3 years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future. With this loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 47 years old and married. She has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Cecilia has been pig fattening for 19 years now and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Janeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Janeth Es una mujer de 30 años de edad con dos hijos que vive con un hombre en una unión libre, se dedica básicamente a la cría de pollos y la venta por catálogo ya que en su primer negocio identifico mucho tiempo muerto  y empelo la venta pro catalogo para aprovecharlos, como el trabajo de su pareja no es estable decidió adquirir su propio negocio por si un día le falta trabajo a su conyugue pueda asumir todos los gastos de la casa y más a un que tiene dos hijos menores de edad por los que da la vida, para esto usa una frase muy colombiana que dice “me quito el bocado de comida de la boca por dárselo a mis hijos”, Janeth no se conforma con lo que tiene y quiere expandirse para ellos solicita un crédito para la compra de cuido, pollos y algunos productos por catálogo que se encuentra en promoción y de los cuales puede sacar un muy buen provecho, cumpliendo su sueño de ver como prospera y se expande su empresa y sabe que los únicos beneficiados con estos progresos son sus amados hijos
texts.en:
Janeth is a 30 year old woman with two children who lives with a man in a common-law relationship. She raises chickens and sells products from catalogs. Her first occupation leaves her with a lot of free time so she started selling from catalogs to take advantage of this. As her partner's work is not stable she decided to get her own business so that one day if her partner has no work she can assume paying the household expenses. Plus having two young children who she would do anything for, in a very typical Colombian saying " I take the food out of my mouth to give it to my children."

Janeth is not content to stay as she is, she wants to expand her business. So she is requesting a loan to buy chickens and some catalog products that are on special promotion and which she can sell for a good profit. This will fulfill her dreams of how to proper and expand her business and know that her beloved children will be the ones to benefit from this.

loans.use: to buy chickens and catalog products on sale.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Зарина, не отвечает стандартам жилья и она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом. Ей 34 года, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети учатся в средней школе и всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но их доход от выращивания сельхоз культур не достаточно для этого. Она должна отремонтировать все комнаты, так как все комнаты грязные и трещины на полу. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: The house in which Zarina lives does not comply with the housing standards, and she must have it renovated immediately. She is 34 years old, married, and raising two children. Children attend secondary school. They keep asking their parents to renovate their home, but the family's income from growing farm produce  is insufficient cover these costs. Zarina needs to have all rooms renovated as the room [paint?] is dirty and there are cracks in the floors. Zarina is applying for a loan in the amount of 4,500 TJS to buy construction materials such as cement, wood etc to renovate her house. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. for  renovating her house.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a responsible mother. She raised her family and sustains their living in a decent way, such as raising hogs for income and selling food and snacks to the people in her village. 

Gina is now 44 years old and has four children. Her youngest child is still studying. Her spouse is a carpenter. Gina is now asking for additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy hog feed and medicine for sustaining her business. She will also buy biscuits, breads, candies, and hot dogs to sell. 

Their income goes to pay for bills at home and other expenses.

Gina hopes to keep maintaining a good flow of her businesses and earn more funds for her family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and medicines

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is a farmer who plants and harvests rice and vegetables for sale. His wife is his companion in planting and harvesting their crops. They aimed to improve their farming business in order to increase their production and income to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

Having inadequate capital, Jaime would like to avail a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in planting rice and vegetables to sell. 

Being a hardworking father, he believes that he will improve their farming business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in planting rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Koda, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales et d’ l’habillement.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MAMOU, première personne à partir de la droite n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de céréales. Elle compte acheter des  sacs de mil sur place avec les producteurs du village. Ces sacs seront vendus en détail et en espèce à Dioïla à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group is composed of married woman who are, on average, 41 years old and have seven children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kodo, commune of Massigui, administrative center of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They met through family, neighborhood and friendship affiliations. They are all involved in the sale of prepared foods, grains and clothing. The women in the BENKADI group are asking for their eighth loan from SORO YIRIWASO, in order to respond to increasing customer requests.
Mamou, seen in the far right of the photo, is currently involved in the sale of grains. She plans to purchase large sacks of millet from the producers in the village, and then sell the grain for cash in Dioïla to a mixed clientele. She hopes to earn a monthly benefit of 20 000 FCFA that she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase grains

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is 51 years old and a widow with three children. Her youngest child is still studying. She supports her child's education expenses through her income in the retail business. She patiently sells grocery items to the people in her village. Teodora is now asking for a loan of 21,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, noodles and biscuits to sell in her store. Additional stocks of merchandise will help increase her sales, thus gaining more profits too. Someday, she hopes to develop her business and establish a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, noodles and biscuits to sell in her store

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 55-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from six years to 18 years. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stocks of meat. He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stocks of meat. His business goal is to improve within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans of KES 70,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of meat

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and soap.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Rosalie aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and soap

loans.name: Basiran

texts.en:
Basiran is 58 years old, and she is the mother of seven children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband sells dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffalos and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities through his earnings from the milk sales. He speaks with a tone that is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. 

He is in need of one buffalo to increase his income. So, Basiran asked for this loan. In this way she can support her husband's business.
She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo in order to produce and sell milk

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga works hard to support her three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Domingga requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Domingga is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. 

Mesaid has operated a beauty salon business for the past seven years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from her general store. Victoria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase sugar, coffee, milk, etc. for her cafeteria business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, milk, etc. for her cafeteria business

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 51 years old; she is a mother of three children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Bushra has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Bushra is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a 36-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. He manufactures the iron accessories for doors and windows and provides door-to-door services to weld broken accessories.

His welding plant became out of order due to overheating and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant but does not have the money due to a lot of household expenses. Therefore, Farida has requested a loan from BRAC, an active Kiva field partner, so that her husband can buy a welding plant for manufacturing.  

Farida thanks Kiva and Field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new welding plant to weld iron accessories for doors and windows.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for more than five years. He earns an income from this as well as from his farm, which is their main source of income. 

With his generated revenue, he has successfully repaid the previous loan for his retail business. Recently, he has requested a loan to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew is a 32-year-old married man. He settled to earn his living in Tangub City, Philippines, together with his child. Over the past 5 years, Matthew has been able to run a retail store that absolutely meets the market primary demands. Up to now, the business has been doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures.

Recently, Matthew took out a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell in order to increase sales. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Matthew expects an increase in sales so as to expand his business and improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Teresia, a woman of strength. She is a mother with six children dependent on her. She lives in Nyamira, a remote village in Kenya where the main staple food is banana! To provide her family with a decent living, for the last 30 years Teresia has been selling milk, eggs, tea and vegetables produced on her farm to the local market. She also gets involved in numerous seasonal businesses to make extra money for personal expenses. 

She is appreciative of the fact that farming, "creation of food" as she calls it, gave her a purpose in life. In particular, she is very passionate about dairy farming. She encourages other farmers to keep quality dairy animals because they are lucrative. She makes the most profit by selling milk daily. However, limited funds for growth is her biggest challenge. Most of her income is spent on farming related costs due to expensive inputs.

Teresia is seeking a loan to purchase another dairy animal. She has conducted a feasibility study. She discovered there is a big demand for milk and an even bigger supply of milk. This has led to reduced prices and other market conditions since producers have no bargaining power over buyers. 
With your loan, Teresia is going use the milk from the additional cow to venture into the value addition chain. She will still be selling raw milk to repay the loan and sustain the agribusiness at first. In time, she will start enjoying bigger profit margins from ghee, cheese, yogurt and other products. Once the value chain business picks up, she will transition her whole dairy operation in a parallel shift to the value added chain.

At the end of the day, Teresia is just looking for ways to generate more income so that her family can enjoy better living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en: Rose Marie is 33 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Rose Marie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Rose Marie has been in this business for 1 year. She requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is 49 years old and married with 10 children, 6 of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family, and runs a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy household goods to sell like soap, chips, eggs, noodles, and canned goods.

Genoveva has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling used clothes.

She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy household goods to sell like soap, chips, eggs, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Sheree Ann

texts.en:
Sheree Ann is a 36-year-old married woman. She settled to earn her living in Misamis Occidental, Philippines, together with her three children. Over the past eight years, Sheree Ann was able to put up a rice farm while her husband works abroad. Until now, the farm is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's expenditures.
 
Sheree Ann joined GDMPC in 2012 to have an easy access to financial services. She borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer in order to improve her farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Sheree Ann expects an increase in sales so as to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita plants, harvests, and sells corn for a living with her family. She has been in her business for many years and earns well to sustain their living. With her income, her previous loan used for fertilization of farm was successfully repaid. 

Recently, Teresita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 32 years old, married, and blessed with four children. She is engaged in raising hogs to help her husband in gaining income. They aim to uplift their status of living in order to educate their children. 

With this regard, Amelia is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy hog feeds, vitamins, additional piglets, and materials needed to improve the pig pen. Despite hardships and difficulties in life, she has the determination to improve the business. She hopes that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, additional piglets, and materials needed to improve the pig pen.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a 33-year-old resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. The area where she lives was hit by Typhoon Haiyan last November 2013. After several months, she and her neighbors are recovering and moving on. She is living with her partner, Teddy, a fisherman and they have four children. They both work hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

Loida's business and source of income is found in the sea. She, her husband and some workers swim under water to get sea cucumbers. These sea cucumbers are boiled and then dried by smoke. When they are dry, they sell them. Chinese people are their main clients. They use this as an ingredient for their soup. A kilo of dried cucumber is sold at PHP 8,000. She also has a piggery for additional income. Her minimum monthly income is PHP 80,000.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy a new boat that will be used for her business.

Loida dreams that her business will recover fully. She also hopes to open her variety store, which was destroyed by the typhoon. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for a new boat

loans.name: Dianah

texts.en: Dianah is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows bananas and coffee and keeps cows, which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a fertile place and her primary customers are factories and individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low prices. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy seedlings and animal feeds. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and animal feed

loans.name: Winecita

texts.en:
Winecita is 60 years old, married and has five children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising chickens in the Philippines. Winecita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Winecita has been raising chickens for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Liney

texts.es: Liney toda la vida se había desempeñado como administradora de un negocio familiar operado por su padrastro el cual era el alquiler de lavadoras actividad que desarrollo por varios años hasta juntar un monto para iniciar su propio negocio de alquiler de lavadoras en su propia casa con dos objetivos generar mayores ingresos y poder estar al cuidado de sus hijos pues es una madre soltera, solicita un crédito para la compra de ciertas herramientas para reparar algunas lavadoras que no se encuentran operando y que le están generando perdida, su gran sueño es poder brindarles todas las comodidades a sus dos hijos son la luz de su vida su motor de inspiración por esto quiso empelar el negocio en su casa para no perderse ni un segundo del crecimiento de estos formándolos con valores y aptitudes para que sean unos ciudadanos que contribuyan con el crecimiento del país
texts.en:
All her life, Liney has been the  manager of a family business operated by her stepfather, that business being the hire of washing machines. She developed the business over several years until she had the money to start her own washing machine rental business at home. Her two goals were to generate more income and to be able to care for her children, as she is a single mother.

She is asking for a loan to buy certain tools to repair some washing machines which are not operating and are losing her money. Her dream is to be able to give her two children - who are the light of her life and the driving force of her inspiration - everything they need.
