This is why she wanted to run the business from home, so that she would not miss a second of their growing-up,  training them with values ​​and skills so that they will be citizens who contribute to the growth of the country.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair some washing machines which are not operating and are losing her money

loans.name: Nelson René

texts.es:
Nelson de 56 años de edad, se a dedicado a trabajar desde muy pequeño a la agricultura sus padres con mucho esfuerzo lograron que pudiese cursar hasta un 5º grado, luego  tenia que seguir trabajando con su padre y sus hermanos, despues se caso y procrearon 4 hijos de los cuales todos están acompañados y fuera del hogar solo vive con su esposa.


Nelson se a dedicado a la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño se a dedicado a trabajar la agricultura en compañía de su padre y sus hermanos, después que se caso empezó a trabajar por su cuenta, hoy en día esta cultivando 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y una de frijol, ademas se dedica a cuidar animales bovinos, en época de invierno tiene que trasladarse de su vivienda  al lugar de trabajo a 2 kilómetros de distancia esto lo hace en vehículo que transita por ese lugar no obstante este pasa una vez al día y regresa por la tarde,  después tiene que andar cuidando sus animales ademas cuida otros bovinos, por los que recibe una compensación monetaria, su esposa se dedica solo a los oficios domésticos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la compra de insumos agrícolas, abonos, fertilizantes y para rentar las tierras y la preparación de las mismas.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y valerse por si mismo, ya que sus hijos ya los saco adelante en su vida.
texts.en:
Nelson, 56 years old, has been working in agriculture from a young age. With great effort, his parents put him through school until the 5th grade. Then he had to continue working with his father and his siblings. He later got married and had 4 children, all of whom are in relationships and out of the house. He lives with only his wife.

Nelson has been working in agriculture with his father and siblings from a young age. After he got married, he started to work on his own. Today he farms 14,000 square meters of corn, and one of beans. He also takes care of cattle. In the winter, he has to commute from his house to his place of work 2 kilometers away. He does this in a vehicle that goes that way, but it only goes by once a day and returns in the afternoon. Afterwards, he has to tend to his animals. He also takes care of other cattle, for which he gets a monetary compensation. His wife focuses on household chores.

The loan for which he is applying is to purchase agricultural inputs, compost, and fertilizers, and to lease and prepare the land.

His dream is to continue working and to be self-sufficient, since he has already gotten his children ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, compost, and fertilizers, and to lease and prepare the land.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 30 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to resell, such as shampoos, soaps, creams, coffees, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Virgie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and earns an income from farming vegetables.

Virgie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to resell, such as shampoos, soaps, creams, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Yunilyn

texts.en:
Yunilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients, such as sugar, milk, canned goods, etc. for her food vending business.

Yunilyn has been in this business for two years. Yunilyn earns more income from raising chickens and pre-paid mobile loads.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, such as sugar, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Bonanza Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias trabajadoras y coordinado por la señora Claudia de 42 años de edad, acompañada se dedica al mantenimiento en refrigeración siendo de principal ayuda el esposo quien es técnico en refrigeración y tiene 12 años de haber  establecido el negocio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de aceite y herramientas a utilizar. En el grupo también lo integra  la socia Katia 26 años de edad se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva y posee pulpería en su domicilio y la socia Ligia comerciante de ropa nueva en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is composed of three working partners and is coordinated by Claudia who is 42 years of age and married. She works in  refrigeration maintenance. Her main help in this is her husband who is a refrigeration engineer. The business has been established for 12 years. She is asking for the loan to buy oil and tools. 

The group also includes, as partners, Katia who is 26 years old, sells new clothes and has a grocery store in  her home and Ligia who sells new clothes from her home.

loans.use: to buy oil and tools

loans.name: Huệ

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ works in agriculture, farming food.

Huệ is 45 years old and married with two children.
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build toilet .

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build toilet.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl manages a fishpond where she raises fish, crabs, and shrimp for sale, while her husband works as an Oversees Filipino Worker (OFW). 

With her generated income, Cheryl successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative, that she used to buy fingerlings. 
Aside from this, she also has a farm, growing and harvesting rice and selling it in volume. 

Recently, Cheryl requested a new loan to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, 34 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She's been into hog-raising business for almost two years, and earning a net income of PHP 4,000 per hog. Her profits in her business are spent on the school allowances of her children. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase hog feeds. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds.

loans.name: Angilou

texts.en:
Angilou earns a living from raising pigs while her husband works as a welder. For two years, Angilou has earned well and sustained the business. She had also bought some home improvements like appliances.

To buy feeds, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit, which she had joined this year. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house and for business improvements.

loans.use: to buy feeds

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora works hard to support her family. Teodora is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients, such as spices, meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

Teodora has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, such as spices, meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 49 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to resell, such as shampoos, groceries, etc.

Merly has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items, such as shampoos, groceries, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Julius, a father of 2 from Kisii, a rural town in Kenya with a hot and wet climate. Julius is a mixed farmer with over 6 years of experience. He makes money selling milk, eggs, tea and vegetables produced on his farm. He also makes extra income engaging in other personal businesses.

He finds farming, especially dairy farming, to be enjoyable and profitable. The biggest challenge for all farmers in the region is lack of a good road network. Poor roads make it hard for farmers to transport their produce to the market.

Julius is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Milk prices in Kisii are always high and stable. Julius is determined to acquire more cows and produce more milk. He is also breeding his cows with the assistance of an agricultural extension officer to ensure the calves inherit the most desirable traits from pedigree bulls. "Higher quality cows produce much more milk than regular ones. My dream is to own a couple of pedigree cows." Julius said. 

With your loan, Julius is going to improve his agribusiness and produce more milk. The extra income will be ploughed back to the business. In the long run, Julius will be able to provide for his two sons the life he never had growing up.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 58 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for 8 years and also earns an income from general store. Cecilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ernicita

texts.en:
Ernicita is 38 years old and has six children.  Ernicita is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ernicita requested a 11,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds to sell.  Ernicita has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ernicita would like to save money so she could afford to send her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Tulio Ermes

texts.es:
Tulio de 72 años de edad,  pertenencia a una familia bastante numerosa y de muy escasos recursos económicos y no le pudieron dar ningún tipo de estudio económico, ya que tenia que trabajar todos los días en compañía de su padre y sus hermanos ya que siendo el mayor tenia que hacerle frente a la obligación, sus hijos ya son mayores y están acompañados uno de ellos hizo la vivienda en la misma propiedad donde tiene su casa. Su esposa hace varios años que fallecio.

Él se a dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño en compañía de su padre y sus hermanos, hoy en día se dedica a la misma actividad y también a la crianza de ganado de repasto, en época de invierno se dedica a trabajar 7,000 metros cuadros de maíz en esta época lo a hace todos los días desde la mañana y por la tarde se dedica al trabajo de  jornal a otros agricultores, su hijo quien vive en su misma propiedad le ayuda al trabajo agrícola.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es  para comprar insumos agrícolas, abonos, fertilizantes y preparar las tierras agrícolas.

Espera arreglar su vivienda ya que para la época de invierno se le penetra agua a su casa y quiere arreglarla.
texts.en:
Tulio, 72 years old, belongs to a fairly large and economically disadvantaged family. They were not able to give him any type of education, since he had to work everyday with his father and brothers. Being the oldest, he had to face his obligations. His children are grown and in relationships. One of them built his house on the same property where he has his house. His wife passed away several years ago.

He has made his living working in agriculture since he was very young and worked with his father and brothers. Today, he makes his living the same way, and also raising pasture cattle.

In the winter, he works 7,000 square meters of corn. During this season, he does it every morning, and in the afternoons he works as a day laborer for other farmers. His son who lives on the same property helps him with the agricultural work.

The loan for which he is applying is to buy agricultural inputs, compost, and fertilizers, and to prepare the agricultural lands. He hopes to fix up his house, because in the winter, water gets in and he wants to fix it.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, compost, and fertilizers, and to prepare the agricultural lands.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is aged 45, and is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her elder son has been running a small garment shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for his family. The summer season has started in Pakistan, so he wants to purchase a new variety of clothing, such as cotton shirts, pent, caps, suits etc. He always tries to establish his businesses through offering latest garments. 

To enhance his business he wants to buy more stock of new garments. Therefore, Sakina requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to buy new variety of garments. She is thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more garments for her son's shop.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана живет в городе Никополе. Она продает женский трикотаж, нижнее белье, халаты, пижамы, пр. Светлана использовала предыдущий КИВА кредит для  увеличения  ассортимента весеннего товара. У Светланы — 2 торговых точки — одна в арендованном магазине, а вторая — на одном из местных рынков. Торговля пошла хорошо и Светлана нуждается в дополнительных средствах, чтобы сделать дополнительные закупки товара. Более широкий выбор товара поможет Светлане развивать свой бизнес и дальше, при этом помогая финансово детям за счет полученной прибыли.
texts.en: Svetlana lives in Nikopol. She sells women's knitwear, underwear, robes, pajamas and other clothing. Svetala used the previous Kiva loan to increase the assortment of spring clothing. She has two vendor locations: one is in the rented out store and the second one is on one of the local markets. The sales were good and now Svetlana needs additional finances to make additional inventory purchases. A wider selection of inventory will help Svetlana grow her business further and also the income from the loan will help her children financially.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing inventory for spring.

loans.name: 03 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mơ has a retail business selling groceries. Mơ has been involved in this business for 7 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Mơ is 61 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. With her business profit, Mơ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and to build a new house and travel for vacation within the country.

Mơ is the group leader of the 03 Trường Thi solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Mơ's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW).

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products for sale

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María de 48 años de edad, se ha dedicado a trabajar en compañía de su madre, ya que su familia tenia bastantes problemas económicos que los llevo a que ella solo pudiese cursar hasta un 6º grado, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y unos se separaron del grupo familiar las dos hijas  menores están con ella, pero no estudian ya que son madres solteras, su compañero de vida  de María quien se dedica a la pesca artesanal todos los días en la laguna que se encuentra en la comunidad.

Ella  se dedica a trabajar en la venta de frutas, verduras, y también venta por catalogo, esto lo aprendió de su madre cuando estaba pequeña. Estos trabajos lo  tiene que hacerlo casa por casa lo hace todos los días por toda la comunidad y lugares cercanos de la comunidad, sus hijas quienes también le ayudan a los gastos familiares.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar mas productos para la venta de frutas y verduras y ademas para gastos familiares ya que su hija tuvo problemas de salud y a tenido que gastar para que pudiese curarse.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y ayudar a sus hijas quienes han quedado con ella, y en un futuro arreglar la vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 48 and has worked with her mother. Her family had a lot of financial issues, which meant that she could only stay in school until 6th grade. Her children are now grown-up, and some have left home. The two younger daughters still live with her, but they don't study because they are single mums. María's life partner works every day as a traditional fisherman at the neighbourhood lagoon. María sells fruit, vegetables and catalogue items. She learnt this activity from her mother when she was little. She has to do this work going from house to house every day throughout the neighbourhood and surrounding places. Her daughters also help out with the household bills.

She is asking for this loan through CREDICAMPO to buy more fruit and vegetable produce and also to cover household costs, because her daughter had health problems and she has had to spend money to help her get better.

María's dream is to carry on working and help the two daughters who still live at home with her. In the future she also wants to sort out the house.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetable produce and also to cover some family costs for her sick daughter.

loans.name: Neresa

texts.en:
Neresa is 49 years old, married and lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband works abroad and she helps him by growing rice on their own farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years.

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. She plans to expand their farm in order to generate more income for the future of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business selling soap, cooking oil, water, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

Rose will use this 30,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy more stock of soap, cooking oil, sugar and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soap, cooking oil, sugar and other items

loans.name: Ricardo Amilcar

texts.es:
Ricardo de 26 años de edad, solo ha estudiado 3º año de bachillerato,  es una persona que está soltera, él vive con la familia y por lo tanto nadie depende de ella también.

El cliente tiene una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad se a dedicado a este negocio por más de tres y manifiesta que es una fuente de ingreso para mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia. Se dedicó por que le gusta vender mercadería solamente tiene este tipo de ingreso de la tienda y la distancia de su casa al negocio esta como cuatro  kilómetros,  en el negocio se involucra un hermano y la hermana y su horario de atención son de 6.00 am a 5.00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar aceite, bebidas, detergentes, huevos, azúcar, galletas, pan, helados, etc.  de productos. Con el financiamiento se mejorara más el negocio también sus ganancias y tener una mejor la calidad de vida. 

Los sueños para el negocio es incrementarlo para que sea más grande y las ganancias las utilizara para compra de mas productos de la tienda y algunas cosas de uso personal.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 26 years old and only studied up to third year of high school. He is single and lives with family; Ricardo has no dependents.

Ricardo has a shop where he sells staple goods. He has had the business for over three years and tells us that it is a source of income that allows him to improve his and his family's quality of life. Ricardo chose to open a shop because he likes selling merchandise. This is his only source of income. The shop is four kilometres from his home. It is open from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. and he works there with his brother and sister.

Ricardo is applying for this loan in order to buy oil, drinks, detergents, eggs, sugar, biscuits, bread, ice cream and more. With this loan, the business and Ricardo's profits will improve, and he will have a higher quality of life.

Ricardo's dreams for the business are to expand it and to use his profits to buy more products for the shop and to buy a few personal items.

loans.use: to buy oil, drinks, detergents, eggs, sugar, biscuits, bread, ice cream and more.

loans.name: Madioleth

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 54 años de edad, casada, con 6 hijos, de los cuales 3 son mayores de edad e independientes y 3 cursan su secundaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace aproximadamente 4 años estableció su negocio de venta de ropa usada y confección de ropa. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar más pacas de ropa para mujer y hombres para incrementar su inventario. También confecciona uniformes, pantalones y blusas para damas y caballeros. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Madioleth is originally from Waspam. She is 54 years old, married and has six children. Three of the Madioleth's children are now independent adults, while the youngest three are in secondary school. In order to earn her own income, around four years ago Madioleth started her own business selling second-hand clothes, and making new clothes. She is applying for a second loan in order to buy more clothes for men and women so as to increase her stock. Madioleth also makes uniforms, trousers and blouses for men and women. Madioleth's dream is for her business to expand.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Guetsey

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 36 años de edad, casada, con 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 se encuentra en edad escolar y un pequeño de 3 años. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 7 años estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de calzados y cosméticos por catálogos. Inicio con un préstamo realizado a un familiar, no obstante con el objetivo de incrementar su inventario solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar sandalias, zapatos para adolescentes, hombres y mujeres en Masaya y ofrecerlos a precios accesibles en Waspam. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y que sea un negocio prospero
texts.en:
She is native to Waspam. She is 36, married with 3 children, two of whom are school age and the small one is 3 years old. With the purpose of having her own source of income, 7 years ago she established her small business selling shoes and catalog cosmetics. She started with a loan taken out by a family member.

However, with the goal of increasing her inventory, she is applying for her third loan to buy sandals, shoes for teens, men and women in Masaya and offer them at accessible prices in Waspam. Her dream is to improve the infrastructure of her business and that it becomes a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy sandals, shoes for adolescents, men and women in Masaya and offer them at accessible prices in Waspam.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines and also earns additional income from direct selling Natasha and Avon products. Marilou is borrowing 28,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her business

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa  propia junto a sus tres hijos. Rosa es una mujer emprendedora y muy conocida en su comunidad como una mujer integra quien se gana la vida honradamente. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es el que le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar  por mucho tiempo. Con el fin de mantener su negocio activo por mucho más tiempo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de insumos como: maíz, frijoles, queso y una plancha más grande para hacer las ricas tortillas y además para hacer ricas pupusas para atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 and lives in her own house with her three children. Rosa is an enterprising woman and very well known in her community as a woman with integrity who earns her living honorably. She makes her living selling tortillas. This business is her main source of income and it is what has allowed her to bring money to her home for a long time.

With the goal of maintaining her business active for much more time, she has made the decision to apply for this loan from FUSAI. She will invest it in her business in the purchase of supplies like: corn, beans, cheese and a larger griddle to make delicious tortillas and also delicious pupusas. This will attract more customers so that they permit her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy: corn, beans, cheese and a griddle to make tortillas and pupusas.

loans.name: Pochol Al Vencimiento Group

texts.es:
Maria (es la segunda que se encuentra del lado derecho en la fotografía) ella es una mujer soltera de 30 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
Maria comenta que desde hace 5 años se dedica al cultivo y venta de maxan, esta labor lo realiza en un terreno que tiene. Eligió esta actividad porque es productiva y rentable, a través de lo que realiza obtiene un ingreso que le ayuda a cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Ahora ella ha decidido formar un grupo con el propósito de mejorar la economía de sus familias a través de la labor que realizan. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de insumos agrícolas y otros materiales que servirá para el cultivo de maxan.
El sueño más grande de doña Maria es generar más ganancias, para que en un futuro a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Maria (she is the second one found on the right side of the photo) is a single woman of 30 years. She lives with her two children in the Department of Suchitepequez. Maria comments that for the past 5 years, she has been working growing and selling maxan [a leaf used for wrapping food]. She carries out the work on land that she has. She chose this activity because it's productive and profitable, through what she does she obtains income that helps her cover the necessities of her family. 

Now she has decided to form a group with the purpose of improving the economy of their families through the labor they do. They will utilize the loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies and other materials that will serve for the cultivation of maxan. 

The biggest dream of Maria is to generate more revenue so that in the future her family lacks nothing.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and other materials that will serve for growing maxan.

loans.name: Yunila

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 36 años de edad, casada, con 5 hijos, en edad escolar. Trabaja como cocinera de una parroquia. Desde hace aproximadamente 8 años vive en una casa de madera y tambo con un solo espacio, viviendo en hacinamiento con su familia. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda y que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda: madera cepillada y rustica, postes de madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus hijos y familia en general. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado y construir los dormitorios para su familia. También sueña tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
She is from Waspam. She is 36 years old, married and has five children in school age. She works as a cook for a church. She has been living in a one-room wooden stilt house with her whole family for approximately eight years.

She is requesting her first loan with the intention to improve her house, so that her family can live in a dignified, safer environment. She will buy materials to make some improvements, such as planed and rough wood, poles, zinc sheets and nails, and pay for the labor. Her dream is to have a safe house with the basic amenities needed to live comfortably. She also wants to install a toilet and build a septic tank (she has a latrine which is in bad shape), and build bedrooms for her family. She also dreams of having her own business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make some home improvements, such as wood, poles, zinc sheets and nails, and pay for the labor.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther owns and operates a retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grocery goods in her village. Esther has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns well from this. she is requesting a new loan  to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia tiene 47 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 7 años. Este negocio es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y apoyar con la economía del hogar. Sonia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: maíz, cal, gas propano etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder comparar lo necesario para su negocio y seguir  percibiendo los ingresos que le permiten llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en: Sonia is 47 and she has been making a living selling tortillas for the last 7 years. This business is what permits her to bring home the bread and support the economy of the home. Sonia has taken the decision to apply for this loan from FUSAI to invest it in her business in the purchase of the necessary supplies like: corn, lime, propane gas, etc. She hopes to be able to count on this loan and thereby be able to buy what is necessary for her business and continue having income that will permit her to bring sustenance to her home.

loans.use: to buy: corn, lime, propane gas, etc. for her tortilla business.

loans.name: 0603 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Két is 59 years old and married with two children. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Két has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Két lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and has no dependents. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. 

In 2011, Két joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Két has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 0603 Đông Vệ solidarity group which consists of five members. 

With her business profit, Két hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry, feed, and sell in the future

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, aged 45, is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her third loan with BRAC; she is an old member. She has been taking loans according to the needs of her family.

Shazia's family is poor, and it is very difficult for her to meet all the household expenses with poor earnings. Her husband is a hawker by profession, selling hair oils from his bicycle. He sells mustard oil, avocado oil, castor oil, coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil, safflower oil, etc. He calls the name of his products loudly in the streets to attract his consumers. He is famous for protecting hair from falling out. He wants to buy large quantities of hair oil to sell for the growth of his business and to overcome the poverty. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy more quantities of hair oil. Shazia is very impressed with this honorable support. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy hair oils to resell

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 26 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijos menores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 6 años estableció su pequeña pulpería y venta de verduras y frutas. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería e incrementar el inventario de su negocio. Su sueño es llegar a ser dueña de un negocio próspero en un local que brinde las óptimas condiciones.
texts.en: She is native to Waspam. She is 26, married, with 2 children who are not of age. With the purpose of having her own source of income, she established her small grocery store 6 years ago and sells vegetables and fruits. He is applying for her second loan to buy merchandise and increase the inventory of her business. Her dream is to become the owner of a prosperous business in a premises that provides optimal conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and increase the inventory of her business.

loans.name: Santha Martha  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Santa Martha está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio que tienen una muy buena amistad,  son amables, gentiles y sobre todo trabajadoras, que buscan mejorar su estabilidad económica para sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven por el sector de San Joaquín en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que se caracteriza por la belleza arquitectónica la cual le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, esta bañada por 4 ríos, esta ciudad es llena de colorido por la belleza de las vestimentas tradicionales, el mayor orgullo de su gente es aun mantener viva su cultura y tradiciones.
Una de las socias  de este grupo es la Señora. Elsa, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, su primera hija es  casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo labora en el extranjero, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Elsa se dedica al trabajo que aprendió de sus padres el cual es realizar artesanías, realiza canastas las que vende en la ciudad o entrega a su clientela especifica. 
El dinero es para la compra de paja que necesita para la elaboración de estas artesanías. Su sueño es viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Santa Martha is comprised of seven members: six women and a man. They are very good friends. They are kind, humble and most of all hardworking people who are trying to improve their financial situation to get ahead with their families. They live in San Joaquín, in the city of Cuenca, a city with architectural masterpieces that earned it the title of UNESCO’s Cultural Heritage Site in December, 1999. Four rivers cross the city, which has many colors from the beautiful traditional clothes. The city is proud of its people and of keeping its traditions and culture alive.

One of the members of this group is Elsa, who is 35 and married. She has two children aged 19 and 17. Her daughter is married and does not live with her and her son, the youngest, studies in a local school. Her husband works abroad. She lives in a house of her own. Elsa makes handicrafts, an activity she learned from her parents. She makes baskets and sells them in the city or delivers them to clients who order them.

With this loan she will buy the straw she needs to make her handicrafts. Her dream is to travel around the world.

loans.use: to buy straw to make baskets.

loans.name: 0305 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan is 49 years old and married with two children. She has a manufacturing business making wine. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business which she has been involved in for more than 10 years. Lan lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, and has one dependent. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.


Lan is the group leader of the 0305 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials for wine making and sales

loans.name: Elybet

texts.en:
With her passion to succeed, Elybet always finds a way to achieve success. She is managing a hog-raising business in her village. Elybet also runs a meat-vending business in the market. She has been 5 years in the meat-vending business and 10 years in her hog-raising business. Elybet wants to interest more customers – that’s why she always assures that she is delivering good service to her customers.

Elybet is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to buy hogs to butcher and sell in the market. She believes that this loan will be a big contribution in growing the business. She will be using her profit for the education of her three children who are studying. She would like to think that someday her children will finish their education because of her perseverance and hard work.

loans.use: to buy hogs to butcher and sell in the market.

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
Epifanio is 62 years old, married, and has seven adult children. They live in a rural community planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops for sale. 

He aims to improve his farming business in order to sustain the necessities of his family and save money for their future. Due to financial insufficiencies, he has asked for a loan of 19,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for growing vegetables. 

With patience and hard work, he believes that he will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for growing vegetables

loans.name: Javier Oscar

texts.es:
Javier vive en la ciudad de Ucayali, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho empeño trabaaj muy duro en su empleo como almacenero en una tienda de su ciudad desde hace 1 año.

Javier esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a esa ayuda el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y trabajar con mucho esmero y empeño para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una gran familia”.
texts.en:
Javier lives in the city of Ucayali. He is a young person with much desire to get ahead. For this reason, he pushes himself a lot every day to be able to get ahead. Therefore, with much commitment, he has been working very hard in his job as a stock boy in a store in his city for the past year.

Javier is thankful for the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, he will be able to carry out renovations in his home. In this manner, he will be able to improve his quality of life and work with much care and dedication to make his greatest dream a reality: "to have a big family."

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and reselling rice grains in the Philippines. Teresa has been in this business for 10 years.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Teresa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en:
En is a villager residing in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 54 years old, married, and has been blessed with four children. 

En has struggled for a living through cassava and cashew farming. It is the business that she has been in for 34 years, and it has generated a decent income. 

This is the fifth loan cycle for her with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has fully repaid her past loans. 

En leads a group consisting of four borrowers looking to get a new loan.  Out of the total amount of 7,400,000 KHR, 2,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava seedlings and to pay for plowing and labor fees for her farmland. 

She hopes to upgrade her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and to pay for plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Lesly Adolfo

texts.es: Tiene 30 años de edad, casado y tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Trabaja como conductor en una institución del gobierno central. Desde hace aproximadamente 4 años vive en una casa de madera y tambo con un solo espacio, viviendo en hacinamiento con su familia. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda y que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda: madera cepillada y rustica, postes de madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus hijos y familia en general. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado y construir los dormitorios para su familia.
texts.en:
He is 30, married and has a small child of 2 years of age. He works as a driver in a central government institution. Since approximately 4 years ago, he has been living in a wooden house on stilts with only one room, living cramped with his family. With the goal of improving his home and so his family lives in a safe and dignified manner, he is applying for his first loan to buy materials to improve his home: brushed and rustic metal, wooden posts, zinc, nails and to cover labor costs.

His dream is to have a secure home with the basic conditions for the comfort of his children and family in general. He also wants to improve his house by constructing rooms for his family, a toilet and construct a septic tank since currently he has a latrine in regular status.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve his home: brushed and rustic metal, wooden posts, zinc, nails and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Nena

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 31 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijos, un pequeño de 7 meses y el mayor de 6 años que cursa su primer grado de primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y de velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, desde hace 1 año estableció en su vivienda una pequeña pulpería. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería e incrementar el inventario de su negocio. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y hombres de bien. También anhela con ser dueña de un negocio próspero en un local que brinde las óptimas condiciones.
texts.en: She is native of Waspam and is 31 years old. She is married and has two children: the baby is 7 months old and the 6 year old is in first grade of elementary school. With the goal of having her own source of income and for the well being of her children, she started her small grocery store in her home. She is requesting her first loan to buy merchandise and increase the stock of her business. Her dream is having her children be professionals and good people. She also wants to be the owner of a good business in a place that offers optimal conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: basic grains, sodas and  dairy products

loans.name: Zhidmad (Gualaceo) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Zhidmad está formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven por la parroquia del mismo nombre que pertenece al cantón Gualaceo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, a tejer de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al bordado de polleras y blusas. Toda su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, forma parte del grupo de crédito Zhidmad desde hace 10 años, tiempo en el que ha llegado a establecer una buena amistad con todas sus compañeras, le gusta su grupo porque se apoyan para salir adelante.
La Señora. Rosa tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 16, 14, 9 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos  en una escuelita de la localidad, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica al trabajo del campo como es la cría de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos y también  a la agricultura es para el consumo de su hogar y también lo vende, pero el trabajo al cual le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo es la elaboración de guaipe (telas para limpiar). 
El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de tela para la elaboración de guaipe. Su meta es  ampliar su casa y que sus hijos estudien y lleguen a ser profesionales.
La foto peueña es de una socia  que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo lafoto del grupo.
texts.en:
The credit group Zhidmad is made up of 10 women who live in the Parish of Gualaceo which is in the Canton of the same name. The people who live there typically work in farming and raising livestock, weaving hats from straw, making woolen sweaters, and embroidering skirts and blouses. Everyone still maintains the culture and traditions of their villages.

One of the members of this group is Rosa. During the ten years she has been a member she has developed close friendships with all her fellow members. She likes this group because they support each other and help each other get ahead. Rosa is 36 years old and is the single mother of four children who are 16, 14, 9, and 7 years old. The eldest one works and helps with the expenses; the second one is in secondary school, and the two younger ones go to a little neighborhood school. The house in which Rosa lives belongs to her.

Rosa devotes her time to farm work such as raising chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, and also to agriculture. Her family eats what she produces, and they sell the rest. But she spends the majority of her time making guaipes (cleaning cloths). The money from her loan is for the purchase of cloth to make guaipes. Her goals are to add on to her house, and for her children to study and become professionals. 

The small picture is of a member who was unable to be there when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Romy

texts.en: Romy engages in hog-raising as a supplemental source of income. He is 36 years old and has three school-aged children. His goals are to improve his business and continue sending his children to school. Because he has limited capital, he is requesting a loan for PHP18,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional pigs and materials needed to improve his pigpen. Despite the many hardships he has faced, he believes that he can improve his business and make it more profitable as he continues to strive to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional pigs and materials needed to improve his pigpen.

loans.name: 02020301 Thôn 9- Hoằng Đông Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết is 57 years old and she is married with 7 children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  She has a rice stall and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

In 2004, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyết is the group leader of the 02020301 Thôn 9 -Hoằng Đông solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She has successfully repaid 10 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a new loan to invest in her business. With her business profit, Tuyết hopes to buy land of her own, to buy a motorbike, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: 02030824 Tây Xuân Vi - Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Hương works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Hương is 43 years old and she is married with 3 children. Hương is the group leader of the 020308240002 Tây xuân Vi - Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Hương lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry and feed for sale in the future.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina, 57 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost twenty years. She earns a net income of PHP 150 daily. Her net income is usually spent on their daily expenditures. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase detergent soap, beauty soap, curls, beverages, cooking oil, and breads to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase detergent soap, beauty soap, curls, beverages, cooking oil, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 - Thôn Thuận 17 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Điền's work is fishing and selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Điền faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing tools for fishing and selling. This is Điền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

Dien is 52 years old and she is married with 1 child. She lives with her child in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 - Thôn Thuận 17 solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 

In the future, Điền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for fishing and selling.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 57 years old and single.

Clarita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Clarita is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Clarita has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Clarita is committed to rebuild, and in the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like chips, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is 30 old and single with three children, two of whom are in school. Adelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Adelyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Adelyn has restarted her buisness and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Adelyn has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Adelyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en: An inhabitant from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Rin is a 53-year-old mother blessed with four children. She deals with her family’s hardship from five hectare of rice cropping with 15 years of experiences. She is a former borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two past loans which have been completely repaid back. Now, she can improve her living condition better than before. For this cycle, she teams up as a group of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and harvesting fees and to purchase fertilizer. She hopes her family condition of living will be better.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and harvesting fees and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn, 51, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with five children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. She and her husband have been in this business for 25 years. The current business earns her family about 28,000 KHR per day.
This is Vorn's microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is a sixth time borrower. As the leader, she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 38 years old and married. She has five children who are in school. 

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Estrella is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Estrella has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. 

With your help, Estrella can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida  works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Loida would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 58 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rebecca is taking out a bridge loan to restart her dried fish vending business.

Rebecca has requested PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to restart her dried fish vending business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Rebecca is committed to rebuild, and in the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en:
Somaly is aged 30 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is farmer who has been growing rice and pineapples for 6 years. The current business earns her family about 28,000 KHR per day to feed the family. She manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

Somaly has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Somaly wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her crop on time to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Loern's Group

texts.en:
Loern is a 47-year-old mother of four children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice. The current business earns her about 41,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  

This is the third micro-loan for Loern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: 02130102 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng is 51 years old and she is married with 3 children. They live in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. 

In 2013, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng is the group leader of the 02130102 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. In the future, Hồng hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry and raise them to sell in the future.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem, 47 years old, is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to a farming business. She is married to a humble man who operates the same business as her. This couple nourishes and educates their children with the income generated from rice husbandry. They have worked in agriculture for over 20 years, and it has been the major source of their income. 

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Hem is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is a 29-year-old married man. To earn his living, he settled together with his child in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Over the past five years, Brian was able to manage his farm in order to make a living. The farm is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's needs. 

Recently, he took a new loan to buy fertilizer and planting supplies. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Brian expects an increase of income so as to expand his farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and planting supplies.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita lives in Coron, Palawan, Philippines, one of the areas affected by Typhoon Haiyan last November 2013. She is 37 years old and she is married to Sentolo, a carpenter and someone who sells interwoven splits of bamboo for making walls. They have three children.

Merlita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 23,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Merlita hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her three children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: 02130401Thôn 6 Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt has a grocery store in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Nguyệt is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. In 2013, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She is the group leader of the 02130401Thôn 6 xã Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes to buy a motorbike, to travel on vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger vive en la ciudad de Ucayali, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo como Barmant, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para solventar sus estudios técnicos de barman.

Roger esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales para su negocio de barman, como medidores, copas, vasos, licuadora, esencias, licores, entre otros; ya que en ocasiones brinda este servicios para eventos y de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su propio Bar y resturante”.
texts.en:
Roger lives in the city of Ucayali, and is a young man with a great desire to succeed. This is why each day he does his very best in his work as a bartender. With this, he can have income to pay for his bartender courses.

Roger is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help he has been offered, he will be able to buy materials for his bartending business, such as measuring cups, wine glasses, glasses, blender, flavoring essences, liquor and other items, as he sometimes offers this service for events. This way he will be be able to improve his income and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: "To have his own bar and restaurant."

loans.use: To buy materials and utensils for his bartending business.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Sophal is a 34-year-old mother of five children. Rice farming, which she has been doing for seven years, is the main source of the family’s income. The current business earns her about 26,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sophal has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other member of her group is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now Sophal is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Eddy Xavier

texts.es:
Eddy es un joven emprendedor y muy trabajador tiene 19 años de edad, soltero, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chico para poder sustentar sus necesidades, actualmente vive en casa de unos familiares en un barrio muy alejado de la ciudad aquí su gente se dedica mucho a la elaboración de escobas y material de limpieza como también a la agricultura y ganadería este lugar se llama Pastocalle zona rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Eddy  heredó de sus padres la habilidad de criar animales, pues esta actividad les ha servido para salir adelante y solventar sus necesidades. 
Eddy dedica a esta actividad desde 3 a 4 horas cada día ya que el ordeño de las vacas se lo hace dos veces al día una por la mañana y la otra en la tarde, Eddy con la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de los años  experimentando el crecimiento que ha tenido su pequeña microempresa hoy ha visto la necesidad de incrementar en una vaca lechera mas ya que una de las que tiene está pronto a secarse, y por esto la necesidad del crédito adicional que desea realizar los tramites de la escritura de un pequeño terreno que su padre le regaló. Lo que más desea Eddy es que con la inversión que hará su producción aumente para que así  pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su familia. 
Eddy quiere hacer llegar un efusivo saludo y a la vez agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Eddy is a young entrepreneur and a hard worker.  He is 19 years old, single, and thanks to the efforts of his parents, he was able to finish primary school.  But the lack of financial resources forced him to work from a very young age in order to support his needs. He currently lives with some family members in a neighborhood that is very far from town. Many of the people here work at making brooms and cleaning materials, and also in agriculture and raising livestock. This area is called Pastocalle, in the rural part of Cotopaxi Province in the Republic of Ecuador. Its people live day to day working at these activities.  Although it is far from the city, there are families who have undertaken all kinds of activity to cover their necessities and those of the community. 

Eddy learned how to raise animals from his parents. This work enabled them to get ahead and meet their needs. Eddy does this work for 3 to 4 hours every day since the cows are milked twice a day - once in the morning and once in the afternoon. With the experience he has gained through the years seeing the growth of his small business, today he recognizes that he needs one more dairy cow because one of the ones he has is about to enter her dry period. This is why he needs the loan.  He also needs it to complete the paperwork for a small piece of land that his father gave him.

What Eddy hopes for most is that the investment he makes will result in an increase in production, thus allowing him to improve his and his family's life style. Eddy wants to send warm regards and to thank Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador and Kiva for making it possible for him to grow personally and at work.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: 02130301 Thôn 5- Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tho works in agriculture, farming food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Tho is 40 years old and married with five children. Tho supports five dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 02130301 Thôn 5- xã Hoằng Kim solidarity group. 

In 2013, Tho joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Tho hopes to remodel her house, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su menor hija en el Caserío de San José de Lirio, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, desde hace 5 años, sus cultivos están a diez minutos de su domicilio, junto a su esposa se esfuerzan en la labor que realizan, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ismael is 22 years old and lives with his wife and their youngest daughter in Caserío de San José de Lirio, a rural area in Callayuc district. It is a community with a varied climate, and the people who live there work in agriculture, small business and livestock-raising. It is located in Cutervo province, which is part of Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands.

He has been engaged in agriculture, especially coffee cultivation, for five years. His plantation is 10 minutes from his home, and together with his wife they do their best in the work they do. 

He has requested a loan of 2500 nuevos soles in order to purchase fertilizer for maintaining his coffee plantation, and thereby generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for maintaining his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is married woman with seven school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk,soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kamach's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Mongkul Borey district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Kamach is aged 45 years and widowed. As a widow, she has struggled to feed her two children by farming rice and selling grocery items. Having been in the business for 25 years, the current business earns her approximately 41,000KHR per day. 

Kamach is just with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for this cycle. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to timely grow her rice so as make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis nació en la Saquisilí cantón de la provincia de Cotopaxi perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, en donde nace gente luchadora, emprendedora y con alma de guerreros, tiene 20 años de edad, actualmente vive en casa de familiares en una zona rural del sector, y esta zona se caracteriza por sus habitantes que se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ganado de leche, y lomas fuerte es la elaboración de bloques para construcción. Para Luis ha sido muy satisfactorio el que pese a la situación económica de sus padres ha podido sobresalir solo y ha sacado adelante su pequeña microempresa él se dedica a la elaboración de bloque, los mismos que son llevados a la costa ecuatoriana donde tienen gran acogida, Luis trabaja de 6 a 8 horas diarias empezando desde las tres de la mañana hasta el medio día, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres y familiares ya que es muy común en la zona, por ser un sector rural.
Por el momento solicita un crédito de para poder comprar una máquina prensadora para hacer bloque de otra medida ya que tiene pedidos, su producto es muy reconocido por el buen terminado. 
Luis quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Luis is 20 years old and lives in a home with family members in a rural area on the Saquisilí Canton of Cotopaxi Province in Ecuador, where he was born. People in Saquisilí have the hearts of warriors; they are tenacious and resourceful, and many make a living raising and selling young animals or dairy cattle. Saquisilí is also well-known for producing cinder blocks for construction.  

Luis's parents have had financial difficulties, so it has been very satisfying for him to be able to succeed on his own. He runs a small business that produces cinder blocks, which are then transported to the coast, where demand his high. Luis works six to eight hours a day, starting at 3:00 a.m. and working until midday. He leaned cinder block production from his parents and other relatives, who like many people in this rural area, earn a living in this business.  

Luis is applying for a loan so that he can purchase a concrete block machine to make blocks according to a different method. Luis has orders to fill and his cinder blocks have a reputation for quality. 

Luis would like to express his sincere gratitude and warmest regards to the Alternative Foundation in Ecuador and to Kiva for making it possible for his business to grow and for him to prosper.

loans.use: Para la compra de una máquina prensadora.

loans.name: Demps Allen

texts.en:
Demps Allen is proud to manage a beauty salon business, even though he is a man. Though he did not reach his dream to become a seaman or an army man, due to financial constraints, Demps Allen did not stop dreaming. 

Just to have a better future and a better way of living, Demps Allen chose to manage a beauty salon business. He offers hair rebonding, straightening, curling, and hair coloring. He has been two years in running the business, and is happy to say that his revenues are enough to sustain his needs. 

Demps Allen wishes to build a snack house beside his salon business. For this, he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy materials and hair treatment to be used for his business. He will also use the loan to start up building his snack house business. 

Demps Allen hopes to succeed with the business he has and he may have someday.

loans.use: to buy materials and hair treatment and to start up building his snack house business.

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
Pech is 32 years old and is widowed with one kid. She lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district. Pech’s main source of income is planting rubber trees and she also works for others for a fee. She currently earn about 28,000 KHR per day and has been with VisionFund for one cycle.

Pech is the leader of a group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Coron, Palawan, Philippines, one of the areas affected by typhoon Haiyan. Her husband is Anthony who works as a driver and they have children who are not school age. Gina and her husband are working hard to recover what they lost during the typhoon and to provide for their family.

Gina operates a piggery and sells live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes, she has the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from this, Gina also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 1,200 PHP in sales every week.

Gina is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to buy hogs and hog feed. She dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. Gina meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy hogs and hog feed

loans.name: Kirua Group

texts.en:
ATHUMAN, who is in his late 30s is married with one child who is still at school.  He has been running a business selling chips, water, soda and juice for nine years now.  He works from 06 am to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be ATHUMAN's eleventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.
