He used the previous loans to increase his food stock, pay rent, renovated his selling place by putting new iron sheets on the roof top, made the floor smooth and now the place is attractive to more customers. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.  He used the profit to pay school fees, build his house and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy  sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, juice, sodas and water to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of owning nice house and to start a business of selling local kitchen items outside of Dar es salaam.

ATHUMAN will share this loan with his loan group "Kirua" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy  sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, juice, sodas and water to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: 12 Thôn 3 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh works in agriculture farming poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thanh is 54 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Thanh is the group leader of the 12 Thôn 3 Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. 

In 2009, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thanh has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes to maintain  a successful business, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been selling suman in their community to make a living. She earns good income from this aside from her husband's income from their transportation business. With her generated income her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. To improve sales and meet costumer's orders, she took a new loan to buy more ingredients, like sugar, glutinous rice and other materials. In the future, she wants to improve her business as well as the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like sugar, glutinous rice and other materials

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en: Beryl is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more fish to resell. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with four school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past five years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Chovy's Group

texts.en:
Chovy, aged 30 years of age, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice. To supplement the family’s income, his wife also works as a garment worker. The current business earns him about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
Chovy’s group consists of two members who live in the same area and he is a third cycle client, while his member is also a third cycle client with VisionFund. The past loans that he successfully paid back have helped his family business and improved living conditions. Now leading this group to apply for a loan, Chovy, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizer and seed for his farmland. He hopes to increase his family’s income to improve his family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farmland

loans.name: Iraramira Twimukye Group

texts.en: Alex is a member of the Iraramura Twimukye Group, aged 32 years.  He is a farmer and business man trading coffee and brewing alcohol. He is an old client, married and has applied for a loan of Ugx. 2,000,000 (two million shillings only) to boost his business. He started his business in the year 2004 in Igaramura Kiyanga mitooma for self development. He works 9 hours a day and his customers are the people in his local area. He has four children aged 10, 8, 4 and 3 years. He also has three dependents, who are orphans. They all attend school. He is honest and hardworking, however he faces the challenge of poor payment from some of his customers, poor seasons which are unpredictable and debts. He hopes to use the loan to buy organic manure for his coffee plantation. He hopes the this will increase his coffee yield and it will help him to create employment opportunities for his children.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Senghan's Group

texts.en: A young mother who is married and blessed with one young child at home, Senghan is a villager from Dambae district of Kamponmg Cham province. Cassava and rice farming are the only source of income for her in order to cover her daily costs of living. She has been with this business for 13 years and she can earn income 30,100 KHR per day. She and her co-borrower have never been with VisinFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she is seeking a loan for 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting a loan for 500,000 KHR. As the leader she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, to pay for plowing, harvesting fees and to pay for labor costs. She greatly hopes to expand her farmland further.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, to pay for plowing, harvesting fees and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.ru: Анастасия торгует нижним бельем. Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту она смогла расширить ассортимент товара и привлечь больше покупателей. Весна - хороший сезон для Анастасии, т.к. есть повышенный спрос на ее товар. В связи с этим, Анастасия просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки дополнительного ассортимента мужского и женского нижнего белья. В планах Анастасии - дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и увеличение продаж.
texts.en: Anastasia sells underwear.  Thanks to a previous loan from Kiva, she was able to expand her assortment of goods and attract more buyers.  Spring is a good season for Anastasia, as the demand for her merchandise increases.  For this reason, Anastasia is requesting a loan to buy another batch of men's and women's underwear.  Anastasia plans to further develop her business and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear for men and women.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru: Татьяна уже несколько раз пользовалась КИВА кредитами и успела оценить их помощь для своего бизнеса. Раньше Татьяна торговала обувью, но недавно решила поменять группу товара и перешла на одежду, т.к. на этой группе товара при той же сумме вложения можно получить большую прибыль. Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит для увеличения ассортимента весенней и летней одежды. Татьяна уверена, что таким образом она сможет увеличить продажи и получить дополнительную прибыль. Дополнительный доход Татьяна планирует потратить на обучение своей дочери.
texts.en: Tatyana has already taken a few loans from Kiva and she was able to use them to develop her business.  Tatyana used to sell shoes but she has recently decided to switch to another type of goods and she is now selling clothes.  With the same amount  of money invested, you can indeed make a larger profit selling clothes than shoes.  Tatyana is requesting a loan to increase her assortment of spring and summer clothes.  She is positive that this will help her to increase her sales and profits.  Tatyana plans to use her extra income to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of spring and summer clothing.

loans.name: 1801030001 Thôn 7 Xã Hoằng Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy has a retail business selling rice. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She is 55 years old and married with two children. Thúy is the group leader of the 1801030001 Thôn 7 xã Hoằng Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 

This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thúy hopes to remodel her house, to buy a motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a married entrepreneur with five children. He helps his wife to operate their general store to make a living. Aside from this, his wife also vends fish to earn extra income. For the five years that he has been running the business, he has been earning well to support the needs of the family and has been able to sustain the business.  He borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. He hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: A married father of two kids, Pheap is 50 years old and is living in Kampong Cham province. To sustain his family, he grows cassava on one hectare of farmland as the main source of income and does cashew farming as an additional source of income. It is the business that he has been involved in for 25 years. Now, he is a team leader of five to get a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is in his fourth loan cycle. His co-borrowers are taking their first loan. The total loan amount requested for his entire group is 7,200,000 KHR, of which 2,000,000 KHR is his loan portion. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy insecticide and to pay for plowing and labor fees, and land leasing for his cassava and cashew farming. He strongly believes he will collect a better yield than before and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and to pay for plowing and labor fees, and land leasing

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is 55 years old and the widowed mother of three children. She and her family live in a village in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she has been growing rubber trees and working as a paid worker in order to better support her family. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to support her family.
 
Pheap has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back her past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her rubber trees. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rubber better and produce higher yields in order for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
Mean is a married mother of three children, aged 54 years old, living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income and her husband supplements this income by working for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in this business for 30 years. The current business earns her about 29,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.  

Mean’s group consists of two members who are all female and live in the same village. She is a fourth-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely repaid the past loans, which have enabled her to better support her family and have some money. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. Mean wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow good crops of rice and get a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a widow with six school-aged children. They own a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Zawadi has operated a business selling clothes for the past ten years. She sells door-to-door to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Toyor Al- Jana'a Group

texts.en:
This group is called Toyor Al- Jana'a. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER from AMB. 

Boshra is a 26-year-old married woman with three children. She is the leader of the group. Boshra lives with her children in their own house. She is educated up to Secondary school level. She is very dynamic and vigorous.  Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Many years ago, Boshra and her husband built their own house on land they purchased. Now, the family lives in their own house, but it is not renovated from the inside and it needs paint. As a result, Boshra is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase paint in order to renovate the inside of the house.

Boshra's dream in the future is building one more floor and renovating it. She hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: To purchase paint in order to renovate the inside of her house.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.ru: Микола работает на железной дороге помощником машиниста. Он женат, имеет одного ребенка. Уже давно он мечтал отремонтировать фасад своего дома. Насобирав определенную сумму денег, Микола решил начать ремонт. Но к сожалению, его личные средства закончились и ремонт остановился. Микола просит предоставить ему кредит для закупки материалов, которые нужны ему для окончания ремонта. Новый фасад будет делать дом не только красивым, но и теплым, что позволит экономить энергоносители. В данный момент Микола с женой ожидают появление второго ребенка, и они надеются, что к его появлению Микола сможет закончить начатый ремонт.
texts.en: Mykola works as an assistant engineer on the railroad.  He is married and has a child.  For a while now he has been dreaming of fixing the facade of his house.  He saved up some money and started the process of improving his house.  Unfortunately, he ran out of funds and was not able to finish the job.  Mykola is asking for a loan to purchase building materials necessary to complete the improvements.  The new exterior will make the house look nice and additional improvements will weatherize it against the cold and will save money on the energy bills.  Currently, Mykola and his wife are expecting their second child and they are hoping that Mykola will finish the house before the new baby arrives.

loans.use: to purchase building materials needed to improve and weatherize his house.

loans.name: Veth's Group

texts.en:
Veth is a 43-year-old mother of four kids, three of whom are in school and under her responsibility. To make a living, she does cassava and rice farming and she has been involved with this business for 25 years. 

This is not the first loan for Veth with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan, which she has fully repaid, has helped her to buy sufficient food on a timely basis. For this cycle, she is the leader of a group, consisting of three members. She and her co-borrowers are seeking a loan in the amount of 2,300,000 KHR, of which 600,000 KHR is her loan portion. Veth will spend her portion of the loan to pay for plowing, harvesting, and labor fees, and to buy fertilizer and insecticide. She hopes to gain a better yield than before and to upgrade her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, harvesting, and labor fees, and to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary has been selling suman (rice cakes) in her community to make a living. She earns a good living from this business. Her husband also earns income from their transportation business. Her previous loan for the business was successfully repaid. To meet her customers' orders, she took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy ingredients like sugar, glutinous rice, and other materials needed to make suman. In the future, she wants to improve her business, as well as the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, glutinous rice, and others

loans.name: Jose Alexis

texts.es:
José tiene 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja como obrero en uan empresa de la ciudad y también trabaja como chofer, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Jose esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá solventar gastos personales, asimismo realizar mejoras de en su vivienda y de esta manera seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old, and he lives in the city of Ica. He works as a worker in a company in the city, and he also works as a driver, which allows him to have income to be able to get ahead.

José is grateful to the Kiva moneylenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to settle his personal expenses and also be able to make improvements to his home. This way, he will be able to continue working and making efforts to be able to make his big dream a reality: "to improve his family's quality of life".

loans.use: to improve his home and to settle his personal expenses.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
Salomón tiene 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico; tiene tres hijas menores de edad que estudian en la escuela en el Caserío Playa Azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de frutales, café y arroz, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno para posteriormente engordar y comercializarlo en la plaza de San Juan De Chiple, una zona donde se reúnen ganaderos de los caseríos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de de un torete pequeño para ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Salomón, age 56, lives in his own house made from rudimentary materials.  He has three minor daughters who go to school in the Playa Azul neighborhood.  It is a rural area in the Pucará district.  The community devotes itself to agriculture; especially fruit, coffee, and rice.  It is in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He raises livestock to later fatten and sell in the San Juan De Chiple plaza.  It is an area where the people who raise cattle from the outlying neighborhoods meet.

He has requested a loan for 1,200 soles to buy a young bull to sell at a better price to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a young bull.

loans.name: Edelfonso

texts.es:
Edelfonso tiene 43 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su esposa y dos menores hijos en el Caserío El Mirador del distrito de Pimpingos, cuentan con servicio de agua, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, cuenta con 2 has. sembrado de la variedad catimore, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edelfonso is 43 years old, and he has a stable home with his wife and his two young children in the neighborhood of El Mirador in the district of Pimpingos. They have water service. The people here work in agriculture, trade, and animal-raising. It is located within the Cutervo Province which belongs to the Cajamarca Region on Peru’s northern coast.

He works in agriculture, primarily coffee farming, and he has two hectares (approximately 5 acres) planted with the Catimore variety. His wife supports him in this work. He has requested a loan of 4,000 Nuevos Soles for the purchase of fertilizers in order to maintain his crop, and in this way have his production ready in time to offer it to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана живет в городе Павлограде. Она занимается собственным делом, торгуя в местном торговом центре женской одеждой. Торговую точку Оксана арендует. Работать начала совсем недавно, только становится на ноги в этой сфере, но очень хочется добиться успеха, обязательная во всем. 
Оксана планирует закупить товар для пополнения ассортимента и привлечения новых клиентов в своем молодом бизнесе. Она хочет приобрести женские кофты, блузы, платья, юбки и прочее для того, чтобы иметь возможность развивать бизнес и расти дальше в сфере предпринимательства. Товар Оксана закупает у украинского производителя. На этом этапе ей нужна сумма в размере 30 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Oksana lives in Pavlograd. She has her own business selling women's clothing at the local market, where she rents a storefront. She started this business not too long ago and is still getting on her feet. It is important to her above all her business is successful. 

Oksana plans to purchase an assortment of clothing to attract new customers to her young business. She wants to buy women's sweaters, blouses, dresses, skirts and so forth in order to further develop her business. She buys her merchandise from a Ukrainian producer. At this stage, she needs 30,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, shirts, dresses and skirts for sale

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любови — 58 лет. Она — предпринимательница из Мелитополя. Она торгует на одном местном рынке женской одеждой, обувью и бижутерией в ассортименте, а в летний период работает в курортном городке Кирилловка, куда съезжаются многие отдыхающие из разных частей  Украины. Торговое место у Любови — собственное. Опыт работы составляет 18 лет. 
Любовь планирует закупить товар весенне-летнего ассортимента, а именно, блузы, футболки, костюмы и бижутерию для торговли на своих точках. Сумма, необходимая ей для закупки партии товара — 40 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Lubov is a 58-year-old businesswoman from Melitopol. She sells women's clothing, shoes and jewelry at the local market. In the summer she works in the resort town Kirilovka, which attracts tourists from all over Ukraine. She owns her storefront and has 18 years of experience. 

Lubov plans to purchase spring and summer clothing such as blouses, t-shirts, suits and jewelry to sell at her shop. She needs 40,000 hryvnia to purchase these goods.

loans.use: to purchase spring and summer clothing to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует школьными принадлежностями в двух школах, а также канцелярией и книгами в зарегистрированных киосках на одном из крупных рынков города. Опыт работы в этой сфере у Елены составляет около 7 лет. 
Елена планирует использовать сумму, полученную от КИВА в размере 30 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию товара, а именно канцелярские товары и книги. Она планирует развивать свой бизнес и дальше, преодолевая все подводные камни ведения малого бизнеса в Украине, улучшая в процессе быт своей семьи.
texts.en:
Elena lives and works in Melitopol. She sells school supplies in two schools and books and office supplies at a registered kiosk in one of the city's major markets. She has about 7 years of experience in this line of work.

Elena plans to use the Kiva loan of 30,000 hryvnia to purchase goods such as office supplies and books. She plans to continue developing her business while avoiding all the pitfalls of running a small business in Ukraine. In the process she will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy office supplies and books to sell at her kiosks

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
Khan is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children in her own home located in Banteay Meanchey province. All of her children go to school and devote their free time to help Khan with her farming work. Khan has been a rice farmer for more than 25 years, and earns approximately USD 5.00 per day. Rice farming is the sole source of her income.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Khan is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her family's household sanitation practices

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes owns and operates a tricycle transport service business. She also has a farm for planting and harvesting bananas. After years of running her business, she has successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used for these activities. To improve her service, she took a new loan to purchase a new set of tires. She wants more secure and better service for her customers. In the future, she wants to expand her business in order to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a new set of tires

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza manages their coconut farm with the help of her husband. She earns a better income from this and bought large cattle to raise and sell in the future. With her income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy planting materials. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional livestock to raise. In the future, Analiza wishes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Alexs

texts.es:
Alex s tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el Caserío de San Juan Bautista una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la ganadería, comercio y agricultura, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno desde hace 5 años, los cría en las invernas de su propiedad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Alexs is 24 years old and lives with his wife and child in the rural area of Caserío de San Juan Bautista in the district of Callayuc. This population earns a living from raising livestock, trade and agriculture and is located in the Cutervo province which forms part of the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He has worked in the raising and selling of cattle for the past five years. He raises them in the fields on his property. He requests a loan of 4,000 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency) to buy cattle to then fatten them and sell at a better price.

loans.use: to buy cattle to then fatten them and sell at a better price.

loans.name: Agustin Roly

texts.es:
Agustín tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, pollos, gallos, gallinas, pavos, cerdos, en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Agustín is 35 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district, an agricultural, ranching, and commercial community in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Perú. He raises and sells livestock including ducks, chickens, turkeys, and pigs, working out of the back of his house. He is taking out a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles to buy various food stock to feed his animals and, in so doing, increase his family's earnings.

loans.use: buy various food stock to feed his animals

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de horneado de pavo, crianza y comercio de ganado menor, aves de corral, es muy conocida en la zona por la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: María is 69 years old and lives with her husband and children in La Matanza, a tropical community where people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock located in Morropon Province in the Piura Region on the north coast of Perú.  She sells oven-baked duck and raises and sells livestock and ground fowl. She is very well known in her neighborhood for her work and is taking out a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy food for her animals and, in so doing, increase her family's earnings.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe, 43, lives in Coron, Palawan, Philippines, one of the areas affected by Typhoon Haiyan last November 2013. She is married to Diosdado, who works as a driver, and they have children. They both manage their household as they operate the business, working hard to provide for their family’s everyday needs.

Anafe owns and oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to Anafe, who earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Anafe is requesting a PHP 25, 000 loan to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of their tricycle.

Anafe hopes to have more tricycle units and dreams that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is 47 years old and living with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. Rice farming is the only source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 27 years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 40,000 KHR but she is able to save 20,000 KHR each day. 

This is the fourth loan for Pheap with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Pheap wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a shop kiosk business selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Khai's Group

texts.en: Khai is 40 years old and married. She lives in the Dambae district of Kampog Cham province. For her household, cassava and rice farming are the main sources of income to provide their daily food for consumption. She has been with this business for ages. Khai has never been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is a leader of six members to get a new loan. The entire loan amount of her group is 4,800,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, labor, and harvesting fees and to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income and expand her farmland on a larger scale.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor, and harvesting fees and to buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна уже получала финансовую помощь от КИВА. Она использовала денежные средства по назначению и смогла продолжить торговать, удерживая бизнес на плаву несмотря на разные потрясения, которые испытывала украинская экономика и малый бизнес в последние полгода. 
В этот раз Татьяна обратилась за помощью в размере 40 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести футболки, майки, блузки, облегченные брюки, юбки и пиджаки под реализацию в летний период, тем самым пополнив магазин и рынок товаром. Она надеется за счет расширения ассортимента предложить клиентам товары на сезон и сохранить покупателей.
texts.en:
Tatyana has previously received financial assistance through Kiva. She used the money as intended and was able to keep her business afloat despite the economic difficulties facing small businesses in Ukraine in the last six months. 

This time Tatyana asked for a loan of 40,000 hryvnia to buy t-shirts, tank tops, blouses, lightweight trousers, skirts and jackets for the summer season. This will help her re-stock her store. She hopes that expanding the variety of clothing available will help her keep her customers.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, tank tops, blouses, pants, skirts and jackets to sell for the summer season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc, cement, PVC pipe, cable conduits, etc.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel  has been selling cosmetics and ready-to-wear products in her village for a year and she earns well from this business. She was able to use her generated revenue to support the family, apart from her husband's income working as a backhoe operator.  The couple has had to work hard with determination to earn a better income to provide their children with better education than they were able to get. 

To improve  sales, Hazel took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy more cosmetics and ready-to-wear products to sell. In the future, Hazel hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and ready-to-wear products to sell

loans.name: Chrisantus

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Chrisantus, a farmer in Kisii, a rural town in Kenya. For the last 13 years, Chrisantus has fended for his family of 4 children by selling milk, eggs, tea and sugarcane produced on his 3-acre farm. He also engages in personal businesses to make extra money. Chrisantus enjoys farming because, despite challenges such as poor road networks and lack of market, he has been able to sustain his family comfortably with farming as his main source of income. 

Chrisantus is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He prides himself on being a good cow caretaker. Those close to him say he personally pampers his animals. Chrisantus wants to get another cow to better utilize the available pasture. He grew fodder this year and expanded his shed to accommodate two more cows that he plans to acquire. The income he projects to generate will be enough to relieve the burden of school fees off his shoulders. With your loan, Chrisantus' family will enjoy an improvement in living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. After working on their farm, she prepare snacks to sell in their village and she earns well from this business.  For many years, the couple has earned a good income to provide for their family. 

Eden had planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. In the future, Eden wants to provide a good education for her children and to improve the entire family's general living situation.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married and has one school-going child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Gertrude has operated a poultry sales business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Gertrude wants to use this loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Pheng's Group

texts.en:
Pheng, 47, is a married mother of seven children. Nowadays, four of the children still count on her as three of them are in school and one is too young for schooling. To support her family, Pheng has grown cassava and rice as her main source of income for the past 29 years, earning a decent income of approximately 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is Pheng's second cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the leader of a four-member group. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing, harvesting and labor fees for her farmland. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for plowing, harvesting and labor fees

loans.name: Derlen

texts.es: Tiene 25 años de edad, madre soltera con 3 hijos adolescentes que cursan su primaria. Desde hace aproximadamente 12 años vive en una casa de madera y tambo con un solo espacio, viviendo en hacinamiento con su familia. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda y que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda: madera cepillada y rustica, postes de madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus hijos. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica, ya que actualmente tiene una letrina en regular estado y construir los dormitorios para su familia.
texts.en:
She's a single mother, 25, with three teenagers who are in their basic education.  For about 12 years she has lived in a house made of wood and stilts with a single living space, overcrowded with her family.

Her goal is to improve her house so her family can live safely and decently.  She's requesting her first loan to buy materials to improve her house (brushed rustic wood, wood posts, metal sheeting, and nails) and to pay for labor.

Her dream is to have a safe house with the basic conditions for her children's comfort.  She wants to set up a bathroom in her house and build a septic tank, because currently she has a latrine in normal condition, as well as bedrooms for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, wood posts, metal sheets, and nails, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Romero

texts.es: Romero es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Tipampa en una casa de adobe que solo tiene luz y agua Romero tiene dos profesiones, es agricultor y trabaja como  auxiliar de electricista en una empresa. Romero quiere potenciar  su negocio de agricultura  y para eso quiere  un credito para comprar una vaca lechera para aumentar su produccion de quesos que son vendidos por su madre en diferentes ferias. Romero es ayudado por sus padres pero desea ser independiente, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Romero is single, and he does not have children.  He lives with his parents in the Tipampa community.  Their house is adobe, and it only has electricity and water.  

Romero has two professions.  He is a farmer, and he works as an electrician’s helper for a company.  

Romero wants to strengthen his agricultural business.  That is why he wants a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase his cheese production.  He mother sells the cheese at different fairs.  Romero’s parents help him, but he wishes to become independent.  In order to do so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fredi

texts.es:
Fredi tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el Centro Poblado Tambillo, una zona rural del distrito Santo Tomás, una zona de clima variado, con abundante vegetación, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimore, y caña de azúcar que lo utilizan para la elaboración de aguardiente una bebida típica de la sierra norte del Perú, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fredi is 31 years old, he lives in the Tabillo central village, a rural area in the Santo Tomas district, an area with a changeable climate and abundant vegetation. His village works in farming, trade and cattle-raising, located in the Cutervo Province which is part of the Cajamarca Region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

He works in agriculture, specializing in growing the catimor variety of coffee and sugar cane, which is used to make aguardiente - a common drink in the northern highlands of Peru. 

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 4,000 nuevos soles to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop, in order to have better production to be able to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Dairy cows are valuable assets supporting the rural poor to earn a decent living. Augustine has been a small dairy farmer for the last 13 years in Kisii, a rural town in Kenya. He possesses about two acres of land, which includes his house and cowshed. He was struggling to meet his family's basic needs, let alone paying school fees for his 4 children, until last year.

Last year, Augustine joined Juhudi Kilimo, microfinance for smallholder farmers based in deep-rural areas who cannot access finances through banks. Augustine attended various agri-business trainings to be eligible for a dairy loan. Since the training, Augustine perceives dairy farming as not only a science, but also a business. He got rid of the traditional breeds he kept for 12 years in exchange for 3 grade cows that produce thrice the amount of milk. Besides increased yield, Juhudi's extension officer, Tobiko, has guided him on proper feeding and management of dairy cows, feed supplements, sources and contact persons for good quality semen, animal first-aid and preventive health care.  

Augustine is fully equipped to be a successful farmer and he is taking a further step of seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. His major challenge is raising funds. Most of his income is spent paying for expensive farm inputs and his children's school fees.
 
With your loan, Augustine is going to have four quality dairy cows! The additional income will go to converting the temporary shed into a permanent tiled-roof one with enough space for each animal. His dream will be achieved the day his wife and children will get to enjoy a socio-economic status in the village for living a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Soraida Lucia

texts.es: Lucia es una señora separa su esposo, tiene 4 hijos de 16, 15, 13 y 11 hijos los que se encuentran estudiando, Lucia comenta que los días jueves madruga a las 3 de la mañana para trasladarse a otras ciudades donde poder conseguir más barato su mercancía, luego se traslada a vender en las ferias de otras ciudades, esto lo realiza hasta el domingo, de lunes a miércoles se dedica a tejer sacos de lana, es crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en papas y en frutas, ella se esfuerza  mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos, mediante su negocio ella aspira que le alcance el dinero para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lucia is a woman who is separated from her husband.  She has four children, ages 16, 15, 13, and 11.  The children go to school.  Lucia says that on Thursdays she gets up at three in the morning to go to other cities where she is able to get her merchandise cheaper.  She then goes to sell at the fairs in other cities.  She does this until Sunday.  Mondays through Wednesdays she knits wool bags.

She will use this loan to buy her merchandise of potatoes and fruit.  She puts forth great effort in order to get her children ahead.  Through her business she wants to have enough money for her children to complete their education.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and fruit.

loans.name: Ayda Judith

texts.es: Ayda es una señora de 30 años de edad ella es casada, se dedica a tejer sacos de lana que luego los vende en Otavalo  que es una ciudad en donde son muy usadas estas prendas  por sus colores llamativos y porque son tejidos manualmente, Ayda también trabaja de empleada domestica en una casa, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de lana para tejer sus sacos, su aspiración es comprar un lote de terreno y posteriormente hacer una pequeña casa.
texts.en:
Ayda, 30, is married.  She earns a living knitting wool jackets that she sells in the city of Otalvo.  These garments are common there for their striking colors and because they're knit by hand.  Ayda also works as a domestic employee in a home.

She's going to invest the loan in buying wool to knit her jackets.

Ayda's goal is to buy a plot of land and build a small house.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: 05.11.02 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a retail business selling sugar, sweet and cigarettes.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Hoa is 41-years-old and married with two children.  Hoa is the group leader of the 05.11.02 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of five members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2013, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa has been involved in this business for six years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, sweets and cigarettes

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José de 57 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir pues comenta que sus padres no contaban con el dinero suficiente y también porque no habían escuelas ni profesores en el lugar donde Vivian, solo habían escuelas lejos, es por esta razón que no logro estudiar, él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y cuidar de sus 9 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, en su vivienda solo vive sus 9 hijos su esposa y él. 

José se dedica a cuidar de un turicentro por el día y la noche comenta que tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que es una fuente de ingresos que le genera para la sostenibilidad de su familia, el trabajo lo adquirió por parte de un amigo que lo recomendó para trabajar en el turicentro que le queda cerca de su casa a un 1km aproximadamente y que se va caminando a su trabajo, él también se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) en la temporada de invierno que junto a su familia realizan los trabajos agrícolas.


El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en su vivienda, ya que la tiene un poco deteriorada las paredes son de tabla de madera por el transcurrir de los años se le han deteriorado y teme que para la época de lluvia se le pueda mojar su familia y sus pertenecías, específicamente comprara 20 tablas de 3 metros para sustituir las que están arruinadas y colocar las nuevas, el trabajo él lo realizara ya que tiene conocimiento que como hacer el trabajo, gracias a esto no tendrá peligro que se le meta el agua en la época de lluvia y su familia estará más segura y protegida.

José desea para el futuro construir su casa de bloque, ya que la que tiene esta deteriorada y no es muy segura para vivir, y para sus hijos desea que sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad y también conseguir un mejor empleo para obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
José, 57, doesn't know how to read or write.  He said his parents didn't have enough money and also there weren't schools or teachers where they lived, only far away.  That's why he couldn't go to school.

He's married and his wife takes care of the home and their nine children, who are currently attending school.  Only the nine children and his wife live in the house with him.

José makes a living taking care of a tourist center day and night.  He said he has done this work for three years.  It's a source of income that allows him to support his family.  He got the job through a friend who recommended him for it.  The center's close to his house, about a kilometer away, and he walks to work. He also works in agriculture growing basic grains (corn and beans) in the winter.  He and his family do the farming activities.

José's going to use the loan to invest in his home because it's a little bit damaged.  The walls are made of wood and over the years they have deteriorated.  He's afraid that in the rainy season his family and their belongings will get wet.  In particular, he's going to buy 20 3-meter boards to substitute the ones that are ruined with the new ones.  He'll do the work himself because he knows how to do the job.  Thanks to this there will be no danger of water getting in and his family will be safer and protected.

José wants to build a house of cinder blocks in the future because his current house is damaged and not very safe to live in.  He wants his children to keep on studying so they'll be good people in society and also get a better job to earn more income and give their families a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 20 3-meter boards

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is 33-years-old and she has studied up to the 9th grade. She is married and a mother of two. Esi is a person who is hardworking, and above all, enterprising.
She has been selling foodstuff for four years. The loan will be used to purchase more merchandise, such as plantain and cassava, and to stock her business.
Esi’s desire is to be healthy.  This way, she will be able to continue supporting her children in addition to striving so that they can study and be prepared to face adversities in life.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise, such as plantain and cassava, and to stock her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 37-years-old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Analiza has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Analiza has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Analiza is committed to rebuilding her devastated life.  In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita manages a farm, where she plants vegetables to supplement her husband's income. They harvest coconuts and corn as their main source of income. 

Her previous loan, which was used to pay for weeding and plowing, was successfully repaid with her generated income. To improve the farm, she would like a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. 

In the future, Esterlita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Furaha Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Thabith, who is in his mid 40's, is married with six kids; three that are grown and three still at school.  He is an electrician and also repairs refrigerators and cars, and sells juice, soda, and water.  He has been in this business for twelve years now.  He works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Thabith's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the profit to pay school fees, build his own house and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy spare parts for refrigerators and cars, and to increase his inventory of juice, water, and soda.  He dreams of building another house to rent to people.

Thabith will share this loan with his loan group, "Furaha Tegeta". The two members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for refrigerator and car repairs and to increase his inventory of juice, water and sodas.

loans.name: Anavel

texts.en:
Anavel is 36 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Anavel has been in this business for four years. In the future, Anavel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 4,500 housing loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Elizabeth will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 58 years old and married. Claudia works very hard to provide for them.

Claudia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Claudia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Claudia has taken a PHP 9,700 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

Claudia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 51 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Nida's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nida has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Nida has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

Nida is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo, a sus 79 años nos muestra con orgullo su vida laboral activa. A pesar de su avanzada edad, hace 5 años se gana el pan del día a día junto con sus dos hijos, como comercializador de ropa y alquiler de sillas. A pesar de no haber terminado su secundaria, él siempre ha buscado como darle lo mejor a sus hijos como padre soltero, es por esto que no piensa dejar de trabajar. 
Reynaldo necesita un préstamo para aumentar su capital en el negocio mediante la compra de mesas y ropa, la cual se venderá en su propia casa y de donde podrá tener la oportunidad de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: At age 79, Reynaldo is proud of his active work life. Despite his advanced age, for the past five years he has earned his daily bread working with his two children as a clothing salesman and by running a chair rental business. Even though he didn't finish high school, he has always sought out ways to give the best to his children as a single father.  This is why he doesn't think about retiring. Reynaldo needs a loan to capitalize his business by buying tables and clothing, which he will sell from his house and, in so doing, will be able to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy tables and clothing

loans.name: Emely Altaracia

texts.es:
Emely Altagracia es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Emely tengo 20 años, soy de La Vega, Rep. Dom., vivo con mi hermana y dos tías. Estudio el   6to. Ciclo de  Medicina en la Universidad Católica y Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI), curso ésta carrera porque siempre me ha gustado ser parte de la mejora y solución de los problemas de los demás, también hay un gran vinculo con lo que es el valor humano, la solidaridad, el amor y la bondad.
	
Mi familia está haciendo un gran sacrificio para que yo pueda cumplir con todo esto y además también para hacerme una persona de bien y útil en la sociedad pero esta carrera es de muy alto presupuesto para  nuestro alcance y es por ello que me dirijo a ustedes.

Un sueño que también poseo es tener una fundación sin fines de lucro para ayudar a personas que no se puedan costear los servicios de salud que necesiten, darle a mi familia un mejor futuro y estabilidad, que los haga sentir seguros y protegidos.
texts.en:
Emel Altagracia is a young medical student.  She is requesting a loan to cover her educational costs.  Here is her story:  “My name is Emely. I am 20 years old. I am from La Vega, Dominican Republic. I live with my sister and two aunts. I am in the sixth cycle of medicine at la Universidad Católica y Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI)  [the Catholic and Technological University  of Cibao]. I am taking a degree in medicine because I have always liked to be part of improving and solving the problems of others.  Moreover, there is a great affinity between this field and human value, solidarity, love and kindness.

My family is making a great sacrifice so that I can commit to all of this and also in order that I develop into a decent and useful member of society. However,  this profession requires financing beyond our means and so I have come to all of you.

I also have a dream of establishing a charitable foundation that will help people who cannot afford the health services they need. I also want to give my family a better future and stability that will make them feel secure and protected.”

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Evaline, a mother of three, from Litein, a remote village in Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the last nine years of her life farming. She sells milk, tea, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also offers transportation solutions to other farmers in Litein using her motorcycle. Evaline is a go-getter, who occasionally engages in various seasonal businesses to make extra money. 

Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy is the one she is cut out for. She enjoys milking the cows at dawn and in the evening before preparing supper. She is very close to her cows. She makes a point to name and follow up on every animal she gets into her compound. 

Evaline is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. She has enough space and fodder for more animals than what she has. Her farm has room for more dairy animals. The additional cow will produce more milk for sale, utilize the available pasture, and produce more dung for organic manure and biogas. 

With your loan, Evaline will not only create value, but also enough income for her children's school fees. All Evaline dreams of for her children is a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, aged 32, lives in the village in Svay Chek district, Banteay Meanchey province. He is married and has one child. Phat and his wife own and operate a farming business in this region, growing and selling rice products to earn a living. He has been a farmer for almost 15 years, earning a decent income for his family.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Phat is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding his family's health and protecting the environment. He will use the loan he's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 53 years old and has eleven children, five of whom are in school. Petronila works very hard to provide for them.

Petronila's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Petronila has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Petronila has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Erica is 24 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Erica 's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Erica is taking out a PHP 9,595 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. This will be used to build a house for her family.

Erica has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Erica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 59 years old, married, and has eight children.  She and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Primitiva is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Primitiva has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her hog raising.

With your help, Primitiva can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.  In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya lives in Armavir town with her husband. They have been renting a small store in the town center for ten years. The couple trades with clothing and shoes for woman.

The requested loan of USD 2,000 is very important for Melanya and her husband to purchase new supplies for the store. The loan will help them to meet their customers' demand and enlarge their retail business.

loans.use: to pay for new supplies to resell.

loans.name: Ailenda

texts.en:
Ailenda is 36 years old and married with children, two of whom are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. But her business and family home were wiped out.

Ailenda is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. This will be used to build a house for her family. Ailenda has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her hog raising business.

With your help, Ailenda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 59 years old and married with children who are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. But her business and family home were wiped out.

Anecita is taking out a housing loan in the amount PHP 4,000 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. This will be used to build a house for her family. Anecita has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her business. With your help, Anecita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 27 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Edelyn 's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Edelyn is taking out a PHP 7,350 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. This will be used to build a house for her family.

Edelyn has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Edelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Najla*** Group

texts.en:
This group is called Najla*** and it consists of five women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. Maryam is a hardworking woman. She is a married woman with six children who lives in a poor area in Sana'a. Her oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest one is 7 years old. She is the leader of the group.  Maryam is an educated woman, and she is very dynamic.

Maryam has operated her business of selling women's clothing and accessories door-to-door for more than 15 years. She started her business with a small amount of capital. Year by year, her business improves more, and what she earns as profit goes toward the expenses of her family. Unfortunately, her business income is not enough to enlarge her business, and she wants to improve it.

Maryam has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to purchase more women's clothing and accessories to sell to her customers. She looks forward to expanding her business more, and she hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothing and accessories to resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Alba Lila

texts.es:
Alba de 51 años, es catalogada por entregarse con pasión al mundo laboral y más cuando se trata de vender un producto. La jubilación de su madre la motivó más a superarse, ya que ahora solo son ellas dos quienes están juntas. Ya lleva 3 años sosteniendo su propia pulpería con distintos productos como granos básicos, ropa y cosméticos. 
Alba, a pesar de ya no tener la responsabilidad económica de sus dos hijos adultos y recibir de vez en cuando remesas de su hermana, no cubre los gastos del hogar. Además necesita cuidar de su madre, quien ya no trabaja. Por esta razón requiere del préstamo para comprar sardina, arroz, azúcar, ropa y cosméticos, los cuales pueda vender en su negocio. De esta manera podrá presentar mayor variedad a sus clientes, incrementar sus ingresos y lograr el sueño de mejorar su casa y ayudar a su madre.
texts.en:
Alba, 51, is defined by giving herself passionately to her work and especially when her job is selling a product. Her mother’s retirement motivated her to excel since now it is only the two of them who are together. 

Alba has been running her own small store for the past 3 years where she offers a variety of products, such as basic grains, clothing and cosmetics.  Despite no longer being economically responsible for her two adult children and receiving remittances occasionally from her sister, she is not able to cover household expenses. In addition she needs to care for her mother, who no longer works. Consequently she needs a loan to purchase sardines, rice, sugar, clothing and cosmetics, which she can sell in her store. This will enable her to offer a larger inventory to her customers, increase her earning and fulfill the dream of improving her house and helping her mother.

loans.use: to purchase sardines, rice, sugar, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: José Saturnino

texts.es:
José de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado debido a las condiciones económicas de su familia no pudo estudiar más tiempo y debido a la distancia que estaban las escuelas, él es casado su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos y a vender frutas y verduras, tienen 4 hijos los cuales están casados y viven aparte ya son personas independientes, en su vivienda  solo vive él y su esposa.

 José es hortalisero  se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas de tomate, chile , pepino, frijol, maíz pipián etc. desde hace 30 años, comenta que aprendió este trabajo gracias a un programa que impartió sobre el cultivo de hortalizas  la escuela nacional de agricultura de El Salvador , comenta que siempre le motivo este trabajo pues para él es una actividad muy rentable que le genera buenos ingresos económicos para su familia, comenta que siempre recibe el apoyo de su esposa en las actividades que realiza en los cultivos que requiere de ayuda y en ocasiones de sus hijos.

El préstamo lo utilizara para los cultivos de hortalizas,  él quiere hacer crecer su negocio ya que gracias a él le da el sostenimiento a su vivienda con lo necesario, y también lo utilizara para mejorar  su vivienda y ampliarla un poco más comenta que quiere vivir en mejores condiciones él y su esposa. Específicamente comprara, cJosé de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado debido a las condiciones económicas de su familia no pudo estudiar más tiempo y debido a la distancia que estaban las escuelas, él es casado su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos y a vender frutas y verduras, tienen 4 hijos los cuales están casados y viven aparte ya son personas independientes, en su vivienda  solo vive él y su esposa.

 José es hortalisero  se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas de tomate, chile , pepino, frijol, maíz pipián etc. desde hace 30 años, comenta que aprendió este trabajo gracias a un programa que impartió sobre el cultivo de hortalizas  la escuela nacional de agricultura de El Salvador , comenta que siempre le motivo este trabajo pues para él es una actividad muy rentable que le genera buenos ingresos económicos para su familia, comenta que siempre recibe el apoyo de su esposa en las actividades que realiza en los cultivos que requiere de ayuda y en ocasiones de sus hijos.

El préstamo lo utilizara para los cultivos de hortalizas,  él quiere hacer crecer su negocio ya que gracias a él le da el sostenimiento a su vivienda con lo necesario, y también lo utilizara para mejorar  su vivienda y ampliarla un poco más comenta que quiere vivir en mejores condiciones él y su esposa. Específicamente comprara, semillas de tomate, chile, pepino, frijol, maíz pipián, abono y fertilizantes, cemento, arena y grava.

José desea para el futuro expandir sus cultivos llegar a tener un negocio permanente, el cual le pueda comercializar su productos a otros mercados regionales de esta manera generar más ingresos económicos y seguir dándole  el sostenimiento y a su familia, también desea mejorar su vivienda ampliarla,  para vivir más cómodamente él y su esposa.


José desea para el futuro expandir sus cultivos llegar a tener un negocio permanente, el cual le pueda comercializar su productos a otros mercados regionales de esta manera generar más ingresos económicos y seguir dándole  el sostenimiento y a su familia, también desea mejorar su vivienda ampliarla,  para vivir más cómodamente él y su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 61 years old and completed school through the first grade due to his family's economic circumstances. He is married and his wife is a homemaker and also sells fruits and vegetables. He has four children who are all married and live on their own. His household is just he and his wife. 

José is a horticulturist who has grown tomatoes, peppers, beans, corn, pumpkins, etc. for 30 years. He tells us he learned his trade through a horticulture program at the National Agricultural School of El Salvador. He finds it to be a profitable venture that generates a good income for his family. His wife has always supported him in his growing and he has also had the help of his children on occasions. 
 
He will use this loan for his crops, seeking to grow his business and meet his household needs and allow him to improve his house and expand it a little.  Specifically, he will buy seeds for tomatoes, chiles, beans, corn, pumpkins, and compost and fertilizer, cement and gravel. José hopes to expand his crops in the future to guarantee a durable business where he can sell his produce to regional merchants and, in so doing, increase his earnings and go on providing for his family. He also plans to improve his home and expand it so that he may live more comfortably with his wife.

loans.use: to buy seeds for tomatoes, chiles, beans, corn, pumpkins, and compost and fertilizer, cement and gravel.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sirifila, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments et d’habillements.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KOROTOUMOU, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habits. Elle compte acheter 15 pièces de pagnes wax chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 76 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of married women, who average 46 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Sirifila, in Communce de Massigui, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains, condiments, and clothing. 

The women of the group DANAYA are on their 23rd solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand of their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.  

This client, KOROTOUMOU, who is the first person standing from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of clothing. She intends to purchase 15 items of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from wholesalers in Bamako. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home and at the market. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 76,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing made of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Victoria Emelina

texts.es: Victoria tiene 51 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos nietos de 15 años y 9 años de edad. Victoria es una mujer emprendedora quien con mucho esfuerzo va sacando adelante a su familia. Ella se dedica  al comercio de pescado y ropa para mujeres y con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio en la compra de más mercadería que le permita atraer a más clientes. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de ropa, zapatos y sandalias para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Victoria is 51 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband and their two grandchildren, ages 15 and 9. Victoria is an entrepreneurial woman who with much effort is raising her family. She works in commerce, selling fish and clothing for women. With the goal of improving her income, she has made the decision to invest in her business by buying more merchandise, which will allow her to attract more customers.
