To do this, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in her business by buying a variety of clothing, shoes, and sandals to improve her sales and income and thus improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, shoes, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Ney Lidia

texts.es: Ney de 46 años de edad, habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 16 años. Ella para apoyar el sostenimiento de su hogar, genera ingresos mediante su dedicación a la actividad comercial de vender ropa, calzado útiles escolares y mercancías variadas.     Desde hace 5 años inició su aventura de negocios pues, cuando pequeña mostró su inclinación por hacer negocios.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito,  desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, comprando de contado en piqueteaderos, para venderle a vecinos y amigos . Su meta es tener su propio local  y mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia. Pero su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiación para lograr sus propósitos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  ropa, calzado y útiles escolares. Con su inversión,  planea aumentar sus inventarios y con ello vender mucho mas, Lo cual se constituye en el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en: Ney, who is 46 years old, lives in a community in the metropolitan area of the city with her spouse and their two children, ages 9 and 16. To support the sustenance of her household, she generates income through her dedication to her commercial activity of selling clothing, footwear, school supplies, and various other merchandise. She began her business venture five years ago, since when she was small, she demonstrated her inclination for business. She makes her sales for cash and on credit from 8 in the morning until 9 at night, buying for cash in small quantities to sell to her neighbors and friends. Her goal is to have her own shop and improve the quality of life of her family. But her greatest challenge is to obtain sources of financing to achieve her goals. She is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy clothing, footwear, and school supplies. With the investment, she plans to increase her inventory and with that to sell much more, which for her would constitute the success of this investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 23 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Judith and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. But her business and family home were wiped out.

Judith is taking out a PHP 8,750 housing loan in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. This will be used to build a house for her family. Judith has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Judith can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sirifila, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales et d’habillements.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente AMI, première personne a partir de la gauche dans le rang des assise n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter 50 kg de riz, des condiments, du beurre de karité et de la farine boulangère chez les grossistes à Dioïla. La vente des plats se fait en espèce dans sa gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKOLA is composed of married women, who average 46 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Sirifila, in Commune de Massigui, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains and clothing. 

The women of the group BENKOLA are on their 23rd solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand of their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, AMI, who is the first person sitting from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a restaurateur. She intends to purchase 50 kg of rice, some condiments, shea butter, and baker’s flour from wholesalers in Dioïla. Her sales of food is made to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her stall. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar, cereals, packs of soft drinks, and candies.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKAN est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Koda, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales et de vanne.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe BENKAN sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente ALIMA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter 50 kg de riz, du beurre de karité, de la farine boulangère et des condiments chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente des plats se fait en espèce dans sa  gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group BENKAN is composed of married women, who average 40 years of age and six children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Koda, in Commune de Massigui, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains and basketry. 

The women of the group BENKAN are on their 8th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand of their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, ALIMA, who is the second person standing from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a restaurateur. She intends to purchase 50 kg of rice, shea butter, baker’s flour, and some condiments from wholesalers at the weekly market. Her sales of food are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her stall. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover her children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria ha sido una mujer guerrera que nunca se ha dejado vencer por las adversidades y siempre ha tratado de luchar por sus sueños.
Ella tiene un taller de confección en contratación con terceros y genera empleo a dos personas, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre desde que era una niña.
Pero no todo fue color de rosa, pues esta mujer tuvo que pasar múltiples pruebas en su vida para llegar a conformar en modulo productivo que actualmente tiene, pasando por largas noches de trasnocho, madrugadas y en ciertas ocasiones indicios de humillación. Pero todo esto le sirvió para ser fuerte y progresar.
Ella desea un apoyo económico para comprar telas e insumos para su producción ya que ha tenido muchos pedidos y no los ha podido cubrir por falta de materia prima para trabajar.
Al obtener estos elementos, ella podrá tener un nivel de producción más alto y efectivo, lo que permitirá obtener más ingresos para su familia.
Su mayor sueño es tener una gran fábrica de confección con capacidad para emplear a muchas personas.
texts.en:
Gloria has been a warrior woman who has never admitted defeat by her adversaries and who has always tried to fight for her dreams. 

She owns a sewing workshop contracted to third parties and generates employment for two people. She learned this trade from her mother when she was a child. Nevertheless it was not all rosy since this woman had to pass multiple tests in her life in order to achieve the productivity she currently has; she had to spent long nights staying up until dawn and on certain occasions endure hints of humiliation. But all of this served to make her strong and prosper.

She wants economic help in order to purchase materials and supplies for her production because she has had many orders but has not been able to fill them due to the lack of raw materials with which to work. Upon obtaining these products, she will be able to attain a higher and more effective level of production. This will enable her to earn more for her family.

Her great dream is to own a large sewing factory with the capacity to employ many people.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and supplies, such as thread and needles, in order to continue production.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sirifila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments et d’habillements.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente BATOMA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 1 carton de poison fumée, des sacs de sel, des cartons de cubes Maggi et des boites de pâte de tomate chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera en parti réinvesti dans son activité et le reste couvrir les petites dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The group DJIGUISSEME is composed of married women, who average 40 years of age and six children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Sirifila, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains, condiments, and clothing. 

The women of the group DJIGUISSEME are on their 23rd solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand of their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, BATOMA, who is the person standing in the middle, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase a box of smoked fish, bags of salt, boxes of Maggi cubes [bouillon cubes], and cans of tomato paste from wholesalers in Bamako. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home and at the market. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will in part be reinvested in her business. The rest will be used to cover sundry day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sirifila, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et de savon artisanal (gabakourouni).                                                             
Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KADIA, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savons. Elle compte acheter 4 sacs de savon artisanal (gabakourouni) chez les grossistes à Dioïla. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au village à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group KOTOGNONTALA is composed of married women, who average 39 years of age and five children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Sirifila, in Commune de Massigui, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in condiments and artisanal soap (gabakourouni). 

The women of the group KOTOGNONTALA are on their second solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand of their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, KADIA, who is the first person sitting from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of soaps. She intends to purchase 4 sacks of artisanal soap (gabakourouni) from wholesalers in Dioïla. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home and in the village. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase artisanal soap (gabakourouni)

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments de tubercules et de jus.                                                           
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente WASSA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de jus. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de sucre, des bouteilles vides, du sachet plastique et autres matières premières sur place avec les grossistes à Dioïla, puis le transforme en jus de qualité. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché  et dans les villages environnants à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of married women, who average 40 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Dioïla, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in tubers and juice drinks. 

The women of the group BENKADI are on their 7th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand of their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, WASSA, who is the person standing in the middle in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of juice drinks. She intends to purchase 2 sacks of sugar, some empty bottles, plastic backs, and other basic material locally from wholesalers in Dioïla. She then processes the supplies into quality juice drinks. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the market and in surrounding villages. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making juice drinks

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 52 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Julieta's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Thus, she has taken out a 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) housing loan through NWTF to pay for materials and construction labor to rebuild her family home. 

Julieta is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for building materials and construction labor

loans.name: Santos Erodita

texts.es:
Santos, estudio hasta sexto grado, es acompañada, su esposo trabaja como seguridad en la construcción de la presa, tiene 3 hijos, una  ya está acompañada vive aparte el 2do es docente y trabaja en el centro escolar, la 3ra está estudiando 4to año de Lic. en  ciencias de la educación en la universidad, con ella solo viven dos de sus hijos, su esposo y una nieta


Santos se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también siembra una pequeña parcela de maíz, sus hijos son quienes le ayudan económicamente. Trabajando en la agricultura tiene 10 años, ya que sus padres eran jornaleros y ella se involucraba mucho en ello y le gustó mucho trabajar sacar producción, siempre se a dedicado a los oficios domésticos, en la siembra de los granos básicos es su esposo quien le ayuda dirigiendo las actividades que hay que realizar, cuando trabaja en el área agrícola lo hace de 7 am a 12 M.D

  
Con el financiamiento comprara todos los insumos para la siembra de los granos básicos, como semilla, fertilizantes, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra; también pagara parte del crédito vigente en la institución. Además comprara 6 pliegos de lámina para mejorar el techo de su casa, 8 cuartones, dos libras de clavos y 50 varas de tusa para detener la teja. El crédito ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida pues tendrá más producción y también podrá vivir en un ambiente mejor para sus hijos ya que vivirán más confiados bajo su nuevo techo.

El sueño de Santos es que su hija termine de estudiar y verla un día graduada de Lic. en ciencias de la educación y que en un futuro pueda tener un trabajo y pueda aportar para el sustento de su familia. Todo esto lo va lograr con esfuerzo y dedicación
texts.en:
Santos studied up to the sixth grade and has a husband who works as a security guard in a dam construction site. She has three children. One has a partner and lives on her own. The second one is a teacher and works at a school. The third one is in fourth year of university, majoring in Education. Only two of her children, her husband and her granddaughter live with her. 

Santos performs household chores, but also cultivates corn in a small plot of land. Her children support her financially. She has worked in agriculture for 10 years. Her parents were laborers and she was interested in this activity. She likes working and growing products. She has always performed domestic chores. Her husband helps her directing the required activities related to the sowing of basic grains. When she works in agriculture, she does it from 7:00 a.m. until noon.

With this loan, she will buy all the supplies for the sowing of basic grains, such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, will pay for agricultural labor and a current loan, and will buy 6 sheets, 8 beams, two pounds of nails and 50 cane sticks to improve her home's roof. The loan will help her ameliorate her quality of life, as she will improve her production and will be able to live in a better environment where her children will be more at ease under their new roof. 
  
Santos' dream is for her daughter to finish her studies, to see her with a degree in Education, and for her to have a job in the future so that she could contribute to her family's sustenance. She will achieve all of this with effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, to pay for agricultural labor and a current loan, and to buy 6 sheets, 8 beams, two pounds of nails and 50 cane sticks to improve her home's roof.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 38 years old and married with six children. With three children currently in school, Nancy works very hard to provide for her family.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 29,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, detergent, canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads and hair conditioner. 

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, detergent, canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads and hair conditioner.

loans.name: Agrepina

texts.en:
Agrepina is 48 years old and is married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. Thus, she is taking out a housing loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to pay for building materials and construction labor so she can build a new house for her family. 

Agrepina has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover her family's life through her pig raising business.

With your help, Agrepina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for building materials and construction labor

loans.name: Aramazd

texts.en:
Aramazd is 59 years old and lives with his wife in Dilijan, Armenia. They have four daughters, who are all married and live separately with their families. For several years, Aramazd worked as a barman at the Dilijan rest house. Now he works at a private company as a cashier while his wife works at a bank. 

Recently, Aramazd’s car has broken down and become impossible to drive. This is costing him a lot of time and money because his work is far from his house and such a long distance to travel by taxi or even bus. Thus, he is asking for this loan in order to buy car parts and finally repair his car, which is of great use to his family.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат работает швеей на протяжении 7 лет. Ей 51 год. Она жительница района Вахш и проживает там с тремя дочерьми и сыном. Старшие дочери помогают ей в деятельности, а младшая дочь и сын школьники. Саодат одна без мужа воспитывает детей. Она работает усердно, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Саодат еще в юности научилась у своей матери швейному делу и это очень помогло ей в жизни. Благодаря своему умению шитью она зарабатывает на жизнь, так как у нее только среднее образование. Поэтому Саодат благодарна матери, что она научила ее этой деятельности.
Сейчас Саодат намеревается расширить деятельность. Она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести новую модернизированную швейную машинку, на которой она будет шить быстрее и качественнее и еще сможет делать на платьях вышивки. Это поможет ей увеличить количество заказов и таким образом улучшить финансовое положение своей семьи.
texts.en:
Saodat has been earning a living sewing for seven years. She is 51 and lives in the Vakhsh region with her son and three daughters. The older daughters help her with her work and the youngest daughter and son are still in school. Saodat is raising her children alone, without a husband. She works diligently to take care of her family. Saodat learned how to sew in her youth from her mother and this skill has helped her a great deal in life. Thanks to her sewing abilities she is able to earn a living, since she only has a high school education. Therefore Saodat is grateful to her mother for teaching her this trade.

At this time, Saodat intends to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to acquire a new, modern sewing machine on which she will be able to sew quicker and better and to do embroidery on dresses. This will help her to improve the quality of her orders and in such a way to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy organic manure and hire day laborers

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 34 years old and has one child. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Suzette is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Suzette requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Suzette has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Suzette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy supplies for her coffee fields

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 52 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Milagros is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Milagros has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 31 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Jocelyn and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Jocelyn is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,600 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jocelyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Jocelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 61 years old and she lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. Nina has no higher education and for 25 years, she has simultaneously worked as a cleaner and been engaged in swine breeding. She runs a farm in the nearby village of Khashtarak where she breeds pigs, cows, and calves and on her plot of land, she cultivates a great variety of fruits and vegetables (potatoes, carrots, greens, apples, plums, peaches, etc.). The income of her family she receives from the sale of her farm goods and perfect quality meat. In farming, her husband helps her very much both physically and with his skills and knowledge of farming. With Nina and her husband also lives their grandson.
 
Nina is asking for this loan to buy several pigs and a lot of fodder for her farm animals.

loans.use: to buy several pigs and a lot of fodder for her farm animals

loans.name: Fredigunda

texts.en:
Fredigunda is 61 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Fredigunda has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Fredigunda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene un hijo de 2 años, el vive solo se dedica a trabajar de chofer de maquinaria pesada, comenta que tiene experiencia de tres años en la crianza de pollos ya que su madre le enseña de esta actividad, con el crédito va a comprar pollos  para tenerlos en un galpón en el mismo lugar donde tiene los pollos su hermano, su aspiración es incrementar su negocio y darle a su hijo lo que le haga falta.
texts.en: Pedro has a 2-year old son. He lives alone and earns his living driving heavy machinery.  He has three years of experience raising chickens, a job taught to him by his mother. With the loan Pedro plans to buy chickens and keep them in a coop, the same place that his brother also keeps chickens. His hope for the future is to expand his business and provide his son with whatever he needs.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru:
Таджикистан славиться  своими вкусными натуральными фруктами, овощами и сельхоз культурой. Вот и наступила пора посадки семян разных сельхоз культур. Особенно жители села очень усердно занимаются земледелием и посадкой зерен разного вида. Наш клиент Равшан тоже занимается посадкой сельхоз культур. В данное время он  подготавливает землю к посадке.
Равшан позитивный, трудолюбивый, общительный молодой человек. Ему 20 лет. Не женат. Живет с родителями в селе. Как мы уже отметили, Равшан работает на поле, занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Кроме этого Равшан еще мастер по  штукатурки. Он работает в бригаде, работа Равшана сезонная. Но у него в летний период дела просто кипят,  он старается успевать на все. Большее время и внимание Равшан конечно же уделяет к полевым работам. К сожалению, у Равшана немножко проблемы с  денежными средствами, ему не хватает немного денег  для реализации своих планов. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом в МДО Арванд, он очень надеется на поддержку организации.
Равшан мечтает и планирует создать семью, но сперва он  хотел бы самостоятельно зарабатывает деньги, чтоб будущим  смог обеспечить свою семью и достойно воспитать детей.
texts.en: Tajikistan is famous for their delicious fruits and vegetables. Right now is the planting time for most of the crops and the residents of Ravshan's village are all busy planting. Ravshan is also a farmer and needs to prepare his fields for planting. He is a hard-working, optimistic and outgoing young man. He is 20, married and lives with his parents in the village. As we just mentioned, Ravshan is a farmer, but he also applies plaster and lime coating in houses. He works as part of a team and this construction work is seasonal. But because of it, in summer Ravshan is tremendously busy, he tries to get it all done. Most of his time and attention, without a doubt, goes towards his fieldwork. Unfortunately, Ravshan is currently having financial difficulties and needs additional money for his business. For this reason he has turned to microfinance bank "Arvand" and he hopes the organization can support him. In the future Ravshan dreams of having a family, but first he needs to become independent and be able to provide for his future family and raise his children well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 50 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios' business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Remedios has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Remedios is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 52 years old and married with six children.  With two of her children in school, Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Yolanda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Yolanda has taken a PHP 4,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Yolanda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Faber De Jesus

texts.es:
Faber es un hombre con miras siempre al futuro y bienestar de su familia.
Es un hombre responsable y dedicado completamente al cuidado y protección de sus hijos.
El inicio con su tienda de abarrotes y comestibles desde hace ya 5 años, y ha tenido que pasar por múltiples obstáculos para lograr consolidar su negocio.
Empezó atendiendo a sus clientes desde una ventanita en la casa de sus padres, pero luego, gracias a su organización logro conseguir un local e instalarse allí.
Hoy en día tiene una tienda bien acreditada donde ofrece variados productos, pero tiene una nevera en mal estado y le ha provocado muchos problemas, pues los productos que coloca allí tienden a dañarse. El tiene la esperanza de poder comprarse una nevera nueva, de este modo podrá conservar los productos frescos para sus clientes y aumentará su rentabilidad.
texts.en: Faber is a man with his eye always on the future and the well-being of his family.  He is a responsible man and completely dedicated to the care and protection of his children.  He started with his grocery store five years ago, and he has had to go through multiple obstacles in order to build his business.  He began serving his customers from a little window in his parents' house, but later, thanks to his organization, he was able to find a place and set up his shop.  Today he has a well accredited store where he offers various products, but he has a refrigerator in poor condition and it has caused him many problems, as the products he stores in there have a tendency to get ruined.  He has the hope of being able to purchase a new fridge, and with that he will be able to conserve the freshness of his products for his customers and increase his profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for his business.

loans.name: Ihtierdjon

texts.ru: Ихтиёрджону  47 лет. У него большая и дружная семья. Он женат и имеет троих прекрасных детей , которых вырастил такими же трудолюбивыми и как и сам. У него есть небольшой магазин . Он занимается тем, что продает продукты питания. Вся семья участвует в семейном бизнесе. Жена и старшие дети  помогают ему. Младшие ещё учатся в школе.   С ростом детей растут и потребности семьи и конечно же финансовые затраты тоже растут. А так как его услуги  пользуются спросом ,   Ихтиёрджон хочет расширить ассортимент продуктови тем самым получить дополнительный доход.   Для этого ему потребовалась дополнительная сумма за которой он обратился в «Арванд» . Ихтиёрджон доволен тем, что сможет  быстро и удобно оформить кредит и с помощью этой суммы он сможет воплотить свои планы в реальность.
texts.en: Ihtierdjon is 47 years old. He has a large and tightly knit family. He is married and has three amazing children, whom he raised to be just as hardworking as himself. Ihtierdjon owns a small grocery store where he sells various goods. The whole family helps managing the family business. His wife and his older children help out in the store, while the youngest kids are still attending school. As his children are growing, Ihtierdjon has found that their needs and expenses grow as well. Since his store is popular among the residents, Ihtierdjon wants to expand the assortment of groceries he is offering and so earn additional profits. To finance this expansion Ihtierdjon has turned to "Arvand" for a loan. He especially liked how fast and convenient is was to fill out a loan application. He hopes that this loan will allow him to make his business plans a reality.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, age 42, lives in Dansoman. He is married, and they have one child. His wife is also a trader.

Daniel is a husband who is a tailor. He buys materials, sews and sells to customers. He has been doing this job for eight years and has been able to sustain this job through eight successive loan cycles. Therefore, he is very grateful and thankful for this help, which will make him move on well.

This loan is to buy all types of materials which he will sew and sell to customers. He dreams of giving his child the best.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru:
Абдумачиду 44 года он живет в далеком от города селе. У него большая семья, он женат у него четверо детей. Абдумачид получил среднее специальное образование. Подрастают дети , которым конечно же Абдумачиду хотелось бы дать хорошее образование. Так как дети растут и стремятся жить в городе им в будущем , чтобы устроиться на работу нужна будет хорошая специальность. 
 Жена и подрастающие дети помогают ему по уходу за скотом. Ведь Абдумачид  дополнительно к  своему основному занятию  выращивает скот, а его жена перерабатывает молоко и приносит дополнительную прибыль в бюджет семьи. Но для того чтобы отложить на учебу детей  этих средств не хватает и поэтому Абдумачид хочет приобрести дополнительно небольшого теленка.  Он обратился в "Арванд" за кредитом и заранее выразил свою благодарность за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Abdumajid is 44 years old, and he lives in a remote village. He has a large family - a wife and four children. Abdumajid has a professional school degree. Now that his kids are growing up Abdumajid wants to give them a good education. As his children want to move to the big city they need to have useful and well-paying professions. Abdumajid's wife and kids help him with the family business - cattle. Abdumajid sells the meat and his wife milks cows and sells various dairy products. But in order to pay for his kid's education the business needs to expand and thus Abdumajid decided to buy another calf. He has turned to "Arvand" for a loan and is grateful for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Utulivu Group Musoma

texts.en:
Vaileth, who is in her late 30s, is married with four children who are still going to school. She has been selling different types of clothes for four years now. She works from 7:30 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Vaileth's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy new stocks of clothes and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support for the Utulivu group. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date clothes to resell. She dreams of owning a wholesale retail shop.

Vaileth will share this loan with her loan group Utulivu with two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date clothes to resell.

loans.name: Marco Rene

texts.es: Rene es un joven muy trabador, a sus  24 años  se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y al jornal del trabajo en el campo, él vive solo en un cuarto que paga arriendo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para incrementar su negocio y para mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera ampliar su negocio para salir adelante en su vida ya  que no tiene apoyo de ningún familiar, es un joven positivo y alegre con su negocio.
texts.en: Rene is a very hardworking young man.  At 24 years old, he works in raising pigs and also performs wage labor in the countryside.  He lives alone in a room paying rent.  Rene will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs in order to increase his business and to improve his income.  By doing this, he will expand his business to get ahead in his life, as he has no support from any relatives.  He is an optimistic young man and happy with his business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Judeline

texts.en:
Judeline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Judeline is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Judeline has a business raising chickens in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her chickens.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Judeline has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Judeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her chickens

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and has three children. She is a widow and has two children who are in school.

Delia and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Delia is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Delia has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her business.

With your help, Delia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 72 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Abraham has no higher education but he is a very famous and skilled electrician in his city and despite his age he still works at a private company and he also has a lot of orders waiting to be fulfilled. Abraham lives with his wife and smaller grandson. His son and his wife and elder son temporarily live in the Russian Federation. Abraham’s grandson is a student at the paid division of Yerevan State Economical University. Abraham dreams that his grandson will become a highly qualified and clever economist and he will manage to find profitable and interesting work in his profession. But at this moment he does his best to support him with everything that may promote his learning process.

Abraham is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer for his grandson. He wants him to be aware of any innovation and any information that can help him to enlarge his knowledge and skills in his profession.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his grandson

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, coffee, sugar, shampoo and other groceries.

In the future Josephine would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a candle making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials like wax, cord, etc. for her candle making business.

Alona has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from nipa roofing.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like wax, cord, etc. for her business

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 62 years old and married with seven children, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Aurelia's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Aurelia is taking out a bridge loan to restart her business buying and selling charcoal and firewood.

Aurelia has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her business buying and selling charcoal and firewood.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Aurelia is committed to rebuild, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He is married and has a daughter (she is already married and lives with her family) and a son who is a very talented young man. Despite having a completely different profession, he writes songs, very nicely and with a great sense of love and tenderness. He took part in many festivals and he is already a rather famous musician being only 28 years old. Vazgen’s wife is engaged in the clothes trading business. Vazgen works at a private company as a driver. He makes passenger transfers from Vanadzor to Yerevan and back. Vazgen says that the way that he drives is rather long and people get tired, and now with the coming of warm seasons it is now more difficult and uncomfortable to sit in a minibus full of passengers.

Vazgen needs this loan in order to make his minibus more comfortable for his passengers. In particular he wants to buy an air conditioner, which will make his passengers satisfied and they can enjoy their long way.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner to make his minibus more comfortable for his passengers

loans.name: Glenda Aida

texts.es: Glenda tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 15 años de edad y su hija de 11 años de edad. GLenda es pequeña comerciante de pescado, cosméticos y ropa nueva. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. El negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de mercadería como: mayor cantidad de libras de pescado y variedad de ropa(faldas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, etc.) para lograr mejorar sus ventas así como sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda is 33 years old, a single mother who lives in her own home with her 15 year old son and 11 year old daughter. Glenda is a small dealer of fish, cosmetics and firsthand clothing. This is how she earns a living and maintains her household.

Her business is her main source of income, this is why she wants to keep it going for much more time.

For the latter reason, she has taken the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in her business, buying merchandise such as: a larger quantity of pounds of fish and a variety of clothing (skirts, trousers, dresses, blouses, etc) to achieve an improvement in sales, as well as in her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of pounds of fish and a variety of clothing (skirts, trousers, dresses, blouses, etc)

loans.name: Jorge Anibal

texts.es: Anibal vive con sus padres y con 3 hermanos  él se dedica a criar pollos y también trabaja de chofer, comenta que hace un año atrás tuvo que salirse de su trabajo anterior para poder asistir al curso de choferes y lograr obtener su licencia de conducir autos y que esa es una meta ya cumplida y que su próxima meta es incrementar su negocio de pollos para en un futuro ponerse un carro de cooperativa y trabajar  en este vehículo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para criarlos en un galpón.
texts.en:
Anibal lives with his parents and three siblings. He raises chickens and also works as a driver. 

He says that a year ago he had to leave his previous job to be able to attend a driving course and get his car driver's license. With that goal reached, his next goal is to increase his poultry business so that in the future he can be in a car collective and work in that vehicle. 

The loan will be invested in buying chickens to raise them in a coup.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Ana Marta

texts.es:
Ana de 37 años  de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato,  es soltera, tiene 2 hijos el 1ro estudia segundo grado la  segunda estudia parvularia. Con ella viven sus dos hijos, su madre y sus hermanas.


Ana se dedica a trabajar en una clínica en el área de archivos.  Tiene  2 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, cuando le salió este trabajo fui a capacitación, luego con el paso del tiempo ha mejorado  muchísimo, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad ya que el empleo es escaso y ella tenía  que alimentar a sus hijos, antes solo era doméstica, la distancia que recorre es variable ya que fines pasa en un municipio y fines en otro municipio es decir no tiene un lugar fijo de trabajo, ya que sale a cubrir vacaciones también, los horarios de trabajo son de 8 a 4 pm.
 

Con el financiamiento cancelara parte de la deuda que tiene en credicampo. Por otra parte pretende comprar los insumos agrícolas, como semilla, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, ya que aunque ella no puede hacer todas las actividades agrícolas por lo pesado del trabajo paga mano de obra que le ayude a hacerlo.

Su sueño es tener su familia, es decir un padre para sus hijas y que le ayude a trabajar para darle una vida mejor, por otra parte no pierde la esperanza de tener su propia habitación  para vivir más cómoda con sus hijas y tener más privacidad para ella y su familia, ya que sus hijas crecerán y merecen una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old, she studied up to her bachillerato [high school qualification]. She has two children, the first in 2nd grade and the second in kindergarten. Her two children, mother and sisters live with her.
 
Ana works in the filing area of a clinic. She had been doing this job for two years when she got qualified. With the passing of time, she has improved greatly, and she decided to dedicate herself to this line of work, as jobs are scarce and she must feed her children. Before she was just a domestic maid. The distances that she travels to get to work are variable, as sometimes she works in the town, and other times in another town, which is to say that she doesn't have a fixed place of work. She also goes to cover for people on holiday, her working hours are from 8 to 4pm.

She will use this loan to pay part of the loan she has with Credicampo. With the other part she will buy farming supplies such as seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, and as she can't do all of the farm work as it is very heavy work, for the manual labor to help her do it.

Her dream is to have a family, that is to say a father for her daughters, who helps her to work to give them a better life, and moreover she hasn't lost the hope of having her own home to be able to live more comfortably with her daughters, and to have more privacy for her and her family as her daughters will grow up and they deserve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FAIDA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Dougoukono, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et de poissons congelés.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe FAIDA sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente SITAN, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de poisson congelé. Elle compte acheter 5 cartons de poissons chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché et celui des villages environnants à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Faida group is made up of married women who average 37 years of age with four children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioïla, in the Dougoukono district, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they have restauration activities and sell condiments and frozen fish. 

The women in the Faida group are on their seventh group loan and turned to Soro Yiriwaso so that they could satisfy their huge customer demand. 

The customer, Sitan, who is standing second from the left in the photo, is uneducated and currently sells frozen fish. She is planning to buy five cartons of fish from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her products retail and for cash at the local market and in other markets in surrounding villages to a diverse customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen fish.

loans.name: Joli Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JOLI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Dougoukono, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et de charbon de bois.
Les femmes du groupe JOLI sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente BIBA, personne au milieu n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon de bois. Elle compte acheter 55 sacs de charbon de bois avec les paysans de Zeta. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Bamako aux revendeurs et consommateurs. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Joli group is made up of married women who average 38 years of age with four children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioïla, in the Dougoukono district, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they have restauration activities and sell condiments and charcoal. 

The women in the Joli group are on their third group loan and turned to Soro Yiriwaso so that they could satisfy their huge customer demand. 

The customer, Biba, who is in the middle of the photo, is uneducated and currently sells charcoal. She is planning to buy 55 sacks of charcoal from peasants in Zeta. She sells her charcoal retail and for cash in Bamako to retailers and consumers. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Dougoukono, commune de Kaladougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration et le commerce de condiments.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente DJENEBA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter des sacs d’oignon, du sel, 1 carton de cube Maggi, des paniers de tomates fraîches et des boites de concentrée de tomate chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché journalier à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women who average 34 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioïla, in the Dougoukono district of the Kaladougou commune, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they have restauration activities and sell condiments. 

The women in the Danaya group are on their sixth group loan and turned to Soro Yiriwaso so that they could satisfy their huge customer demand. 

The customer, Djeneba, who is second from the left in the photo, is uneducated and currently sells condiments. She is planning to buy sacks of onions, salt, a carton of Maggi stock cubes, baskets of fresh tomatoes and cans of tomato purée from wholesalers at the weekly market. She sells her products retail and for cash from home and at the daily market to a diverse customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAIDOU est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Tripano, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et d’habillement.
Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente TATA , deuxième personne à partir de la droite n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter des condiments, du pain, de l’huile, de la farine boulangère, sur place chez les grossistes. La vente se fait en espèce dans sa gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Laidou group is made up of married women who average 45 years of age with four children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioïla, in the Tripano district, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they have restauration activities and sell condiments and clothing. 

The women in the Laidou group are on their 12th group loan and turned to Soro Yiriwaso so that they could satisfy their huge customer demand. 

The customer, Tata, who is standing second from the right in the photo, is uneducated and currently runs a restauration business. She is planning to buy condiments, bread, oil and flour from local wholesalers. She sells her dishes retail in her small café to a diverse customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restauration activity.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LOLO est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de fruits et légume et d’articles divers.                                                            
Les femmes du groupe LOLO sont à leur dix neuvième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente KADIA, première personne à partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter, 1 carton de poissons fumés, 4 cartons de cube Maggi, 3 boites de concentrée de tomate, des sacs de sel et d’oignon chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché journalier  à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Lolo group is made up of married women who average 31 years of age with two children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Konobougou in the Barouéli prefecture, which lies in the Ségou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they sell condiments, fruit and vegetables and other diverse products. 

The women in the Lolo group are on their 19th group loan and turned to Soro Yiriwaso so that they could satisfy their huge customer demand. 

The customer, Kadia, who is on the far left in the photo, is uneducated and currently sells condiments. She is planning to buy one carton of smoked fish, four cartons of Maggi stock cubes, three boxes of tomato concentrate, sacks of salt and onions from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her products retail and for cash from home and at the daily market to a diverse customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Un gallo canta en las primeras horas de la mañana, el aire fresco corre por la cara de Feliciano, quién con mucho ánimo ya le ha dado de comer a las vacas, luego está listo para preparar el terreno de siembra, maíz y frijoles es lo que comercializa. Él tiene 46  años de edad, está casado y tiene tres hijos. Ha sido agricultor por 23 años, actividad que realizar con esmero y dedicación, puesto que de él depende el sustento de una familia, la educación y salud de sus hijos es lo primordial.
El solicita otro crédito para la compra de dos terrenos pequeños, de manera que pueda mejorar las condiciones de cada uno y prepararlo para la cosecha de maíz y frijol. Él está muy agradecido con el primer financiamiento, ya que invirtió en la compra de trigo y frijoles, al mismo tiempo sus ganancias aumentaron. Su esposa es su mano derecha, día a día lo motiva, juntos anhelan un futuro prospero. Uno de los planes futuros de Feliciano es la compra de una camioneta, la cual le facilitaría el transporte de los productos.
texts.en:
A rooster crows in the early hours of the morning and the fresh air flows past Feliciano's face. He has already cheerfully fed the cows and is ready to prepare the ground for sowing seed: corn and beans are the crops he sells. He is 46 years old, married and has three children. He has been a farmer for 23 years, a job he does with care and dedication since his family's livelihood depends on it. The education and health of his children are paramount.

He is asking for another loan in order to buy two small plots of land so that he can improve the condition of each and prepare to harvest corn and beans. He is very grateful for the first funding because he invested it in the purchase of wheat and beans and his profits increased. 

His wife is his right hand; every day she motivates him and together they dream of a prosperous future. One of Feliciano's future plans is to buy a truck, which would make the transport of the products easier.

loans.use: to buy two small pieces of land

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOTALA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kofra Bamana, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de vannes.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe KOTOTALA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente ROKIA, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assis n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de vannes. Elle compte acheter des vannes sur place avec les femmes du village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Dioïla à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Kototala group is made up of married women who verage 43 years of age with five children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kofra Bamana in the Massigui municipality, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they sell cereals and lengths for wickerwork. 

The women in the Kototala group are on their sixth group loan and turned to Soro Yiriwaso so that they could satisfy their huge customer demand. 

The customer, Rokia, who is sitting on the left in the photo, is uneducated and currently sells lengths for wickerwork. She is planning to buy lengths locally from women in the village. She sells them retail and for cash in Dioïla to a diverse customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 17,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy lengths for wickerwork.

loans.name: Keneya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KENEYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kofra Bamana, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de vannes.
Les femmes du groupe KENEYA sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MINATA, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de vanne. Elle compte acheter des vannes sur place avec les femmes du village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché hebdomadaire à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 72 0000 FCFA qui sera en parti réinvesti dans son activité et le reste couvrir ses petites dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The Keneya group is made up of married women who average 44 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kofra Bamana, in the Massigui municipality, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends, and they sell cereals and lengths for wickerwork. 

The women in the Keneya group are on their 22nd group loan and turned to Soro Yiriwaso so that they could satisfy their huge customer demand. These loans will be used to buy the aforementioned products.

The customer, Minata, who is standing on the right in the photo, is uneducated and currently sells lengths for wickerwork. She is planning to buy lengths locally from women in the village. She then sells them retail and for cash at the weekly market to a diverse customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 72,000 FCFA, which will partly be reinvested in her business, with the remainder being used to cover small daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy lengths for wickerwork.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael de 62 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Tiene 7 hijos, los primeros tres no estudiaron, ayudan a trabajar en su casa. Los últimos 4 estudiaron hasta bachillerato por falta de recursos económicos.  Cuatro de ellos ya están acompañados es decir ya viven aparte.


Ismael se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) aprendió el oficio ya que desde pequeño sus padres lo llevaban a trabajar y a dejar almuerzo y como no tenían otra fuente de ingreso se dedicaban a ello, fue así que pudo aprender por esta  actividad productiva, y siempre a sido agricultor. El lugar donde va trabajar le queda a 5 minutos de su casa no tiene que tomar bus ni caminar mucho. Sus dos hijos que viven con el son los que lo apoyan en las actividades agrícolas y normalmente trabajan de 6 am a 1 pm.

Con el financiamiento pretende comprar los insumos agrícolas, para su cultivo dentro de los cuales están: 4 quintales  de fórmula,, 6 quintales de sulfato, 2 litros de herbicidas. Además pagara mano de obra para que le ayuden a preparar el terreno donde va sembrar. Será satisfecha la necesidad de poder comprar todos los insumos ya que sin el financiamiento no se le hace nada fácil poder comprarlos.

Los sueños de Ismael son trabajar fuerte la agricultura, sacar buena producción y si es posible vender parte de la cosecha y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, el préstamo le ayudara ya que no hay muchas instituciones que den financiamientos tan fácilmente.
texts.en:
Ismael is 62 years old and studied as far as the second grade. He is married and his wife does the household tasks. He has seven children. The first three didn't go to school, and they help with the work at home. The last four studied as far as high school, due to lack of economic resources. Four of them are now married, so they live away from home. 

Ismael works planting basic grains (corn and beans). He learned it from when he was young and his parents brought him to work and to have lunch, and as they had no other source of income, he did this work. He was able to learn through this productive activity, and has always been a farmer. The place where he works is five minutes from his house; he doesn't have to take the bus or walk very far. His two children who live with him support him in the farming work, and they usually work from 6AM to 1PM.

With the loan he plans to buy agricultural supplies for his crop, including four quintals of fertilizer, six quintals of sulfate, and two liters of herbicides. He will also pay workers to help him prepare the land where he is going to plant. This will satisfy his need to be able to buy all the supplies, since without the loan it is quite difficult for him to buy them.

Ismael's dreams are to work hard as a farmer, to produce well and, if possible, sell a part of the harvest and give his children a better quality of life. The loan will help him, as there are not many institutions that give loans so easily.

loans.use: to buy four quintals of fertilizer, six quintals of sulfate, and two liters of herbicides, as well as to pay hired hands to help him prepare the land where he is going to plant.

loans.name: Marelis

texts.es:
Marelis es una mujer de 47 años que ha trabajado gran parte de su vida para conseguir el sustento de su hogar, tiene un hijo pequeño por el cual hace hasta lo imposible por su bienestar.
Ella tiene un pequeño salón de belleza ubicado en la sala de su propia casa, desde allí ofrece distintos servicio como cortes, cepillados y spa de uñas, entre otros.
Es un negocio pequeño pero muy apasionante para ella, pues con gran dedicación se capacito emprendió su propio negocio.
Las cosas no han sido fáciles para esta mujer y ha tenido que soportar muchas cosas en su vida, pasando por trabajos muy poco remunerados y bastante arduos.
Hoy en día está dedicada en pleno a su actividad y desea ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por esta razón quiere adecuar un espacio que tiene en su casa para este fin, pero para esto necesita algunos elementos para su arreglo como pinturas, resanes y materiales de construcción.
Esto le permitirá atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera, más cómoda e higiénica.
Ella sueña con tener un gran salón de belleza donde pueda generar nuevos empleos.
texts.en:
Marelis is 47 years old and has spent a large part of her life working in order to support her household. Marelis has a young son for whom she does whatever she can to look after his well-being.

Marelis owns a small beauty parlour in the living room of her own home. There she offers different services such as haircuts, nail treatments and more.

This is small business but Marelis is passionate about it. With a lot of dedication she did training to start her own business.

Things have not been easy for Marelis and she has had to put up with a lot of things in her life. She has done many low-paying and difficult jobs.

Today Marelis is completely dedicated to her work, and wants to offer better service to her customers. To do this, she wants to set up a space in her house for her customers. For this work, she needs to buy a few items such as paint, building materials and more.

This work will allow Marelis to serve her customers better, and in a more comfortable and more hygienic space-

Marelis' dream is to have a large beauty parlour where she can generate jobs for others.

loans.use: to set up a space in her home to start a business and buy paints, building materials and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: María Donila

texts.es:
María, estudio hasta 1er año de bachillerato, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, la 1ro estudia 5to grado, la 2da estudia  parvularia  y la 3raq que aún no estudia por su edad. Con ella viven sus hermanas y su madre.


   La señora se dedica a trabajar como encargada de farmacia en la unidad de salud, ella trabaja en el programa de fosalud. Tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, estaba desempleada y al ser seleccionada para la plaza la capacitaron fue así como aprendió a realizar el trabajo. Por el momento no tiene otra actividad productiva más que la siembra de granos básicos. Antes solo ayuda a sus padres en los oficios del hogar. El lugar donde trabaja le queda a un km y se transporta a pie. El horario de trabajo es de 8 am a 4 pm.

  Con el financiamiento comprara todos los insumos para la siembra de los granos básicos, entre los cuales están. Tres quintales de fórmula, cuatro quintales de sulfato, los insecticiditas y herbicidas, también pagara parte del crédito que tiene vigente. El crédito ayudara a comprar lo necesario ya que en otros años lo ha podido sembrar la misma cantidad que pretende sembrar hoy todo por la falta de una oportunidad.

El sueño de ella, es encontrar un mejor empleo que le ajuste para cubrir todas las demandas de su hogar, también ayudar a sus hijos para que no se queden sin estudiar. Por otra parte, quiere tener una mejor vivienda para poder vivir más cómoda con sus hijos.
texts.en:
María studied up to the first year of higher secondary education, she is single and has three, the first of who is studying 5th grade, the second is in kindergarten and the third who is not yet studying because of her young age. María lives together with her sisters and her mother.

María makes her living as a pharmacy assistant in a healthcare unit, working in the health solidarity fund (Fosalud) program. She has been performing this activity for six years, and once hired for the post, she was training and this was how she learned to perform the work. For the moment, she doesn't have another type of trade activity other than that of sowing bulk grains. Beforehand she simply helped her parents with the household chores. Her workplace is one kilometer away and she gets there on food. She works from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.

With the financing, she will buy all the supplies to sow bulk grains from among which are: three quintals (around 120 kg) of formula, four quintals (around 170 kg) of sulfate, insecticides and herbicides. She will also pay for part of the loan that is in progress. The loan will help her to buy what is needed to as in previous years she was unable to sow the same quantity that she wants to sow today due to a lack of opportunities.

Maria dreams of finding a better job that will fit with all the needs of her home, as well as to help her children so that they do not go without studying. Moreover, she wants to have a better home to be able to live more comfortably with her children.

loans.use: to buy three quintals of formula, four quintals of sulfate, insecticides and herbicides as well as to pay part of the loan that is in progress.

loans.name: Hilda Rosario
