texts.es: Rosario es una chica soltera vive con sus padres y con sus 3 hermanos, ella tiene 20 años, se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace un año cuando Fodemi le otorgo el primer crédito y le fue muy bien, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar su negocio, su aspiración es mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos para comprar una maquina de cocer ropa para ponerse un local de prendas de vestir ya que ella estudio en un colegio de corte y confección.
texts.en: Rosario is a single girl who lives with her parents and her 3 siblings. She is 20 years old who, for the last year, has been rearing chicken when Fodemi granted her the first loan and it went very well. This loan will be invested in the purchase of chicken to expand the business. Rosario dreams of improving the business and growing the sales to buy a sewing machine to set up a clothes shop as she studied in a dressmaking college.

loans.use: to buy chicken.

loans.name: Yesika Yulieth

texts.es: Yesika es una hermosa mujer de 24 años de edad soltera que piensa en un futuro ya que quiere establecer un negocio prospero antes de pensar en una familia vie actualmente con su familia y se ha desempeñado como trabajadora en diferentes tiendas hasta que comenzó a formar su propio negocio surtiéndolo poco a poco hasta transformarlo en una muy completo tienda de abarrotes a la que quiere incluirle legumbres y otra variedad de refrescos por lo que necesita un crédito para la compra de granos, refrescos con los que quiere fortalecer el negocio su gran sueño es ir transformando su tienda poco a poco en un autoservicio ir paso a paso hasta llegar a tener un mercado completo en el cual se sigan las políticas de su tienda; humildad, respeto y buen trato al cliente sabe que es una tarea difícil pero con la ayuda de dios la puede lograr pues inicio con un surtido muy básico y hoy en día es una de las tiendas más completos del sector. Yesika tiene muy claro que para alcanzar un sueño lo primero que hay que hacer es precisamente eso soñar lo y nada más fuerte que la determinación de una mujer para alcanzar un logro y ella tiene muy claro que lo va alcanzar con esfuerzo y humildad
texts.en: Yesika is a beautiful 24-year-old woman. She is single and thinks about the future, which is why she wants to start a prosperous business before thinking about having a family. Yesika currently lives with her family and was working in different shops. She then started to set up her own business, gradually stocking it up until she had a full grocery store. She now also wants to start selling vegetables and more soft drinks. She needs a loan in order to buy stock such as grains, drinks, and groceries to strengthen her business. Yesika's big dream is to gradually turn her shop into a self-service store and, little by little, to have a full market with a policy of humility, respect and good customer service. Yesika knows that this is a difficult task but, with God's help, she can do it. She started with very basic stock and now has one of the best-stocked shops in the area. Yesika knows very well that, in order to achieve her dream, the first thing she must do is have that dream and the strong determination to realise it. Yesika knows that she will reach her dreams with efforts and humility.

loans.use: to buy stock such as grains, drinks, and groceries to strengthen her business.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta 3°er grado de educación básica, ella es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y viven con ella en su casa,  ellos trabajan en la agricultura, ellos son los que trabajan para ella, y también los que dependen de ella.

María se dedica al cuido de animales domésticos, los cuales son cerdos y gallinas, ella tiene 15 años de dedicase a este negocio,  ya que sus padres desde pequeña le han enseñado a este trabajo. Ella se dedica también al trabajo de la agricultura, y su horario es de 7 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 5 cerdos, 25 quintales  de harinilla, vitaminas y antibióticos,

Ella a futuro desea tener un crianza de cerdos que le permita tener ingresos constantemente, para ayudar a su familia, y poderlos sacar adelante y tener un estilo de vida mejor.
texts.en:
María is 62 years old and completed up to third grade at school. María is a single mother to three children who live at home. The children work in farming - they work for her - and depend on their mother.

María works looking after pigs and hens. She has had this business for 15 years as, from a young age, her parents taught her this trade. María also works in farming. She works from 7 a.m. until 12 noon.

This loan will be used to buy five pigs, 25 hundredweights of flour, vitamins and antibiotics.

In the future, María would like to raise enough pigs in order to have a constant income to help her family and to help them to get ahead and have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy five pigs, 25 hundredweights of flour, vitamins and antibiotics.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 29 years old and married with two children.

Alona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Alona has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Alona aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Susan has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Susan has taken a 5500 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Susan is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jhoanalyn

texts.en:
Jhoanalyn is 28 years old and she has three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jhoanalyn's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jhoanalyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jhoanalyn has taken a 9000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jhoanalyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia is a 41-year-old married woman. She and her husband have been successfully running a small general store at the corner of their house. She has a good client list, and earns sufficient income to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of further expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been helping in her husband's business of furniture making. The man shown in the photo is Robina's husband. They have been doing the business together for many years. Over time they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of five children and provides them with the basic necessities of life. 

In order to purchase good quality wood with the packs of polish and nails in larger quantities, she applied for a loan of 60,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation. This way they will be able to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Robina dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of good quality wood and packs of polish and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic manure and cocoa plants.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 44-year-old married woman that describes herself as successful.  She has 5 children ranging in age from 5 years to 20 years.  For 7 years she has operated a retail business where she sells clothes.  Her business is located in a suitable location and her primary customers are the general public. 

Regina describes her biggest business challenge to be high transport costs and taxation rates.  She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothing stock.  Her future business goal is to be a successful wholesaler within 5 years.  This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, with the previous loan repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more clothing stock.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman with two children. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics. Susan has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a viable location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add additional stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business and happy family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 27 years old and married with one child. Jane works very hard to provide for them.  Jane's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jane has restarted her buisness and now needs to provide her family with a safe shelter.

Jane has taken a PHP 8000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jane is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa de 58 años de edad, no estudio, padece de una enfermedad, sus hijos trabajan  pero tienen sus propios hogares aparte. Viven cinco nietos con ella, anteriormente ella tejía petates para vender desde los cuarenta y cinco años,  pero ya no siguió  tejiendo debido a que el polvo del tule le provoca la enfermedad.
 El crédito lo utilizara para comprar 12 maletas de tule para hacer petates, todo el invierno ella piensa que con el crédito se le ayudara mucho pues con el dinero podrá obtener el material para empezar a trabajar nuevamente, ella cree que con el dinero que invertirá en el material podrá obtener mayores ingresos al vender los petates  y podrá darle a sus nietos una mayor comodidad, los ingresos que ella obtiene, los invierte en comprar más materiales para seguir haciendo petates y en la alimentación de sus nietos y de ella misma.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 58, did not study, she suffers from an illness, her children work but do not have their own separate homes. Five grandchildren live with her, previously she wove sleeping bags to sell at the age of 40-50 years old, but she no longer weaves given that the dust from the tule reeds brought on the illness. 

Tomasa will use the loan to buy 12 cases of tule reeds to make sleeping bags, during the whole of winter she thinks that the loan will help her a lot as with the money she will be able to buy the material to start working once again. She believes that with the money invested in the material, she will be able to obtain better sales by selling the sleeping bags and she will be able to give her grandchildren a better level of comfort. With the income that she obtains, Tomasa invests in the purchase of more materials to continue making sleeping bags and in food for her grandchildren and herself.

loans.use: to buy 12 cases of tule reeds to make sleeping mats.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 46-year-old married woman. For about nine years, she has been working doing hand embroidery. Zubaida makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to build a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. Zubaida is in her fourth loan cycle and she has a good credit history.

Zubaida is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. She will use her loan to help her to continue her operations. In this way, Zubaida will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by reaching more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José es un hombre de 35 años de edad que se desempeña como trabajar en una finca de cultivo de plátano pero hace 22 meses comenzó con un negocio propio y alquilo un billar con el que ha podido aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia constituida por su pareja y un hijo de 12 años, este proyecto lo inicio con la ilusión de progresar de dejar atrás ese trabajo en la finca, con el pensamiento de que podía mejorar su condiciones actuales y no conforme con ser mandado quería ser su propio jefe no rendir cuentas poder administrar un lugar con los valores y criterios que él considera apropiados. Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas, aguardiente y ron con el que esperar generar un mejor ambiente trayendo al billar estos elementos que lo hacen tan atractivo dado que piensa que nada mejor que jugarse una partida con un buen amigo disfrutando de una refrescante cerveza su gran aspiración es que en un futuro pueda tener un local propio para darle la mejor calidad de vida a su mujer y su hijo
texts.en:
José is a 35-year-old man who makes him living working in a field of banana trees but 22 months ago he set up his own business and rents a billiard room with which he has been able to improve the quality of life of his family made up of his partner and their 12-year-old son. 

He started this project with the aim of progressing, to leave behind work in the fields, with the idea that he could improve his current conditions and that he wasn't happy about being managed: he wanted to be his own boss, to not have to report to anyone to run a place, and to use the values and criteria that he considers appropriate. 

José is seeking the loan to buy drinks such as fizzy drinks, beers, liquor and rum with which he hopes to create a better ambiance providing the billiards room with those elements that make it so attractive given that he thinks that there is nothing better than playing a match with a good friend, enjoying a refreshing beer with his great aspiration that in the future he will be able to have his own premises to give his wife and son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy drinks and spruce up his self-owned pool hall!

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 2 grado de educación básica,  por motivos de escasos recursos económicos él no pudo continuar sus estudios. esta acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  tiene 5 hijos 3 viven con él en la casa que están estudiando en la escuela. 

Carlos tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la artesanía de las hamacas, ya que de esta trabajo es como él se gana la  vida constantemente y de donde obtiene sus ingresos, él decidió por este negocio, ya que se obtiene algunos ingresos para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

También se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, el trabajo lo realiza en su casa, y trabaja de 6 de la mañana a 2 de la tarde en la elaboración de las hamacas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, para cultivar maíz  ya que ya comenzó la temporada agrícola y comprara 5 sacos de fertilizante, una bolsa de semilla de maíz y  pago de mano de obra


sus sueños para su familia es tener una buena producción de maíz y darle un buen manejo adecuada para  obtener una abundante cosecha, así tener alimentación para su familia lo suficiente, y para darles una buena dieta alimenticia, y con la parte que le sobra lo venderá para obtener algunos sus ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos is 39 years old and studied up to the second form of primary school. Due to his family's financial situation, he was not able to attend school any further. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household. They have 5 children, 3 of whom live with them in their house and go to school. Carlos has been an artisan for 20 years : he weaves traditional hammocks. This is his main source of income, the one that enables him to support his family. He is also a farmer. His weaving is done at home from 6 in the morning to 2 in the afternoon. He asks for a loan in order to buy farming supplies so as to grow sweetcorn, which is in season. He will buy 5 sacks of fertiliser and a bag of sweetcorn seeds, and will also hire farm hands. He wants his family to have enough food and benefit from a balanced diet, and therefore wishes for a plentiful harvest that would repay the trouble he takes in caring for the crops. His idea is to sell what exceeds their needs in order to make a small profit.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and hire farm hands.

loans.name: Wisdom Group

texts.en:
Mohammed is a father of one child who is still in school. He is in his late twenties and is married. For five years now, Mohammed has been selling televisions, decoders and other accessories. He does business from 7 am to 9 pm every workday, and is able to make a fairly good monthly profit.

This will be his third loan request from ID-Ghana. He used the previous loans to buy more televisions, decoders and other accessories to resell. Mohammed has paid back the earlier loans successfully. He used his business profits to cover school fees and home food expenses and also saved in accordance with his business plan. With his new loan, he will buy televisions, decoders and other accessories for his business. Mohammed dreams of making his family's life better. 

Mohammed will share this loan with his colleague, Nii. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy televisions, decoders and other accessories for his business.

loans.name: Allah  Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 30-year-old, dedicated, married woman. She has had a hand-embroidery business for many years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best at earning resources in her household.

She is a mother of five children. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand. She expects boosts in her earnings and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with ten children. For the past 15 years, he has operated a business where he sells building stones. Joseph describes himself as focused. His business is located in a profitable location and his biggest business challenge is the lack of capital. 

Joseph is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of building stones. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. Joseph’s business goal is to be successful within five years and he hopes to be stable in the future.

loans.use: buy more building stones

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell, and he has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cooking jikos and restaurant seats. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more cooking jikos and restaurant seats

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a profitable area and his primary customers are local residents. He identifies his biggest business challenge as being lack of capital. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil and other items.

Tony's business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be stable. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Avilina

texts.en:
Avilina is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Avilina's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Avilina has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Avilina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 43 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Jessica works very hard to provide for them. Jessica's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jessica is requesting a 6,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She will use her loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Jessica is committed to rebuild her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 47 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rebecca has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Rebecca has taken out an 8,500 Philippine peso housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rebecca is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
Bernaditha is 55 years old, married and has three children.  She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Bernaditha is requesting a housing loan for Php 10000, to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Bernaditha has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her business.

With your help, Bernaditha can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of their family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Roselene

texts.en:
Roselene is 36 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Roselene works very hard to provide for them.

Roselene's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home.

Roselene is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Michelle will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock in order to raise and resell them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock to raise and resell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 62 years old and married with eleven children, one of whom is in school, Adelina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Adelina has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana, age 40, is a married woman. She has been providing laundry services.  Her husband, who is also shown in the photo is in the business with her. She makes enough through her business to bear her household expenditures. Over time she has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and has attained a regular list of customers. To meet the orders of her customers, she needs to purchase a new dryer machine and packs of washing powder and detergents. For this reason, she sought a loan of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new dryer machine and packs of washing powder and detergent.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is 50 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Astghik has the specialty of accountant, but she never worked as an accountant. She works at the gas station as an inspector. Her husband is in a trading business. They have a son, who works in Russian Federation, and a daughter, who is already married and lives separately with her family.

Astghik, working very hard with her husband for years, has managed to save some money, which they used on repairing their house. Most of the work is over except for some details for which they have no money any more. Astghik hopes that with finishing repairs to their house their son will come back from abroad and finally get married. Astghik just dreams of the day when she will have grandchildren, which will make her life happier, brighter and more meaningful.

Astghik asks for a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams in order to finally finish the repairing of their house.

loans.use: finally to finish the repairing of her house

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush lives in the village Tsovagyugh in Gegharkunik region. She is a perfect farmer and has been engaged in it very seriously since she was young girl. Hranush now lives alone; her son works and lives in the Russian Federation. The region where Hranush lives is very famous for its rest houses, and for many years Harnush worked simultaneously in several rest houses as a cleaner. But now her occupation is only farming.

On her farm, Hranush has 5 cows, 2 calves, 2 heifers, 2 bulls, 2 pigs and 15 sheep. She says she never has lack of work or time to get tired on her farm, since only every day hard work brings good results in the form of income, she says it inspires her to go on. She also has a plot of land on which she cultivates potatos of a perfect sort which she sells to re-sellers. Hranush also sells milk, macun (Armenian national dairy-product), cheese and meat at the city's wholesale market. 

Hranush has decided to make her farm bigger, to buy one more cow, and also to provide her farm cattle with more fodder, so she asks for this loan in order to realize her plans.

loans.use: to make her farm bigger, to buy one more cow, and also to provide her farm cattle with more fodder

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children.

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of their household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her area. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 30 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for 2 years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Nadia was not earning income, her family went through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family. She felt obligated to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. She has since attracted a good number of customers. 

To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of different colored thread and packs of zippers and buttons to meet her increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to cover personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different colored thread and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Sajjida

texts.en:
Sajjida is 51-year-old lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds Sajjida is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good credit history.

Sajjida is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. She hopes to expand her business and dreams of providing a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Altaaf

texts.en: Altaaf is a 32-year-old, determined lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan is a 37-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Rasheedan makes enough to provide for her family. 

Rasheedan is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan to fully stock her store and buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet her increasing demand. Rasheedan will use some of the profit from her loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 42 year old vigorous lady, who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people in her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers.  For this reason she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues, so she will be able to generate a healthier source of income. This is her 5th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is 43 years old, married woman. She is the mother of five children. For 15 years, Khursheed has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected at home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. This is her 7th loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also show in the photo) at the corner of her house. She has 8 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of 2 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Frazana

texts.en: Frazana is 37 years old,  a married woman and a mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Frazana’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning effectively. For this reason, Frazana has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Frazana hopes and believes that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 45, is a married woman.  She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Nasreen needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: El Progreso De La Amistad Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso De La Amistad” está conformada por 05 socios responsables. Este es el caso de Sara de 42 años soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Se siente feliz pues cada vez tiene una mejor calidad de vida. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos, casacas, camisas y pantalones. El anhelo de Sara es de seguir mejorando su negocio. El grupo “El Progreso De La Amistad” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Sara se encuentra sentada, es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo rosado.
texts.en: "El Progreso De La Amistad” communal bank is formed by 5 responsible members. Sara is 42 years old and single. She sells clothing articles. She feels happy because she is improving her quality of life. This time she requested a loan to buy t shirts, jackets, shirts and pants. Sara's wish is to keep improving her business. The group "El Progreso De La Amistad"  is grateful to Kiva for the given help. On the picture Sara is shown sitting down; she is the third on the left, wearing a pink t shirt.

loans.use: To buy t shirts, jackets, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: 02130402 - Thôn 6 - Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ does fish farming. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Huệ has been involved in this business for nine years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Huệ is 30 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Huệ is the group leader of the 02130402 - Thôn 6 - Xã Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Huệ hopes to buy a motorbike, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, feed them, and sell them.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 21-year-old Lebanese married woman with one child who has been working in the agriculture sector for six years to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is a very hard worker and does not tire of work, always aiming to develop it. 

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy new agriculture requisites for her business in order to increase productivity and enhance her income. Fatmeh insists that she will be a permanent customer in order to always be able to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy new agriculture requisites.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 47 years old and married with two children.

Leonida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, coffee, noodles, cereals, etc. to sell.

Leonida has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Leonida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, coffee, noodles, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 60 years old and widowed with seven children. 

Julita is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Julita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Julita has been in pig fattening for 43 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra works hard to support her family. Pedra is married and has a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines.

Pedra requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more nipa roofing to sell.

Pedra has been in this business for 11 years now.

Pedra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina works hard to support her family. Marcelina is married and has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marcelina has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling of personal collection products. Milagros is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream vending business

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 28 years old and married. She has two children who are in school.

Ma. Cecilia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is 44 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Lucina is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Lucina has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming corn, electronic mobile load retailing, and direct selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 24 years old and has a live-in partner with two children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melinda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas.

Melinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda works hard to support her family. Criselda is married and has a buy-and-sell crab business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more crabs to sell.

Criselda has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, Criselda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to sell

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is single and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Jessa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

Jessa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jessa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables and spices for her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by duck-raising in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

Maricel has been duck-raising for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a banana-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell for her banana-vending business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for eight years. Elizabeth earns more income from buying and selling firewood.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 42 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Bernadeth has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling crabs.

Bernadeth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also helps her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and healthcare. 

Razia wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Lusya

texts.en:
Lusya lives in the village Zovaber in Gegharkunik region. Now she lives alone since her husband is in the Russian Federation where he does different construction work. Lusya used to work as a cook at the kindergarten but for 16 years already, farming and agriculture are the only occupation that she is engaged in. She does everything alone but with great pleasure and care.

 In her farm she has two cows, a calf, eight sheep, five lambs and 25 chickens. On her plot of land she cultivates mainly potatoes and greens. From her farm she sells milk, eggs and meat. She likes her occupation very much and she wants to make her farm bigger and more substantial with additional farm animals.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy a cow and also some animal fodder for her farm cattle. She has a lot of plans and she greatly needs this support.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 21-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and one child. Her husband is the main income provider for the family. Zahraa has been working in the agriculture sector for the past seven years in order to earn extra income and be able to support her family financially. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting for her farming business. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. She is certain that with the new seeds and seedlings, she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is a 24-year-old Lebanese single woman. She has worked as a private teacher since 2009. She chooses this profession because she feels that she is helping students to get the needed education. She has arranged a special room in her house where she receives her students and equipped it with required materials and supplies. 

Today, Rajaa is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop to help her in her work and to improve her teaching skills. She is very optimistic about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is a 57-year-old Lebanese married woman with two children who has been working for nine years in the agriculture sector. She likes her occupation so much because she likes to feel her independence. Her husband has his own business as a clothing trader, and they cooperate to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses.

Today, Aliya is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds for her business in order to improve it. She is very positive about her future and wishes to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for her business.
